placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed at Taj Bentota Resort & Spa in June and was thoroughly impressed. The beachfront location is stunning, offering panoramic ocean views and peaceful surroundings. The grounds are beautifully maintained, and the tropical gardens add to the calm and private atmosphere.

Rooms are spacious, clean, and tastefully furnished. I had a sea-facing balcony which was perfect for enjoying the early mornings and sunsets. Housekeeping was prompt and professional throughout my stay.

The service stood out—staff were warm, courteous, and genuinely attentive. From check-in to departure, everything was handled with care and professionalism.

The food was excellent. The breakfast buffet had great variety, and the quality of ingredients was high. I also enjoyed dining in the other on-site restaurants, which offered both Sri Lankan and international dishes.

The pool area was peaceful, clean, and well-managed. I also visited the spa, which offered a very relaxing and well-executed treatment.

Despite visiting during the off-season, the resort operated smoothly, with no compromise on service or amenities.

Overall: A beautiful, well-run property that delivers on comfort, service, and location. Would definitely return and recommend to others looking for a relaxing coastal getaway in Sri Lanka.
title: One of the best I have ever stayed in my entire lifetime!

My friend’s family recently stayed at Taj Bentota Resort & Spa and had a truly wonderful experience. The resort’s location is absolutely stunning, with the beach right in front — perfect for a peaceful and relaxing getaway.

They found the rooms to be spacious, clean, and very comfortable. What really impressed them was the quality of the food — from breakfast to lunch, every meal was fresh, delicious, and consistently excellent.

They spoke very highly of the warm hospitality they received, especially from Mr. Damith and Mr. Ravindra, who made them feel welcome and ensured every detail was taken care of. Mr. Harith offered exceptional buffet service, with everything perfectly timed and arranged. Mr. Asiri was also very helpful and attentive throughout their stay.

They were especially thankful to Chef Pramesh Gawda, who personally checked in with them, ensured the food met their preferences, and even arranged special dishes tailored to their tastes. His dedication to making their dining experience memorable really stood out.

Overall, they described it as one of the best family getaways they’ve had — thanks to the beautiful setting, amazing service, and outstanding food.

From the moment we sat down, his attention to detail and genuine care were evident. He personally explained each dish, ensuring our dietary preferences were respected without compromising on taste. The butter chicken melted in the mouth, the biryani was fragrant and layered with perfection, and the homemade chutneys were a revelation. It felt like we were guests in his home rather than diners at a table. Truly unforgettable!

text:
We had a truly wonderful stay at Fox Jaffna (formerly known by its previous names), and everything about our visit exceeded expectations.

From the moment we arrived, the service was warm and personal. Scoty from the F&B team made us feel at home, always welcoming us with a smile and personally ensuring all our requests were taken care of.

A highlight of our trip was the food. Chef Pushpendran is an incredibly talented chef—if you're looking to experience the true taste of Jaffna cuisine, he’s the one to meet. Every dish was full of authentic flavor and beautifully prepared.

Sanjeewa at Reception was another standout. Always cheerful and helpful, he assisted with all our needs and even took the time to share some fascinating local stories that added a personal touch to our experience.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Jaffna. We look forward to returning!
title: Exceptional Stay with Warm Hospitality and Authentic Jaffna Flavors!

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Prearrival (10/10)
Our recent stay at Cape Weligama was truly something special. After reaching out directly to the Resplendent Properties reservations team, we were set up with an incredible package for our four-night stay in a Prestige Villa during the shoulder season in May. Their promptness and professionalism, ensuring all our queries (including airport transfers) were handled within 24 hours, really impressed us from the start.

Arrival & First Impressions (10/10)
Landing in Colombo, we were quickly greeted by a hotel representative who guided us to our ride – a surprisingly spacious 10-seater Toyota Hiace. I'll admit, when the concierge first mentioned it was their only transport option, I was a bit skeptical, but boy was I wrong! This vehicle was pristinely maintained with plush seats, and our chauffeur, Harish, made the 2.5-hour journey incredibly comfortable. Most of it was smooth expressway driving, with only the final 20 minutes navigating the charming, narrow, twisting roads of Weligama town.

Stepping into the resort, we immediately felt that sense of minimalistic warmth and remote luxury. The front desk team, led by Salman, was lightning-fast with our check-in. Salman then took us on a wonderful buggy tour of the resort, giving us a perfect orientation before showing us to our stunning villa.

Location & Design (9/10)
Cape Weligama truly boasts the best location in Weligama, perched dramatically on a cliff overlooking the vast Indian Ocean. The resort's design, courtesy of renowned Thai architect Lek Bunnang, immediately reminded us of the Four Seasons Langkawi, albeit without the Moroccan touches. There's a beautiful prevalence of dark wood throughout, complemented by his signature purple wall in the main restaurant, which adds a distinct character. With just 30 villas and suites, the resort feels wonderfully intimate and compact. Just a heads-up: the path to the family pool and kids' club can be quite a steep decline, but buggies are always readily available to whisk you around.

Our Prestige Villa (9/10)
Our recently refurbished Prestige Villa was a dream at 180 sqm, offering supreme comfort for two adults and our daughter. It opened into a separate, inviting living area complete with a chaise, work desk, a fully stocked minibar, and a TV. This led seamlessly into the bedroom, featuring a king-sized bed with just the right level of softness, and another TV.

From the bedroom, you step into a walk-in wardrobe, which then opens into a huge, luxurious bathroom. It boasted a twin vanity, a lovely free-standing bath, and separate toilet and rain shower, which even had a sauna – a delightful surprise! The bath amenities were natural and custom-made with intriguing local spicy fragrances.

One of the highlights was the enormous outdoor seating area connected to our villa – it was absolutely perfect for a peaceful al fresco dinner. But the real star was the semi-private pool, shared between just 3 villas. Since it was the shoulder season, we practically had this huge pool all to ourselves, and our daughter couldn't get enough of it! The only minor points preventing a perfect score were the occasional dripping sound on the AC outdoor unit when it rained, which could be a bit disruptive, and the water temperature in the bathroom being a little erratic at times.

Service & Amenities (8/10)
The team at Cape Weligama, despite being fairly new, radiated a wonderful sense of warm, personalized service. Achal and the entire housekeeping team did a magnificent job, keeping our villa spotless whenever we popped out for breakfast. The kids' club staff, particularly Nithmi, were truly awesome – our daughter had a blast.

The concierge gave us a brilliant recommendation to visit Hiriketiya for sunset and check out Smoke & Bitter, a bar voted among Asia's top 50. And wow, did we have a fantastic time there! The family pool and beach shack were undergoing renovations during our visit, but they thoughtfully opened the magnificent Moon Pool for families, where we spent a good amount of time, with Kavindu always attentive to our needs. The on-site boutique, selling charming locally-made cotton clothes and Dilmah teas and spices, is a lovely spot to pick up some authentic Sri Lankan souvenirs.

However, there were a couple of areas that could see improvement. The gym, located beneath the main pool, had a distinct musty smell that made me feel slightly sick after about 30 minutes – definitely something they should look into. Another minor point, for a boutique property of this caliber, was the somewhat limited interaction with the management during our stay.

Dining (10/10)
Simply outstanding! We ended up having most of our meals right at the resort, and every single one was a delight. The Restaurant serves breakfast (a wonderful mix of local and continental à la carte options), lunch, afternoon tea, and dinner. We feasted on loads of Sri Lankan Appa and curries, primarily sticking to the incredibly fresh, domestically sourced seafood. The service was personal and attentive, with Wishwa, Ramesh, Anjana, Nethmi, and Rusith taking wonderful care of us. On our last night, we tried Tableau for dinner, where Chef Dulitha put on a spectacular show with his innovative fusion Sri Lankan cuisine. A true culinary highlight!

Departure (9/10)
Checkout was efficient and seamless, and our excellent chauffeur Harish was there to drive us back to the airport. My only small suggestion would be to reconsider asking guests to fill out the survey right then and there. Perhaps asking the previous night or sending a link later would be a more relaxed approach.

Value for Money (10/10)
At around $500++ per night for our villa, you honestly couldn't ask for more. Even their peak season prices of $1000 seem entirely justified for the exceptional level of property and experience you get.

Probability of Revisiting (10/10)
Without a shadow of a doubt, we will be back! There is truly nothing that comes close to Cape Weligama in Sri Lanka, or even in India, in terms of its unique charm, luxury, and setting. With passionate owners like the Dilmah Group behind it, I can only see this resort growing further and returning to its previous glory, or even surpassing it, very soon.
title: Cape Weligama: A Slice of Cliffside Paradise in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
thank you for your wonderful review and for the shout out to my passionate team including Salman! Delighted that you enjoyed the food and accommodation. Since Cape Weligama reopened in January after a renovation, we’ve received fantastic guest feedback - clearly we’ve done something right! Thanks again and safe trip home. 

warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The sharing pool for villas is a natural pool and isn’t heated… not for the warm water seekers.
text:
This hotel has to be one of if not the best one so far! From the attention of the staff to the taste of the food and the beauty of the environment around… spectacular is not enough to describe it. 

The check in process was very welcoming and pleasant. The staff were friendly and warm… the Resident Manager shared his contact and ensured any matter would be taken care of if needed. One particular staff I’m grateful for is (Salman) who was helpful with every request. This may sound hysterical but he was genuinely working hard everywhere at every time. Even though he’s working tirelessly day and night, he never said no to any request and actually did everything in his power to coordinate with the rest of the team and ensure every need was met. 

Even though there was no buffet for breakfast, the menu covered almost every type of food. For shorter stays, every item will surely not be covered. The taste and presentation of the food was beautifully executed as well. From the western dishes to the authentic Sri Lankan ones, it was truly remarkable. The usually overlooked bread basket was also splendid; special shoutout to one of the crispiest croissants ever!

The villas were also very cozy and beautifully designed to give it a nice touch of tradition whilst portraying the naturalistic theme the entire hotel is built upon. The Prestige Villa definitely weakened the competition and this was evident upon arrival at the next resort on this trip. 

All in all, if an all rounded experience is what’s needed, this is the place to visit. Definitely recommending for a hearty experience!
title: Luxurious service within majestic nature!

text:
An unforgettable dining experience at Tableau, Cape Weligama.
The menu offers a unique and thoughtful blend of local and international flavours that truly impressed us. It was exciting to see how each dish brought together ingredients in a creative way.

Some standout favourites included the starters featuring local mackerel, a flavourful soup, and a delicious kohila dip. The mains were equally impressive—the steak was cooked to perfection, and the cassava and coconut blend was a surprising highlight. It’s now our favourite alternative to mashed potatoes!

Every course was beautifully presented and well-executed, making this one of the most memorable meals we've had.
title: Dining experience at Tableau, Cape Weligama

text: Cape Welligama offers an amazing experience. From its beautiful views and exceptional service, it's hard to top for a relaxing getaway. A special mention also has to be made of its incredible infinity "Moonpool." Quite simply, one of the most spectacular I've seen anywhere. There's also a beautiful large pool more suitable for families. The rooms are incredibly comfortable with solid air conditioning and oodles of amenities. There are several secluded lookouts that let you enjoy the views with more privacy. As an added bonus, the resort also has a fair share of wildlife, including birds, monkeys, and monitor lizards which you're likely to run across. Overall, a great choice for upscale lodging in the Welligama area.
title: Great Views. Exceptional Service. Don't Miss the Infinity Pool.

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you so much for your fantastic review and for thoroughly detailing your 'extraordinary' experience with us at Cape Weligama. It makes what we do so much more enjoyable and really makes our day!

 It is especially heartening that our team made your experience that much better- from the spa to your culinary experiences.

We hope to welcome you again in the future!
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
I’m not someone who often writes reviews. But my partner and I felt this place was truly an out of ordinary on several levels. I wanted to write this for others as I myself was unsure before booking it. But also as a reflection on an experience I won’t ever forget. 

We came to Sri Lanka because we wanted a luxurious break with some natural exploration and cultural exploration. My partner had been to India. I’ve spent time in Thailand and Indonesia for work and pleasure. I’ve stayed in seaside shacks I loved, airbnb and vrbo rooms and villas, boutique hotels and mandarin oriental /four seasons resorts in the past in my travels across the world. 

Arriving in Colombo - it’s worth paying for the expedited immigration- not at all necesssry but it was nice. We spent the night at a place near the airport as we arrived after midnight- cheap and cheerful and clean. We had arranged a driver for the whole trip (which is normal for Sri Lanka - they quote an all inclusive price including driver’s accomodation). A dedicated driver was the same price as airport hotel transfers and inter property transfers and gives you flexibility and a bit of a guide. Some drivers steer you towards places where they get commissions as is normal - so be aware. 

We took local roads to cape Weligama and with lunch it took us more than 6 hours - by highway it would have been half. And probably safer with less dodging tuk tuks, but also less colourful. 

The place is spectacular. I read before I booked to get a villa If you can afford it and I strongly agree. Again it isn’t critical but we loved the villas. And we had a premier one #37 which is closer to the center of things. It was beautifully designed - there is a good sense of privacy (although landscapers a s staff will sometimes walk around the shed but it didn’t feel bothersome). 

The bathroom is huge and gorgeous and luxurious. Pictures don’t do it justice. The steam shower was very nice. The towels and linens were commiserate with the environment. 

 Breakfast outside on our lanai/porch every day was magical. If you are in a villa it can be floating in your private pool or delivered. The fruit was particularly great. There were great squirrels around and one morning a mongoose as well as beautiful birds. It was idyllic. 

Overall the service was great and people seemed to geninuinely want to contribute to the experience and take pride in their environment. It has a relaxed atmosphere and not the Disneysque happiness at gunpoint feel. It is definitely not over programmed - while there are things to do and excursions - of you show up with a “here we are, entertain us” attitude, you may be disappointed. This is for people who want to connect with their environment and bathe in elegance and sophisticated design carved out of nature on the edge of the ocean. 

We particularly enjoyed the cooking class / some of the best food we had in Sri Lanka. It was great to see the extremely fresh ingredients and learn about the spices. We asked about a vegetable we had seen in a supermarket and presto it appeared - they take a lot of pride in their cuisine and ingredients. Aruna Kumara was the chef and he was ridiculously patient with us and we left feeling we could actually cook the dishes back home. Very highly recommend it. 

Also the spa was great - one of the best massages I’ve  had anywhere in the world was by Rina who was strong and anatomically focused/educated. It is usually one or the other if you are lucky. We went back a second time. The couples massage was also a great atmosphere and a centrepiece of our stay. 

Maga was the other massage therepist we encountered and she was lovely. She also runs yoga three days a week - perhaps my only constructive thought was that it would be nice to have yoga daily.one yoga session had the entertainment of monkeys cavorting in the trees. 

The restaurant is solid but it is also easy to eat out in the village - you could walk to local restaurants which looked good or quickly drive to beachside places where you pick your fish and they cook it. 

In addition to the pools shared by residences, there is a common moon pool with a breathtaking view and they will make you a coconut to drink :) pro tip - take it back and put it in your fridge. Cold they are on another level. 

Also you can walk down to the beach and swim in the Indian Ocean. There is also a bar there. The whole complex has pretty good wifi coverage. 

High tea was fine- not their strongest offering but it was fun to try the teas. Piuli (sp?) was a lovely and cheerful guide and introduced me to teas I would never have tried and now brought home.

We went on the local tea plantation tour. It was interesting. A little odd. Worth it to learn about tea and see cinamon being made. 

A note of recognition to Niswanathan (sp?) who I believe is the food and beverage manager and was accomodating and lovely when asked for help. 

Finally If it is in season - strongly recommend the maritime experience/whale watching cruise. It isn’t cheap - especially compared to local tours. But when we went out we understood why. It was fabulous. The crew is lovely. There was a very knowledgeable guide. The food was great. We were under sail a lot of the time. They are respectful toward the maritime life and a lot of local charters were awful - one of them almost rammed a Bryce’s whale rushing to get to it. 

Also - definitely recommend their sister property Wild Coast Tented lodge for two nights. But we love Cape Weligama so much we came back for an unexpected last night before we left Sri Lanka and it was the perfect ending to our trip.
title: An extraordinary experience.

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Explore out and get out for dinner in the town.
text:
2 words. Moon pool. From our arrival and an upgrade from villa to luxury villa, every moment here was a dream! We were fortunate enough to be at a villa next to the moon pool with views of the sea. 
The Moon Pool is one of the most special places in the world. The photos do not really show the sheer size of the pool. With views over the surf it feels more like swimming in a warm clean lake. We even came swimming here in the rain! 
The breakfast was really something! (as with every breakfast in Sri Lanka). 
We chose a villa as we were on our honeymoon and the apartments / rooms overlooked the family pool. Being April however (on the shoulder season) the hotel was quiet and often we were the only people in the pool. 
The villa we stayed in was enormous. With a shared but private pool. We had no need as we were so close to the Moon Pool. 
The restaurant for dinner was great too - although def on the more expensive side. We tuk tuk into weligama and tried the increibdle RISE pizza one night and loved it. the hotel can arrange the Tuk Tuk so I wouldn't let the price of the restaurant hold you back its really easy to get out. 
We had fun with a few games of pool. The surf here at the new beach was a little rough for the swimming but if we had bothered the beaches on either side of the property looked pretty good for swimming. 
We can not wait to come back. A wonderful, honeymoon stay.
title: Perfection.

text: We had a fantastic stay at Cape Weligama as part of a honeymoon trip to Sri Lanka! roomTip: Watch the surfers from the terrace when you eat breakfast - many of them are very good!
text:
We spent the last leg of our three weeks of honeymooning in the Maldives and Sri Lanka at Cape Weligama - it's such a wonderful, peaceful place! 

Rooms are enormous, even our junior suite (smallest alternative) was larger than any other hotel room we have ever stayed at. All thinkable amenities included, quite a generous minibar policy too, where everything in the minibar is free once.

Staff is friendly, attentive and professional. Food was extraordinarily good, with a huge variety of everything from local curries to cordon bleu - the chef's version of the latter was very delicious! 

But what really sets Cape Weligama apart from other options, is the property: it's like walking into an enormous tropical garden, with fruit trees, flowers, birds and butterflies everywhere. On the property we also saw komodo dragons, cameleons, bright blue kingfisher birds. The pretty moon pool overlooks the beautiful bays below the cape where the property lies, but our most terrific experience was just sitting outside the hotel in the afternoon, with some wine, seeing the sun go down, listening to the life in garden; suddenly two grey langurs (rather big monkeys) sat down on the roof above us, before they ran off into some other trees on the property. A peacock wandered by. Next thing, a wonderful moonlit dinner on the nearby terrace. Cape Weligama is very tranquil and relaxing, but also interesting and fun!

Rather pricy for Sri Lanka, we would still chose this hotel over any other, should we return to the island.
title: Great hotel in a tropical garden

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Let me start by saying I had mixed feelings about staying here as I was originally booked for the sister property Ahu Bay. An unfortunate glitch in the system meant there was no room for me at Ahu Bay and as a customers service recovery was offered a room at Cape Welligama. Despite being 1.5 hours away from my last location, this place is it. 

It has been such a long time where a five star hotel acutally met my expectations and exceeded them- all without being pretentious! The Sri Lankan service was impeccable. 

Rooms- chefs kiss! Spacious, everything you need plus things you wouldn’t think you need. Steam shower was amazing. 

Facilities- brand new and fabulous. Pools amazing, as was service as the beach. 

Food/ drink- yes expensive by Sri Lankan standards but well worth it. Cocktails were some of the best I had, with very generous pours. Dinner was delicious! 

If I am ever back in Sri Lanka, I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here or any of their properties. 

10/10- no notes.
title: Unparalleled.

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely hotel on the outskirts of Ella. The vista from the rooms is amazing and the pool lovely.  We had half board in our rate and the food was good, service was great. However, the music was a bit too much for a relaxing dinner and to enable dining conversation.  We stayed two nights and the second night was the worst! I'd suggest management  turn the volume down so people can hear each other talk. If not make sure you book a table outside or as far from the stage as possible. 

There is no air con in the bedrooms, just a fan and no fly screens so be prepared if it's a warm night. Our driver was really surprised when we mentioned no air con... 

Can not fault the service for the staff.
title: Great hotel, just bring ear plugs to dinner

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
Our Dream Honeymoon at 98 Acres Resort

We chose 98 Acres Resort & Spa for our honeymoon, and it turned out to be one of the best decisions we made. The resort is nestled among beautiful tea plantations with breathtaking views of Ella Gap, offering the perfect peaceful and romantic atmosphere.

Our chalet was charming and thoughtfully designed, blending beautifully with the natural surroundings. Waking up to the misty mountains and the sounds of nature was a dream. We especially loved relaxing on our private balcony — it quickly became our favorite spot to just sit back and enjoy the moment together.

A particularly memorable part of our stay was a traditional blessing ritual arranged by the resort. It was such a meaningful experience and added a lovely cultural touch to our honeymoon.

We also had complimentary access to the Ravana Pool Club, which had a great vibe and gave us the chance to unwind in a fun and relaxing setting. It was definitely a highlight of our trip!

While everything was truly special, we thought that a honeymoon cake or some romantic bed decorations could have made it feel even more personalized. Maybe it’s something the resort could offer future honeymooners.

All in all, our stay at 98 Acres was unforgettable. The staff were so warm and welcoming, and every detail was taken care of. We made some beautiful memories and would recommend this place to any couple looking for a peaceful and scenic getaway.
title: Our dream honeymoon at 98 acres resort and spa

roomTip: La tyrolienne et le Sky Walk sont à faire. Le Pool Club semble surfait et était hors de pris.
text: L’hôtel est situé à 1500m d’altitude, il y fait beau et frais, chaud en journée. La chambre était incroyable, avec une terrasse très agréable à la vue imprenable, avec des écureuil qui passent juste devant la porte fenêtre. L’hôtel est parfaitement situé pour aller à pied au Petit Adams Peak, ascension très accessible et agréable en passant par un petit accrobranche, à une tyrolienne géante, et aussi au Pont aux 9 Arches. Le petit déjeuner est le meilleur que nous ayons eu au Sri Lanka. Tout le personnel était adorable, aux petits soins. Mangala au restaurant était particulièrement gentil. Merci à tous! Nous recommandons cet établissement les yeux fermés.
title: Superbe

placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text:
Had a very pleasant stay at the Aarunya Nature Resort with family over the end of year holidays.

This is a boutique hotel set in a very nice nature resort north of Kandy with a spectacular view.

A big thank you to the GM, Haleem, for making our stay very memorable. No, was never an answer. He made sure that all our needs and requests were met.  And ran a team that displayed an exceptional level of service in all areas from the room maintenance and cleanliness, down to the excellent F&B service and the tours and transportation.

Highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the Kandy area. The hotel lies between Kandy and the Sigiriya Rock region.
title: Very Memorable Stay at the Aarunya Nature Resort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. & Mrs. Hoosain,

Thank you for sharing such a detailed and thoughtful review of your stay with us! We are truly delighted to hear that you had a serene and memorable experience amidst the natural beauty of Kandy.

Your kind words about our team members, particularly Mr. Haleem, Mr. Sanjeewa, and your personal butler, Mr. Nilantha, have brought smiles to all of us. Their dedication to providing warm, personalized service is a hallmark of our resort, and it’s wonderful to see their efforts so deeply appreciated. We’ll be sure to share your heartfelt compliments with them—they will be thrilled to know how much of an impact they made on your stay.

We’re glad you enjoyed the peaceful ambiance of the private villas and the unique experience of hearing the Azaan from the valley. It’s feedback like yours that inspires us to continuously create meaningful moments for our guests.

It’s also great to hear your praise for our chef’s parathas! We’ll certainly pass on your compliments to him as well—knowing that his culinary creations made such a positive impression means a lot to us.

We’d be honored to welcome you back whenever you need another escape from the hustle and bustle of life. Thank you again for your wonderful words and for choosing our resort for your stay in Kandy.

Warm regards,

Team Aarunya.
placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If u like the tent vibes - book the tents - the bathroom and toilet are kind of open - I prefer enclosed rooms - especially during this time
text: The experience is so different to hotel living! Nestled in kandy, among luscious green trees, warm people and a personal butler - certainly an experience. While the loaded pictures are that of the tent - the tent is not a positive experience for everyone! We asked to move to the private villas at the top of the hill - where one could actually hear the azaan (call to prayer) 5 times a day from the valleys in front of you! The people at the resort: omg! This review matches my comments of that at the Hilton in yalla! Mr haleem, Mr Sanjeev and my personal favourite ❤️ personal butler Mr Nilantha Sisira Kumara - you are an outstanding human being- your attendance to us at breakfast - served on a table that felt like we’re at home, checking up on me when I didn’t make it for breakfast or lunch - and attendance to my laundry when I spilled hair serum on two white outfits! Mr Haleem - thank u for the complementary meal on day one! Mr Sanjeev, thank you for coming to check on the laundry to see how best to help me! Thank u to the warmest, kindest, most gentlest carying human beings that have cross my path in life! While Kandy is not a place I will necessarily visit again - I will probably come head to this very place to escape the hustle and bustle of life! Oh and the chef - you make the most awesome parathas! There were days I could have settled for just a paratha and a coke! Keep it up - you gorgeous human beings! Thank u kumara! 🥰 ( pics loaded are of the tents and not the room) and does not do justice!
title: Different experience out in nature! Serene!

I can’t recommend this resort enough if you’re looking for a complete escape and time to unwind.

text:
Traumhaft schön gelegen. Das kleine Hotel ist mit viel Herzblut erschaffen und Sylvie hat überall herzige Details eingebracht. Die Villen sind sehr geräumig, sehr schön eingerichtet und wunderbar gelegen. Kiten kann man hier in allen Varianten:Flachwasser,Welle und man hat Platz ohne Ende. Wir kommen gerne wieder!

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s remote
text: Beautiful property, welcoming staff and relaxing stay. Stayed in the a frame beach. Sunset was beautiful. There is a small pool., and swimming not advised but some folks swam and it looked fine.  Breakfast is huge. Dinner was a buffet.  All in all a lovely stay though it was hot and we thanked the wind. Loved the wild donkeys, doggies and cats.  If you want to relax with books or kite surf, you would love this place. In April it’s the off season, 33 degrees.
title: Beautiful resort in the wild

ownerResponse/text:
Hello there,

Thank you for the lovely review! We're so glad you enjoyed your stay in the A-frame by the beach and soaked in those sunsets. The donkeys, dogs, and cats are part of the charm here, and it's great to hear they added to your experience. Yes, April can get hot, and we’re all grateful for the breeze when it comes! Whether it’s books or kites, we’d love to welcome you back anytime for more slow days by the sea.
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
This was by far the best hotel I stayed in during my 3 weeks in Sri Lanka!
If you are looking for relaxation & nature while eating the most amazing food, this is the place!
The staff is amazing and I loved the dogs (Dixi❤️) and donkeys. The rooms are beautiful and the resort overall is very stylish and just wonderful.

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for this wonderful review! We're so happy your family had a magical stay with us. The jetty mornings, starlit showers, and fireflies are some of our favorite moments too — it's lovely to hear they made your trip special. We're glad you enjoyed the activities and that our team could help make everything smooth and easy. Hope to welcome you all back again for more coffee by the water and new adventures! 🌿✨
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text: We had a lovely stay in April 2025 as a family of four. We loved the beautiful location and the sustainability aspect of the resort. We stayed in a lagoon house and loved sitting on the jetty in the morning with our coffee, and also watching fireflies and seeing the stars in the evening in the outdoors shower - really magical. The staff were all great - the food was excellent and the team were really helpful booking excursions and taxis for us which made everything really easy. We also really enjoyed the activities - horse riding, paddle boarding and kayaking.
title: Great stay and really lovely family holiday

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Amelia,

Wow — thank you for such a heartwarming message! We're so happy you felt the magic of this place, even on short notice. 
It means a lot that you noticed the love and care that goes into protecting the environment and creating a space that feels like family. 

Whether it’s horse swims, kitesurfing tips from Marcel, or just swinging in a hammock, we’re so glad you made it yours.

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text: Oh my goodness it is heavenly here! I came as a solo traveller at quite short notice and the team were amazing at helping me make arrangements including airport transfers from Colombo. There was the most amazing welcome in a paradise which felt remote and protected. The commitment to preserve and protect this beautiful environment is clear throughout the work here, with a strong focus on plastic free, ecologically friendly activities. Every member of the team here was so friendly and helpful and there was a strong sense of family and happiness. The food was out of this world in both quantity and quality! And the range of activities on offer was incredible. It’s also the perfect environment to do absolutely nothing and relax by the beautiful infinity pool, on the beach or in a hammock in your beach villa. I rode on the beach and we went swimming with the horses. Marcel was hugely welcoming and has a huge expertise in kite surfing which was really helpful! You’ve created something so special here. Cannot wait to come back again. Thank you!
title: Absolute heavenly paradise

text: Nous avons passé un excellent séjour pour commencer notre aventure au Sri Lanka. L’hôtel est incroyable, l’hébergement est très spacieux avec une douche en extérieur très agréable. text:
We had the most wonderful stay at Elements. The staff were fabulous and so helpful. We ate dinner every night and on the last night they barbecued tuna caught that morning and cut directly of the fish - spectacular. We stayed in the rustic 2 storied cabins but if you weren't keen on sleeping under the rattan roof there were options too. Breakfasts were included and delicious too. 
Beach walks were great and we enjoyed the pool too. Donkeys and birds life abounded too.

text:
Our stay at Elements Beach and Nature Resort was truly tremendous! The people were incredibly lovely, making us feel so welcome from the moment we arrived. The location itself is absolutely spectacular—one of the nicest places my other half and I have ever stayed.

It was the perfect spot for a relaxing getaway, with the serene surroundings providing total tranquility. One of the highlights of our trip was spotting dolphins during our stay, which made the experience even more magical.

A perfect balance of nature, relaxation, and adventure—highly recommended!

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The beach villas offer great view of the ocean with its beautiful sunset..
text: Every time you come back from a holiday in a special place it's hard but leaving the Elements behind is always a little harder. We came back for the second time with our teenager girls, and I have to say at the same magic of a really great place we saw even better services this time. A new bar with excellent cocktails, a better a la carte menu for lunch, a more reliable wifi in the whole resort, two horses to take wonderful walks on along the splendid beach over the Indian ocean... In short, Marcel, his wife, theirpartners and all the staff (Samith, Ashan, Roy and the others) have really created a magnificent place and are carrying it forward with heart and commitment obtaining the results they deserve. We will be back soon but in the meantime thank you again for making us spend a great Christmas and a magnificent New Year's Eve (great party btw!)...
title: 2nd time, same fabulous magic with even better services!!!

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text: Wir können das Elements vollumfänglich empfehlen. Die Lage zwischen Lagune und Meer ist traumhaft. Das Personal ist unglaublich freundlich und bemüht und sehr gästeorientiert. Das Essen, speziell die Currys und der lecker zubereitete Thunfisch, war das Beste während unserer Reise durch Sri Lanka. Wir waren in einem der Häuschen in der Lagune untergebracht und waren mit dieser Wahl sehr zufrieden. Das Gelände des Resorts ist riesig und es fühlt sich alles sehr privat und familiär an. Die Gastgeber sind sehr freundlich und nehmen sich Zeit für Fragen oder Anregungen. Einzig allein die Kosten für den Verleih der Kayaks und der Räder haben mich etwas irritiert. Irgendwie wäre es speziell für Nichtkiter schön, wenn der Verleih im Übernachtungspreis inkludiert wäre. Dies soll ebenfalls nur eine Anregung sein. Wenn der Wind passt, ist das hier für Kiter wirklich ein Paradies. Der Pool ist super schön und fügt sich ganz natürlich in die Landschaft ein. Die Möglichkeit eines Ausrittes auf einem der Pferde habe ich sehr geschätzt und ebenfalls toll, war es zu beobachten, wie liebevoll der Pferdepfleger den mit den Tieren umgeht. Wir werden sicher wieder hierher kommen und empfehlen die Unterkunft definitiv auch an Freunde und Bekannte weiter.
title: Einfach nur umwerfend schön

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
Just like Heaven. We stayed in a lovely water front cabin type bungalow with a decked area and ‘outside’ natural shower. 

This is a beach front ‘bare foot’ resort. The bar and restaurant area are on the beach and the food and service are excellent. 

We shared the beach with donkeys, cows, and horses, along with crabs and a variety of bird life.

The views are amazing. 
We could have spent a week there but unfortunately we only stayed 3 nights.
title: Just like Heaven. Peace, tranquility and stunning beach front location.

placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:
We had an exceptional Stay at the Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort in June 2025.

The hotel is very well located. You can walk to anywhere inside the Fort where all the restaurants and shops are. 

The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive and treated us with genuine kindness and professionalism to ensure our stay was comfortable.

The room was clean, tastefully decorated, and best of all cold! This really was a vital after visiting the Fort in the heat! 

The pool and common areas were well maintained and added to the sense of relaxation and luxury.

We left feeling refreshed, well cared for, and eager to return. This hotel is a true gem in Sri Lanka, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking an unforgettable getaway.
title: Great stay in Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort June 2025

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing such a thoughtful and detailed review of your stay at Taru Villas – Rampart Street. We are delighted that you found our property to be a little oasis of calm in the heart of Galle Fort and that you enjoyed the unique blend of history, charm, and tranquility that defines our villa.

Our beautifully preserved Dutch colonial building is indeed a special place, and we’re so pleased that you appreciated the period furnishings, the elegant four-poster bed, and the serene poolside setting. placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:
We spent two nights here as part of our tour of Sri Lanka. We loved it here! Located in the middle of Galle Fort, it is a little oasis of calm. While you inevitably can hear the city around you, it is a lovely tranquil space with the rooms located around a pool. The staff are friendly, attentive and provide the best service possible. 
The building is Dutch colonial which has been beautifully preserved. Our room had a four poster bed and period furniture which matched the style of the building. 
Breakfast is served at a large shared dining table overlooking the pool. It is selected from a menu which has a good choice of western and Sri Lankan food and is served at the table. 
All of the sights of Galle Fort are within easy reach, as are the shops, cafes and restaurants.
We would have loved to have stayed longer.
title: A little gem located in the middle of Galle Fort!

roomTip: For a little extra the two upstairs rooms are worth it.
text:
Having stayed many times in Galle in everywhere from private villas to the much more expensive Amangalla & Galle Fort Hotel, this time we were looking for something small and intimate for myself and 2 friends and Taru Villas Rampart St not only matches its competitors but in many respects beats them. It is a beautifully restored house in an excellent location just across from the open space of the fort walls. Of only four rooms, we chose the two upstairs rooms which are the largest and best. One has a private balcony overlooking the garden & pool and the other, the master sea view suite has an enormous bathroom with claw foot bath. Thick foliage somewhat obscures the sea view but it is still a magnificent room. 

The public areas are beautiful and we breakfasted daily with a troupe of langur monkeys as our guests! The food is excellent and the pool is a welcome sanctuary from the heat and humidity of Galle.

But it is the lovely staff that makes this place extra special. They anticipate your every need and getting to know then all was a privilege. We had 3 fabulous nights here and didn't want to leave but when we did we headed down to their sister hotel in Tangalle so we knew we were in good hands. Many thanks to all the staff for taking such good care of us.
title: A Beautiful Retreat

text:
Visiting Galle forte is a must, it’s completely different to the other areas of Sri Lanka that we visited. I’m surprised that Taru Villas isn’t number 1 on trip advisor.

Shanika showed us around the boutique hotel , probably the most beautiful hotels of our Kiki tour of Sri Lanka as was our room - We stayed in the upstairs garden facing room, WOW .. 

The hotel 4 rooms and a small pool , partly in the sun through the day . Very peaceful and tranquil, and the monkeys visit to keep you entertained. 

Subject to the times that you choose to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner, you eat with the other guests and Shanika will offer you Sri Lankan or European options . The food and service served by Akalanka and Ravrinda was exceptional always with smile. 

Shame 5 is the maximum score possible! If you visit Galle you have to stay here! 

Thanks for a wonderful 2 night stay.

text:
We stayed 1 night in this beautiful little 4 room hotel in Galle.

They have converted an ancient house into this hotel and maintained the same style and architecture. Front door is usually locked but as soon as you press the buzzer on the right side, staff would come and attend you.

We came in a scorching hot day. As soon as we entered the hotel, staff guided us to the lobby/ lounge area. We were given a cold towel and a passionfruit popsicle as the welcome drink. I thought that was genius. Something cold to cool down. Place is clean, tidy and well maintained. 

We stayed at the premier seaview room. It was on the upstairs over looking fort walls and the front st. Room was surprisingly quiet. Bedroom was extremely spacious with a coffeetable and an old-school couch. Bathroom is the biggest I have ever seen in my life with a freestanding bathtub.

Staff were friendly and attentive. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. However, staff would deliver a pot of tea as soon as you request one. 

Overall we had an amazing time in this boutique hotel. I highly recommend if you are looking for a different kind of hotel to stay
title: Going back in time

text:
What a wonderful hotel. Well located and an oasis of calm from bustling Galle Fort where everything is within walking distance.

The house is beautifully fitted out with a veranda looking out onto the charming small garden with pool. Langur monkeys bounce through the surrounding trees.

The rooms are an utter delight. We had the garden view room so facing inwards from the street. Very spacious with a very large and comfortable bed and plenty of storage. We had a delightful balcony on which we could sit and the bathroom is accessed via the balcony. 

The bathroom had a lovely powerful and hot shower, basin and WC. Lovely cosmetics supplied and plenty of towels. Accessing via the veranda means a torch is helpful at night but there is a large privacy screen so there is no feeling of being exposed or overlooked.

Very good aircon and great soundproofing. We could not hear anything outside at night.

Breakfasts are a substantial multi course feast with the main dish ordered the night before so the kitchen has time to prepare it. Delicious. We had dinner one night which was a huge Sri Lankan curry feast, again delicious. Wine and beer is available but no spirits. Meals are taken at a shared table.

The staff are very attentive but discreet and someone was always available to deal with any matters. 

This was our last stop on our Sri Lankan holiday. We were so pleased that we had chosen to stay in Galle and particularly at Taru Villas.

Highly recommended.
title: Wonderful hotel in Galle Fort

text:
I stayed at Amari Colombo for 3 nights as a solo traveler and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience. From the moment I arrived, the staff were warm, courteous, and always ready to assist with a smile. Their hospitality created a welcoming atmosphere throughout my stay.
The room was spacious, airy, and exceptionally comfortable—not the typical stuffy hotel feel, which I really appreciated. The modern design and thoughtful in-room amenities added to the comfort. I also loved the bathroom—it was clean, well-equipped, and stylish.
One small hiccup was an unexpected fire alarm test during the afternoon while I was napping. The alarm came through the room speaker without prior notice, which was quite startling. I had to call the reception to confirm it was only a test. Later that evening, I noticed a notice about the alarm testing outside the door, but it definitely wasn���t there earlier. That said, it wasn’t a major issue—just something that could be improved in future with earlier communication.
Breakfast was another highlight, with a generous variety and the added bonus of being served until 10:30 AM—perfect for a relaxed morning.
Overall, a smooth and pleasant stay. I would gladly return and recommend it to others.
title: Excellent Stay – Comfortable, Welcoming, and Well-Appointed

text:
My wife and I recently stayed at Amari Colombo for bed and breakfast, and it was truly an amazing experience from start to finish. The hotel is modern and beautifully maintained, with spotlessly clean and new rooms that made our stay incredibly comfortable.

The buffet breakfast offered a wonderful variety and delicious spread, catering to all tastes. For dinner, we dined at Prego, the Italian restaurant, and it exceeded expectations. The pizza was absolutely authentic, full of flavor, and generously portioned – easily enough for two!

One of the highlights was the rooftop infinity pool – the views were breathtaking and the rooftop area was peaceful and relaxing, perfect for unwinding.

The service was top-notch, and I would especially like to thank Mr. Rishitha Perera (Revenue Manager )for his warm hospitality and assistance in organizing our stay. His helpful insights made a big difference.

If you’re planning a visit to Colombo, Amari is a must-stay destination. Highly recommended!
title: Exceptional Stay at Amari Colombo – A Perfect Getaway!

Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for taking the time to share such a thoughtful review of your experience at Aarunya. We are delighted to hear that every aspect of your stay from the stunning natural surroundings and our iconic pool to the relaxation and rejuvenation our facilities offer, met your expectations.

The beauty of the Knuckles Mountain Range, coupled with the tranquil ambiance created by nature’s sounds and Pirith chanting, indeed makes Aarunya a sanctuary for rest and reflection. text: Aarunya has been the best at its service! Scenic view, Iconic pool, Relaxing in the hot tub with exquisite food and beverages is just fantastic! Only nature is there to accompany you through out your stay and these private pool villas are worth every penny! Laxman our butler was very helpful and appriciate the dedicated room service and complimentary treats. Neck and shoulder massage just as you checkin to the hotel is your hint to relax and unplug from your busy life. Holidays are to enjoy leisurely and there were no timelines for your meals which we enjoyed much. And we had the taste of srilankan and western cuisine on our stay which we think is excellant. I loved the seer fish curry and gamkukulmas curry which I think they have nailed it! We were surprised to see everyday Sri Lankan cuisine prepared with a twist! Simply, food was exquisite! We had the best night view and the best sunrise view feeling like its heaven on earth! Chirping birds, Pirith chanting from the cloudy knuckles mountain range and sun kissed greens just made the stay perfect! Thank you for the hospitality! Sri Lanka is proud❤️🌼🌸🌤️🇱🇰
title: Aarunya feels like heaven on earth ❤️🌤️

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for your thoughtful and glowing review. We are delighted that your time at Aarunya Nature Resort provided the peaceful immersion in nature you were hoping for. It's wonderful to hear that within moments of arrival, you were able to connect with the natural surroundings from your balcony, observing the vibrant wildlife.

We’re especially pleased that the Sky Tented room with its private infinity pool and breathtaking valley views met your expectations, enhancing your stay with a personal and intimate touch. Our team takes pride in tailoring dining experiences to meet each guest's needs, and we’re delighted that our chef could create vegan dishes that brought the flavors of local cuisine to you in a unique way. Your kind acknowledgment of this effort means a great deal to us.

It’s also fantastic to know you enjoyed the excursions to see elephants and the Kandy Royal Botanic Gardens, as well as the informative nature walk through our own grounds. Our guides and drivers are truly dedicated to providing memorable experiences, and we’re thrilled that these excursions enhanced your stay.

Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and we look forward to the possibility of welcoming you back to explore even more of the experiences that await at Aarunya.

Aarunya Reservations Team.
placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text:
Aarunya Nature Resort was a wonderful experience. 
Nestled in the forested hills north of Kandy you really do feel a part of nature, within 5 minutes of checking into our room we were watching birds, lizards and monkeys in the surrounding trees from our balcony. 
We stayed 5 nights in the Sky Tented room with its private infinity pool that had the most amazing view across the valley and forests.
The resort is lovely. It was smaller than I was expecting, but that gives it a personal and intermit feel. 
The staff couldn’t be more attentive and helpful. 
The dinning experiences were delightful and after informing the resort, when I booked, that both me and my husband had vegan dietary requirements the chef and staff met the challenge with enthusiasm and smiles and were able to serve us up delicious and interesting (veganised) local dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It is very much appreciated as we know how this can be quite an effort.
The elephant excursion we booked through the resort was incredible, with an informative guide and great driver. It was also simple to book a car and driver at the resort to take us down to Kandy Royal Botanic Gardens, which was a surprisingly delightful way to spend a morning without having to travel too far. 
We were also taken on a nature walk through the resort’s garden where we were shown spices, fruit and the local abundant bird life. 
Our only regret was that we didn’t book more days there as we passed up a few of the other interesting excursions on offer so as we could spend some more relaxing time enjoying the resort and it’s tranquility.
title: Nature and luxury go hand in hand at Aarunya Nature Resort

text: Late review but a much needed & well deserved. The best resort we have ever stayed in, perfect resort to relax & actually unwind. We took all inclusive package & Sky tented room with private pool overlooking a spectacular green valley. anddddd it was sooo much worth it. Their super excellent service spoiled us from the moment you reach the resort. We were welcomed with a spectacular view & super warm staff. Also given a welcome 10 minute massage.  In the package, all meals were included which had 5 course meals every time. The chef was great & food was so delicious every time. Every day 30 minutes massage was also free in the package which was the cherry on the cake to relax completely. The property itself was beautiful & had short in the jungle kind of walkways to explore. It was a perfect getaway & the staff made it extra comfortable for us with their service. It’s a boutique resort so has like 9-10 rooms only mostly all with private pools I think. So the staff gives you full attention & comfort, be it getting you food in your room or at their restaurant. They have one restaurant at the lobby & fixed 4-5 course meal menu but still with 2-3 option in every course. They have Ala carte options too. Kids might not feel much to do in this resort apart from pool or some games. Thankyou to the whole staff for make it a perfect & super excellent stay 7/ for a thoughtful parting gift. We will definitely come back again.
title: Perfect Resort to Relax & Rejuvenate.

roomTip:
1. Don't be in a hurry when accessing WiFi.
2. You won't need sarongs, umbrellas, binoculars, even a iPad - all supplied by Aarunya.
text: Aarunya was sheer indulgence. For location, décor, comfort, amenities, food, drinks and service – we gave 5/5 stars. The staff did not only meet our every need but were very willing to enjoy a friendly chat. Our butler Namal also took us on a tour of the property (and beyond) and explained in detail how the resort grew most of its own food and was mostly self-reliant. We enjoyed many lessons in biology, botany and ornithology !! Dressed in sarongs, the highlight of our stay was a traditional meal in a village setting, cooked in front of us, with live music supplied by a local duo. Thank you Aarunya staff !!
title: Could not find one fault...

roomTip: Perfect with baby!
text:
We spent 4 days at this beautiful place, and every day felt like paradise on earth! We had full board, and although we could only choose from a limited menu, the food was always delicious! I traveled with a baby, and the kitchen went out of their way to prepare something delicious for her every time! 

No one else used the main pool; it was just us the whole time, and the view from there was breathtaking! We stayed in the Cinnamon Villa, while our parents were in the other two, but the view from here was also incredibly! The floating breakfast is worth trying; it's an unique experience! The hotel has a Spa section where you can try Balinese massages or Ayurvedic treatments. I had a Balinese massage in the open-air spa surrounded by beautiful nature, and it was very cool! On our last evening, we tried the special Sri Lankan dinner - if you like fish and spicy food, this is a must-try! It was the perfect way to crown our stay!
title: Truly the best Hotel in Sri Lanka

The decor's classiness, alongside a lovely pool and cozy seating areas, creates an ambiance of luxury and comfort. It's impressive that the villa maintains a delightful fragrance throughout, further enhancing the experience.

Your description of the breakfast as one of the best during your two-week trip, with its wide range of options from pancakes to traditional Sri Lankan dishes, highlights the quality and variety of their cuisine. The thoughtful gesture of organizing a delicious cake for your honeymoon is a testament to their attentive and considerate service.

text: My husband and I had the most wonderful stay here. There are only 4 rooms so it feels very personal and special. The staff were lovely and friendly and we were welcomed with delicious ice lollies and fresh fruit juices. The decor is extremely classy with a lovely pool, large rooms, cosy seating areas and a delcious smell throughout. text: We booked to stay at this hotel for my wife's birthday, we booked through booking dot com and we had no issues with any aspect of this booking.  The hotel itself was absolutely stunning, so many original features and the smell of the wood inside was beautiful.  We stayed in room No.1 which was stunning with wooden floors and furniture and the biggest bathroom we have ever seen, with all the creams, lotions, shampoos, shower gel, conditioners etc. you could imagine, as well as a home made insect repellent which was also provided.  The staff very helpful and nothing was too much trouble, everything was spotlessly clean and the food was of the highest standard, we stayed for a couple of days and took advantage of the sun terrace and pool areas as well as other areas, which were all comfortable clean and in keeping with the age and history of the building.
title: Stunning Hotel

placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
roomTip: Bring plenty of mosquito repellent :)
text:
An amazing experience:
This traditional Dutch Villa property has so much character and has been renovated and maintained with so much care - you can’t help but fall in love with it.
However it is the staff who make the experience truly magical. From the warm welcome to the delicious meals - we could not have asked for more. Special mention goes to chef Manju who is able to create everything from traditional rice and curry to the most amazing seafood platter we have ever had - we are especially grateful to the staff who were able to source the fresh seafood with only a few hours notice for our farewell dinner. 
We stayed as a family of 5 in the 2 upper floor rooms so it felt like we had the place to ourselves but it was also nice to meet the people staying in the poolside rooms over breakfast.
One thing we didn’t expect was the wildlife including a family of monkeys who seemed to love eating the flowers on the trees around the property and also some exotic reptiles. The staff always made us feel safe and looked after us in all respects.
Other highlights include relaxing in the freestanding bath in the huge bathroom upstairs and lounging under the frangipani trees next to the pool.
title: An unforgettable experience

text:
A wonderful four days in Gaulle, which although we were initially underwhelmed by, thanks to the length of our stay and the quality of our accommodation we gradually fell in love with it.

Taru Villas has an elegant colonial charm; understated but sophisticated decor, a beautiful garden with a small pool and sitting out area. Our room is was hugely comfortable with a palatial bathroom for those who love to languish in a bath; the bed was soft and there was a beautiful view.

Breakfast was plentiful and afternoon tea with a slice of cake was served by the pool.  The service is as discreet and impeccable.  Altogether a lovely sojourn.

roomTip: The best room is the First floor room overlooking Galle fort
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and my review title was based on visiting quite a few hotels in Galle during our stay, including AmanGalle.
This boutique property on Rampart Street is closest to the Ramperts of this Fort and the front of the house overlooks the sea.
The property only has 4 bedrooms, 2 overlooking the garden pool, and 2 on the first floor.
We upgraded twice, first from a poolside room to the first floor room , overlooking the pol.What a room !
We would have been very happy there , but saw that the other room was vacant and overlooked the sea and was even larger and we were able to upgrade to that room as the property was quiet.
There are at least 4 staff led by Chamuth, who described himself as the Villa Guardian  and was available 24 hours a day.
We had booked on a B& B basis and then realised that we could eat her and had a lovely traditional Sri Lankan meal , which weirdly was priced in dollars but had to be paid for in SLR. 
The meal was very good but was quite expensive  but due to the personal service was worth it. 
in fact it was the most expensive meal we had in Sri Lanka ( including dinner @ AmanGalle) largely because an average bottle of wine was $35.

This place would be put to its best use with a group of friends taking over the whole Villa, but we enjoyed the personal service immensely and was rather spoilt by all the communal areas and the lovely pool.

I would highly recommend this Hotel and believe it’s the best in Galle but not the priciest for accomodation.
title: Probably the best Hotel in Galle

placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text: Small (4 room) hotel in an old colonial mansion, beautifully decorated with real character. Staff are very accommodating and friendly. The hotel has a central alfresco dining area and a courtyard with a swimming pool, which is great. There are a load of great bars, cafes and restaurants in the old town within walking distance. Highly recommend staying here.
title: A charming boutique hotel in the heart of the Fortified City

placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:
You can sense the history of the building as soon as you walk in. There is a lovely wooden staircase leading to the first floor.
We had a very comfortable first floor room, with a balcony, leading to a spacious bathroom. There was a great view over the garden and pool. A side window gave a view of trees, with langur monkeys.
The garden is lush with flowers, attracting birds and other wildlife.
There is a great choice of breakfast dishes, and an exciting dinner menu. The food was delicious. 
There are other restaurants within easy walking distance.
Staff were very friendly and helpful.
title: Character hotel in great location

placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
roomTip: The two upper floor rooms are Huge.
text:
What a unique find. A stunning heritage property in the centre of Galle Fort. This beautifully restored merchants house is full of period features, antique pieces and tastefully designed decor. 
A boutique property with only four rooms makes it very intimate and private. It is also one of the few hotels inside the fort that can boast a swimming pool. The surrounding garden area is compact but contains a riot of well tended flowers and shrubbery and a glorious old frangipanis tree. 
We choose the garden view room on the upper floor of the main house. It was HUGE with a large outside verandah. Beautiful decor, comfy bed and original wooden floor boards. 
The food was amazing and the staff were friendly and helpful. We truly felt like we were in our own home.
Thank you Taru Villas for a fabulous stay.
title: Tranquil oasis

placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Taj Bentota Resort & Spa! 

We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay with us and happy to note that you had a comfortable stay with us.

I am delighted to read your comments about the room experience, location, dining experience and overall services and all together you cherished the Tajness experiences with the perfect hospitality, right from check-in till check-out. 

Our team is continuously working to ensure flawless service and offer a great experience for all our guests. Once again thank you for your valuable feedback for all our team members.This encourages and motivates us in creating a beyond expectation experience each time. 

Assuring you of our best services and attention at all times. 

Warm regards,
Sibi Mathew
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book ocean facing rooms
text:
We had an amazing time and thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Taj Bentota. I have a five year old daughter and she loved the place. There are separate activities organised for kids (like face painting, coin hunting, magic show) which my daughter enjoyed. 

The view from room are spectacular. We booked an ocean facing room and you can see the Indian Ocean from the room and adjoining balcony. Perfect place to de-stress with morning cup of tea or a glass of wine as you enjoy the sunset.

The breakfast spread is diverse with regular offerings and a special section for local Sri Lanka delicacies. They have Indian chefs to take care of Indian traveller needs - Puri bhaji, chole, dosa, etc

The pool is awesome with spectacular views of the Indian Ocean and there is an adjoining games/lounge area. What will win your heart is the exceptionally warm service, truly Taj standards. 

I would like to call out few individuals who made our stay memorable. Huge thanks to Asiria, chef Dalip Singh, chef Paramesh Gowda and his team at Palms; Don at Tease Bar (who whirred up amazing cocktails every evening), Sachith from house keeping. And above everyone, the General Manager Mr CB Matthews for his sterling leadership.

We can't wait to come back and would highly recommend this property if you are considering Bentota. Whether you are travelling with kids, as a couple or in a group!!
title: Excellent option in Bentota, spectacular views, Beachfront

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a memorable 😀 2-day stay at Taj Bentota Srilanka. The resort is situated in a pristine area, right on a private beach, which provides  a peaceful and scenic retreat. The sea-facing balcony in our room offered breathtaking views — and we clicked lovely photographs showing waves from there!

The swimming pool was the highlight ,many peoples were making reels for their social media. Kids loved the play area, again sea facing, open area. On our first day of stay, face painting was available. The health club was well-equipped with elliptical and treadmill machines, tried my hands for a quick workout.

In the night, there was the lavish dinner spread—a wide variety of dishes, and the Indian food, kadahi paneer to dasi and hopper,  was exceptionally good. Breakfast also impressed us with its extensive variety, kids have a lot of options to select their choice of food.

The bathroom was spotless, stocked with Taj branded toiletries, and the staff service was full of smiles and attentive throughout our 2 days of stay.

We would certainly love to revisit again and also recommend this property for future travelers ️.
title: Sandy toes; sun-kissed nose 😀

Dear Guest

Greetings from Taj Bentota Resort & Spa

At the onset I would like to thank you for being a valued patron and delighted to know that you had a happy and comfortable stay with us.

I will share your feedback with our team and I am sure that this feedback will serve as an encouragement to all of our associates as we strive to create warm and memorable guest experiences.

Further to your feedback to the beds at the beach, wanted to share that since it is a public  beach, the beds are provided by the villagers. However as you would have noticed, the hotel provides the beds within the premises on the lawns

Also further to your observation on the LKR payment, the government has mandated for the room charges to be collected in USD. We do apologise that the team did not explain this better.

Thank you for your appreciation for our team members, Menaka and Chef Dalip. Your encouragement will further motivate them

Once again we thank you for sharing your valuable feedback and look forward to  welcome you back as and when you plan your next trip to Sri Lanka

Warm regards, 

Sibi Mathew
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There's a train station just 2 minutes walking distance
text:
A special thank you to the front desk staff, especially Menaka at the Activity Centre, and the Indian Head Chef at the restaurant – both went out of their way to take extra care of our needs. We absolutely loved the Desi-style fish served to us during our anniversary dinner at Palm – it was a delightful touch!

A couple of things did take away from the experience. At the beach, no beach beds were available unless we paid extra – which felt a bit unreasonable for such a basic amenity. And during checkout, it was quite odd to find out that LKR and UPI online payments weren’t accepted. It would’ve been helpful to be informed about these payment restrictions earlier.
title: Heartfelt Hospitality Made Our Anniversary Special

text: What a fabulous place to stay in Galle. The Accommodation is beautiful with stunning views of the fort. The staff are amazing and are truly attentive to all your needs. They go out of there way to say hello and guide you through the cuisine and hotel amenities. We had our own private pool which was luxurious. The only downside is the access road to the hotel (no fault of the actual resort owners). For my mind a hotel that is bringing in tourist dollars should be looked after however it is hard for any car to enter and exit. Additionally because of this you are stuck having to use the tuk tuks outside the hotel (again not associated with the hotel and scare away any other driver) rather then use pickme or uber. The local authorities should really look into making it a more hospitable environment outside the hotel and keep the tourists coming.

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I chose Le Grand Galle to travel during the off-season period. We arrived to a warm, welcoming smile by Prasanna the baggage handler, and instantly felt at home! 
The check-in staff were also attentive, and provided us with maximum assurance and hospitability by kindly arranging an upgraded, Signature room! 

The welcome drinks also had plentiful cool and warm drinks to choose from and we were able to enjoy them in front of the truly beautiful view captured from the lobby floor. 

The signature room was the perfect room that overlooked the Galle fort, beach and the hotel garden and pool as well as clean facilities. 

The rest of the stay was spent on enjoying the set-menu meals, where all options were perfectly curated to the local and foreign preferences. Each meal from lunch to dinner to breakfast was able to be enjoyed because of the peaceful restaurant service provided by the restaurant staff such as Nihal Ranasinghe!

For those who enjoy exploring, the hotel garden had a convenient access stairway to the beach, a mini library, spa and a great outdoor view that wrapped around the beach coast letting you truly enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of Galle!

Overall, the staff, services and facilities provided by Le Grand Galle show that this hotel is definitely a must to return as it is family-friendly, traveller-friendly, and beautifully scenic! Thank you for such a wonderful experience!
title: Just Amazing!

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
Visited for 2 nights for some relaxation time after a trip around the country. Loved everything about this place! We didn't kite surf and didn't make a difference to our experience. Hired kayaks and went around the lagoon and I went galloping on horseback along the beach at sunset which was amazing! 
Despite it being very windy (typical for that time of year) the restaurant/bar area and the beach front villas are well designed that it didn't matter and were able to get out of the wind. Meant the flies were less of a problem too. 
We stayed in a beach villa and loved it! Felt very safe sleeping under mosquito nets and loved the outdoor shower. Enjoyed coming back from dinner and counting how many frogs had made an appearance. 
All I would say is the stay here was by far the most expensive place to stay and eat from our trip but for the remoteness of the place I can understand and would happily go back.
title: Perfect end to a perfect holiday around Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
Schönes Hotel mit tollen Cabanas, direkt am Meer.
Sehr freundliches und aufmerksames Personal. Gutes Frühstück und Buffetnachtessen mit einer guten Auswahl. 
Direkt am windigen Meer, wo man lange Spaziergänge unternehmen kann. Kite Möglichkeit um es mal auszutesten. Guter Lehrer. 
Schön eingerichtete Cabanas  mit toller Aussendusches/WC. 
Leider hat die Bar sehr früh geschlossen, somit muss man das Trinken mitnehmen, wenn man am späteren Abend noch ein Bier trinken möchte auf dem Balkon. 
Schöne Anlage, welche nicht überfüllt ist mit Häusern. Alles ist entspannt und man kann sich selber gut entspannen.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

First of all, we would thank you for taking the time to write us an Amazing review.

You have truly captured what Elements has to offer, and seems like you have fallen in love with the experience.

It's indeed so generous of you to write the review, and we fully understand why you were hesitant to do so. Don't worry the spirit of Elements will remain the same for years to come.

We would love to see with us again. Please let us know if you are planning on visiting Sri Lanka anytime soon.
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Come with an open mind
text:
It's not for everyone. It's perfect for me. Truly authentic and a perfectly wonderful rustic living resort with just the right amount of needed touches to add a spark. 

We loved it so much we are coming back for a month this summer. That should be a true testament. And I am not easy. 

I could actually imagine living at Elements for a year or more and never be tired of it.

Expect a feeling of wildness. Expect to never wear shoes. Go kiteboarding every day and lay on a hammock at the end. Walk alone the beach and visit with local fisherman. Marvel at the surroundings and how pristine and beautiful it is. Eat well. Dream well. And wonder why you ever paid a fortune to stay at resort factories elsewhere in the world.

This is NOT the place if you are expecting Dj clad resorts or Aman style pampering (or prices). This IS the place if you want to truly detach and let go. Manage your expectations as to what you are after and you will find a true gem. 

For kiteboarders, it is one of the best spots I have ever been to. As well, the area is brimming with other spots to explore reasonably by boat (direct from Elements) or by Tuk Tuk. But you will enjoy just right outside the door both a lagoon and the ocean with fantastic conditions. 

My only suggestion for Kiteboarders is to perhaps bring some of your own gear. The rental kites, boards etc here are adequate but could use a bit of TLC. Do not expect new and cutting edge kites and boards. 

Lastly, I confess to being reluctant to even post this review. I really don't want anyone else to discover it. But I also can't help but make sure that people understand the specialness of this location and lodge.
title: Leave Your Shoes at Home

ownerResponse/text:
