text:
Wir hatten wundervolle Tage im Elements Resort. Die Lakeville war ein Traum und ein bisher einmaliges Erlebnis für uns. Wir haben die Freundlichkeit und Offenheit sehr genossen. Durchweg alle Mitarbeiter sowie die Eigentümer haben uns immer mit einem Lächeln begrüßt und waren sehr zuvorkommend. Das Konzept des Resorts hat uns sehr gut gefallen. Auch hervorzuheben ist das grandiose leckere und frische Essen. Die im Resort lebenden Tiere waren eine tolle Bereicherung und haben uns ebenfalls ein Lächeln ins Gesicht gezaubert. Zu sehen wie alle friedlich miteinander leben war einfach toll.
Vielen Dank nochmal an das gesamte Team für diesen super schönen Aufenthalt und bis zum nächsten Mal.
title: Wundervoller Aufenthalt

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ashalina,

Thank you for taking your valuable time to write us a review and share your experience with the world.

We are sorry that you couldn't see the Dolphins.

Hope you will be able to see these beautiful creatures on your next visit to Elements.
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a really nice two night stay in Elements during the October half term. We had the resort to ourselves as it was low season for kite surfing.

We were very impressed with our beach villa - a beautiful, spacious hut with a stunning outdoor bathroom.

We also loved the resident animals - all the dogs, donkeys, horses and ox.

The staff were the best bit and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. My husband was unwell due to sunstroke and they gave him an aryuvedic tea to settle his stomach.

One thing to be aware of at this time of year - the flies were a big problem due to low wind. They were everywhere and really spoiled our dining experience sadly.

Even though dolphins are common in this area we were the unlucky 2% that didn’t see dolphins or whales on the morning trip. We were absolutely gutted and planned to do the trip on our second morning but we couldn’t go out due to bad weather. Elements gave us a 25% discount and were surprised we were so unlucky - this is the downside of travelling in low season - there were very few boats out so little information about where to find the beautiful creatures.
title: Beautiful place, would recommend

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text: What a week! Die Tage im Elements waren unglaublich! Alles hat wunderbar gepasst. Die Anlage ist sehr gross, gepflegt und lädt zum Verweilen ein. Das Cabana ist einfach und doch mit viel Liebe zum Detail eingerichtet. Das Aussenbadezimmer fanden wir ein Highlight. Das Essen war phänomenal & das Personal sehr freundlich und aufmerksam! Danke an das gesamte Team! Es hat uns so gut gefallen, dass wir am Ende unserer 3 Wochen Sri Lanka Ferien, direkt nochmals zurück kamen. Wer also Ruhe, leckeres Essen, freundliche Menschen, einen Strand zum Kitesurfen sucht, ist hier mehr als richtig. Wir kommen definitiv wieder und können es von ganzem Herzen empfehlen.
title: Sofort wieder :)

placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: A boutique style hotel with a relaxing pool area and well landscaped gardens, cookery demonstration meal excellent (we had both the crab & prawn curries prepared for us), breakfast choice a bit limited but evening menu plentiful & varied, staff friendly & helpful, service at meal times very good and all meals served in the restaurant (there is no separate bar) although staff were very quick to clear plates as soon as you’d finished, too quick really, which can be a little intrusive and the meal courses came in rapid succession (a break between each course would be preferable), the bedroom was comfortable & equipped with the basics for what we needed during our 2 night stay (the USB outlets didn’t work though and the air con although efficient was noisy as if it was blowing wind through the vents), the main road outside the hotel was busy at times and not many restaurants etc within walking distance but we were half board so that didn’t affect us and it was quiet overall at night apart few local barking dogs late on, plenty to see in Jaffna and the surrounding area including visiting the beautiful Buddhist and Hindu temples at Nagadeepa Island. Overall a decent stay.
title: Boutique Beauty

placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
We absolutely loved our three night stay here. The room, in a newly opened building, was very good, with a comfortable bed, excellent "showcase"  bathroom and all the amenities we needed. The garden setting was beautiful, and the food good, with plenty of choice, although a few more "non Sri Lankan" options would have been nice as my wife hates "curry". However what really set the Fox apart was the staff, at all levels, who were friendly, efficient and professional. 

A special mention should go to "AK" (Amith?) who took the trouble to remember our food and drink preferences, and spent time chatting about local places of interest, history etc and our plans for the rest of this trip.  He is a real credit to the hotel, as are his colleagues. The art display and historical photographs in the underground bunkers were an additional element that added to our stay.  

The Fox is a little out of the centre, not really walking distance, but that wasn't an issue for us.

Overall, a thoroughly enjoyable stay and it  has our strong recommendation if you plan to stay in Jaffna.
title: Beautiful place to stay when visiting the fascinating city of Jaffna

Obwohl praktisch direkt an einer Strasse gelegen, liegt dieses historische Haus mit turbulenter Vergangenheit sehr ruhig gelegen in einer wunderschönen idyllischen Gartenanlage.

roomTip: Try the Jaffna crab curry and visit the town near the fort
text:
Stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon, and we absolutely loved this place. I am a British Tamil and my wife is Portuguese,  this was her first visit to Jaffna ,and my 3rd. Jaffna has changed a lot since the end of the war- thank God l, and you can see how it is improving slowly.

This hotel is evidence of this and just loved the customer service,  food and everything they could offer such as the Jaffna crab curry cooking demo and the tunnels below showcasing the LTTE and an art exhibition. 

Can't recommend this hotel enough if your staying in Jaffna, the food is great and the staff have impeccable customer service.
title: Best boutique hotel in Sri Lanka not just Jaffna

placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had some problems with the booking date. We arrived too early and therefore they had no room left at this date. It was not easy to find a room in another hotel at this date. But they did not give up asking around and they organised us a room in another hotel and also the transfer to the hotel.

They arranged that the day after we could stay in a beautiful room back in the Fox.

Everything was perfect. The food was excellent and the dinner was served in the romantic garden. After the hustle and bustle of the city, you immerse yourself in an oasis. You wouldn't expect such a great big well-kept garden in this hectic city. The pool was nicely warm and inviting for swimming. We were there at the weekend and we saw prefotoshootings for several marriages. For us as foreigners this was very interesting and entertaining.

The whole team, including the chef in the kitchen, the serving staff, the manager, the people at the reception, was very kind and helpful. They were always present, attentive and hospitable.

We can highly recommend this excellently run hotel and we would like to thank you once again, especially Mr. Shane.
title: A very beautiful hotel with extremly helpful staff

ownerResponse/text:
Dear peterkN5230BW,

Wow! Thank you for your glowing review and perfect 10/10 rating of Fox Jaffna! We are absolutely thrilled to hear that your experience at Fox Jaffna was nothing short of sensational.

From our pristine pool to the authentic flavors of Jaffna cuisine, we’re so happy you enjoyed every aspect of your stay. Chef Pushpe and his team will be delighted to hear your praise, especially for the Kottu corner!

Your kind words about our team truly mean the world to us. Scotty’s dedication to learning and providing exceptional service is inspiring, and Kumar and the entire staff work hard to create a welcoming atmosphere. It’s wonderful to know their efforts made such a positive impact on your stay.

We’re also glad you appreciated the history and artistic theme of the hotel, including the wartime bunker turned art gallery. Fox Jaffna is a special place, and we love sharing its rich heritage with our guests.

Thank you again for your enthusiastic recommendation! We really hope to welcome you back for another unforgettable experience.

With kind regards,

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
What a wonderful oasis, the team here is exceptional. From the minute we came in to the minute we left it was sensational. 
Special mention of the pool, pristine and perfect temperature.
Food was an excellent representation of Jaffna cuisine and Chef Pushpe and his team are fantastic, the variety and quality perfect. 
My suggestion is to eat the local food, but omelettes and pastries are available.
Highlight was the Kottu corner which is excellent. 
Service!! Wow the waiters are so helpful speak excellent English. Scotty our waiter for most of the time told me he learnt how to speak English from you tube and speaking to himself in the mirror 
AK or Kumar was also brilliant. 
This team is led by a dedicated management team who work with the team and drive the vision of the company. 
Must see is the bunker, war time bunker turned into an art gallery, the theme of the hotel is Sri Lanka’s famous artists and each block is named in honour of one of them. 
Rooms are clean modern and fresh and each has a balcony, there are also 4 rooms in the original house. 
You will have to go there to learn about the history. House was built in 1908 and house a Maharaja.
title: Fox Jaffna 10/10

For visiting Jaffna the spot is perfect; a clean and serene lagoon of rest in a busy city. Rooms are spacious and utilities are great.
title: Relaxed stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear TravelAddict027,

Thank you for sharing your thoughtful review! We’re so pleased to hear that you loved your stay at Fox Jaffna, especially the amazing food. Our Jaffna crab curry is definitely a guest favorite! It’s also wonderful to know that our team, particularly our restaurant staff, made your dining experience special and accommodated your breakfast requests for local favourites.

We appreciate your feedback regarding your room in the heritage section. We’ve looked into the shlortcomings mentioned and taken measures to ensure a more comfortable stay for future guests.

It’s great to know that your parents’ room in the newer section was a perfect fit, and we’d be happy to assist with booking a room in that area for your next visit. We truly appreciate your insights and look forward to welcoming you and your family back to Fox Jaffna!

With warm regards

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
We loved our stay at Fox Jaffna. In particular the food was amazing, especially the Jaffna crab curry! The staff were amazing and very attentive- the food manager (?) checked in on us during multiple meals and very kindly accommodated our breakfast requests of dosa and hoppers! The resturant staff in particular were excellent and always helpful.

Our room was within the old/heritage section of the hotel. The room was clean and nice, the bathroom was lacking a shower screen (appeared to be removed?) so got a bit wet but not terrible and we didnt mention it to the staff. The room did get a little warm at night (there is AC & fan), i think AC unit may hit a certain temp or running time and cut out potentially. As a result we did get a few mosquitoes in the room and had some bites during the night, nothing unbearable just a little annoying. Most mornings there were multiple wedding photos taking place on the grounds and you could hear them (very quietly shuffling outside) - if you're a light sleeper you may wake to them (my husband did but my daughter and I did not).

Next time we come I'd book a room in the newer section at the back. My parents room was in that section and was great - all the minor room issues would be resolved by booking the different room.
title: Lovely oasis in Jaffna

ownerResponse/text:
Dear harianitin,

Thank you for your kind review of Fox Jaffna! We’re delighted that you and your wife had a memorable stay at our boutique oasis. It’s so great to hear that you enjoyed the tranquility of our garden, the cleanliness of our rooms, and the unique experience of seeing couples capturing their special moments at our property.

We’re especially pleased that you enjoyed our à la carte vegetarian offerings and that Orwill (Trevine) and our team made your stay even more special. Your appreciation for the history and art showcased in our bunkers means a lot to us, as we take great pride in preserving Jaffna’s rich cultural heritage.

Your recommendation truly means the world to us, and we would love to welcome you back for another wonderful stay in the future!

With warmest regards,

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Watch out for  couples having their pre wedding photos being taken especially over the weekends in early morning.
text: My wife and i stayed for two nights at Fox Jaffna. This  is a boutique hotel situated near the main road but the rooms at the back. The rooms were very clean and set up in an immaculate garden area . One day early morning we saw lots of couples  having their pre wedding photographs taken. The food in the restaurant was lovely. My wife and I are both vegetarians so we ordered the food from the ala carte menu.  Orwill (resort manager) was brilliant and he looked after us very well. All the staff were very good. Also, there are two bunkers where one of then you can read the history of Jaffna and the second bunker has some the paintings (copy) of the artists from Sri Lanka. I would highly recommend this hotel. One of the best.
title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel in Jaffna

roomTip: This resort is very popular, especially during peak season — be sure to book well in advance to get the room type you prefer.
text:
From the moment we arrived, everything about our stay at 98 Acres was simply exceptional. Nestled among the stunning hills of Ella, the resort offers breathtaking panoramic views that make you feel completely immersed in nature. The setting is peaceful, serene, and perfect for anyone looking to relax and unwind.

The rooms were beautifully designed — spacious, clean, and blending perfectly with the natural surroundings. Waking up to the sight of Little Adam's Peak right outside our balcony was absolutely unforgettable.

The staff were warm, friendly, and attentive throughout our stay. Every detail was taken care of with a smile, and they truly went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed.

We also enjoyed the delicious food at the restaurant, with a great mix of local and international options. The spa experience was equally wonderful — relaxing and professional with the most calming atmosphere.

Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Ella. It’s the perfect combination of luxury, comfort, and natural beauty. We can't wait to come back!
title: Five-Star Experience in the Heart of Ella

Dear Valued Guest, 

Ayubowan!

Thank you very much for taking the time to share such a detailed review of your recent family holiday with us at 98 Acres Resort & Spa.

We’re truly pleased to know you enjoyed the stunning views, spacious and thoughtfully designed rooms, and the wonderful atmosphere throughout your stay. It’s great to hear that you found the food and live music memorable and that waking up to Ella’s breath taking landscape was a highlight of your experience.

We sincerely apologize, however, for the inconvenience you faced during the Pekoe Trail excursion. Your feedback regarding the lack of briefing, the pace of the guide, and the unexpected conditions is deeply appreciated and has already been shared with our team. Please rest assured, we are taking corrective steps to ensure all future nature tours are clearly explained, properly guided, and sensitive to our guests’ comfort and preparedness.

Your comments help us grow, and while we regret the shortcomings you encountered, we are thankful they did not overshadow the overall joy of your stay. We would love to welcome you and your family back for an even more enjoyable and seamless experience.

A J Pragash
Front Office Manager
98 Acres Resort and Spa
placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our second stop in Sri Lanka with family. 
We were all so in awe of the amazing picturesque views from pretty much every area of the facility. Our rooms had endless views of the canyon and mini Adams peak. So wonderful to wake up to and have a relaxing morning on the balcony. 
The room was so well layed out and spacious. Especially the shower and being able to look at the view while enjoying the rain head shower. 
Only negative would be to put a screen on the balcony door so you have the option of leaving open to allow ventilation. Especially as there is no AC. The fan however was ok. 
The restaurant and food was outstanding. Great touch having live music every night. 
One very disappointing experience was the Pekou tour that was organised by the staff manager with their inhouse naturalist (Sam). It was for 5 of us which cost 50usd each. Very expensive but we were happy to pay for the experience. 
Unfortunately Sam did not explain too much and seemed to be in a hurry as he was always well ahead of half of us. We asked for a toilet break only to be told there was not one available. 
Towards the end we wend down a very challenging descent which was very overgrown and we all experienced scratches and irritations as we had shorts. Sam had trousers and was oblivious to this. 
We were very disappointed with Sam and his lack of attention and knowledge of the area. 
Please in future pre-warn the guests of what to expect so we could be better prepared. Overall the 3 hour walk was very enjoyable and challenging. 
This did not take away from the excellent experience at your facility.
title: Family Holiday Experience

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
The views at 98 Acres are unmatched! Looking out over all of Ella at sunrise was such an incredible experience.

The room was also gorgeous. We stayed in a suite, and the room had a GIANT soaking tub - like took 40 minutes to fill giant. It was SO wonderful to relax in after a long day! The staff also left us a beautiful bed design to celebrate our anniversary upon check-in, which was a wonderful extra touch!

The hotel offers a lot to do and you could easily spend a few days here. The on-site restaurant was very good, and the breakfast was large and delicious.

We only had one issue during our stay. During check-out, they were so kind as to do a blessing for my husband and I, giving us each a bracelet and box of tea. Immediately following, housekeeping came up and tried to imply we stole a face towel, which we absolutely did not. And despite a few minutes of back and forth, we left feeling really weird about it.

A great experience overall.
title: The views!!!!

text:
We stayed here for our honeymoon, and it was truly a memorable experience. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed with a traditional pooja-style greeting that made us feel special. The hotel also surprised us with a lovely honeymoon cake , which was such a thoughtful gesture and made our stay even more meaningful.

The view from the property is absolutely breathtaking — peaceful and serene. It’s also a great location for adventure lovers, with hiking to Little Adam’s Peak nearby, plus a swing and zipline experience right next to the hotel.

All the staff were friendly and helpful, and even during our departure, the hospitality was excellent. However, we did face a small issue with the shuttle service for dinner. Despite calling in advance as instructed, the shuttle was not sent. After waiting, we had to walk. I reported the issue to the manager, who kindly assured me that they are working to improve their standards and ensure this doesn’t happen again.

Aside from that, everything was wonderful — peaceful surroundings, warm service, and special moments. Highly recommend for couples and nature lovers alike. Looking forward to visiting again!
title: Beautiful Stay with Scenic Views, Warm Welcome & Great Activities

text:
We had a great time at 98 Acres Resort and Spa. It was our first time here. The resort is located in a breathtaking landscape, and the view from the room is absolutely unmatched.

The highlights for us were the food and the spa. They offer a really good selection of Sri Lankan cuisine—elevated just enough to feel special, but still authentic and full of Sri Lankan hospitality. It’s also reasonably priced. If you’re not in the mood for Sri Lankan food, their Western options are also excellent. I recommend the Eggs Benedict.

The spa area has beautiful views, and it’s a lovely place to relax while being pampered. Again, the prices are very reasonable for the quality of the experience.

Suggestions for the hotel: It would be great if the hotel offered some excursions in their brochure, like private tours to nearby waterfalls or small adventures to make the most of the area.

Overall, I can’t wait to come back again.
title: A Perfect Getaway in the Hills – 98 Acres Resort and Spa

text:
Beautiful hotel and surroundings, the views from the room are second to none. We had a special welcome blessing, and welcome drink which were lovely and appreciated after a long drive. The staff were so lovely and attentive and the customer service was fantastic. As we were there on our honeymoon we also had a complimentary small marriage ceremony and some other extra touches which were lovely. 

The hotel is not far from the centre of Ella, which is easily accessed by tuktuk. Beach club, zip line and Nine Arch bridge are all walking distance which was really handy. Hotel does a guided walk to Little Adams Peak every morning for sunrise which was beautiful and only around 20 minutes. 

Room is turned over twice a day and very clean. Hotel restaurant was very good at catering to dietary requirements in my experience. 
Would recommend taking some good mosquito repellent whilst you’re there.
title: Perfect honeymoon experience

text:
Das 98 Acres Resort war eines unserer Highlights in Sri Lanka. Die Lage ist atemberaubend – eingebettet in die grüne Hügellandschaft mit Blick auf den Little Adam’s Peak fühlt man sich sofort angekommen und verbunden mit der Natur.

Besonders in Erinnerung bleibt uns das ausgezeichnete Frühstück direkt am Bett: frisch, vielfältig und liebevoll angerichtet – mit regionalen Produkten und einem Ausblick, der jeden Morgen zu einem Erlebnis macht. Ob frisches Obst, lokale Spezialitäten oder ein perfekt zubereiteter Kaffee – hier wird Genuss großgeschrieben.

Die Architektur aus Naturmaterialien passt sich harmonisch der Umgebung an, und die Atmosphäre im ganzen Resort ist entspannt und herzlich. Ideal zum Entspannen, Genießen und Durchatmen.

Wir wären gerne länger geblieben – ein Ort, an den man sich mit Freude zurückerinnert!
title: Ein traumhafter Aufenthalt inmitten der Natur – absolut empfehlenswert!

text:
Absolutely stunning resort right from the beautiful welcome. 
We booked ourselves in for 2 nights at very late notice and we arrived early evening, we were accommodated very quickly, our stay was for 2 nights and wow, the room was lovely, the view stunning! 
The food was so good! The best club sandwich and breakfast was also up there. We did the 5.30am Adam’s peak climb with the hotel guide. Highly recommend, with tea and cookies on our return. 
So disappointed we didn’t get to stay longer. But we would return without a doubt. 
If there was one niggle that would be that the mosquito net was useless! Please get a proper rail with weighted nets.
title: Beautiful hotel with beautiful views

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If accessibility is an issue, request a room / villa close to pool and restaurant as there are lots of steps and steep hills to navigate
text:
Our final stop in Sri Lanka after experiencing 2 of the other Resplendent Ceylon properties ( Tea Trails and Wild Cost Tented Safari)

Sprawling grounds with clusters of villas featuring their own private swimming pools.

Highlights included 

The Cliff Edge moon pool - stunning location and views. The staff at the Cocoon Bar were super friendly and always looking out to offer us a cool drink

Restaurant - the staff were flawless. The Executive Chef came out the first night to say hello and to discuss any requirements and subsequently arranged the most delicious Sri Lankan meal. Each meal was delicious and beautifully presented.

The Spa and Ali - I visited three times during my stay for various treatments including the 90 minute Ceylonese massage which was heaven. Ali was brilliant. The spa could do with a steam room and sauna to complete the overall experience.

The Front of House staff - for the warm welcome and personal farewell, assisting with our transfers and also day trip requirements. Plus a special gesture ( and much appreciated one) offering us a late check out to prepare for a late flight out of Colombo

The thoughtful gardener - he saw how delighted I was to have a peacock on our balcony. The very next day he brought me a peacock feather which was such  nice gesture.
title: South Coast serenity

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for your review-it is important for us in order to deliver the level of service we pride ourselves on delivering. 

We truly appreciate your candid feedback and are delighted we were able to make your honeymoon stay with us a positive, memorable one.

 We look forward to welcoming you again!
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I have been on our honeymoon in Sri Lanka and we have stayed at some incredible locations along the way I.e Ceylon Tea trails (part of the Resplendent group) and Anantara Tangalle. Cape Weligama was our last big stop in the country. We were here for 3 nights and 4 days.

Coming from Ceylon tea trails and Anantara (more similar to Cape weligama) - we had the same level of expectations when it came to the level of service and room amenities.

Initially when we were shown our premier villa we were blown away by the view, outdoor living area, spaciousness, cake and Prosecco upon arrival - first impressions were overall very good. 

However we noticed some shortcomings to do with the room and general service (although staff are lovely and sweet) they weren’t as attentive compared to the other locations. 

We shared our honest feedback with the hotel and they have blown us away by how they have treated our concerns. 

On the second to last day Monty (GM) himself went out of his way along with his staff to ensure my husband and I would end up having a memorable and beautiful stay with Cape Weligama. They have really taken on board our feedback and have completely changed our minds about the place. They were able to move us to an even better room, offered us a complimentary evening dinner and met all our needs. 

Needless to say, after this will be back to stay at Cape Weligama. 

Thank you again to the Resplendent group - and in particular Monty, Udith, Divendra at Cape Weligama for contributing to our wonderful time in Sri Lanka.
title: Honeymoon in Cape Weligama

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for sharing your experience  at Cape Weligama with us.  We truly appreciate your wonderful, detailed review. We are delighted your stay was  memorable and lived up to to your expectations. 

It’s especially heartening to know that our team, made a significant impact on your stay. We have shared your positive feedback with the team and thanked them on your behalf. Your constructive feedback is much appreciated and will be looked into. 

We look forward to welcoming you again in the future!
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The villas at the western side of the resort offer the most serene situation
text:
This was our first visit to Sri Lanka, which we were looking forward to as part of our winter tour including Maldives, Sri Lanka, Thailand and a return to the cold UK through Oman and Quatar. Our 25 yrs son spoke highly of his experience during his backpacker/surfer visits to Sri Lanka, but we were looking for a higher level of comfort.
Cape Weligama is a member of the Relais and Chateaux hotel association. We have a friend amongst the management team at R&C whose advice I sought prior to our decision to book. I personally don’t enjoy Indian spices although my wife loves curry, hence the combination of western and local cooking at the resort was important. The resort scored perfectly well in that respect, overall, the food offering is very good.
We had booked a King bedded Master Suite and were allocated one in the eastern beach side of the property at ground floor level overlooking the “family” swimming pool in the “Arthur C Clarke” building of 4 suites.  The villa blocks are named after reputed writers, personalities, or navigators, coincidentally my wife’s maiden name is “Clarke”. We were a little disappointed with the view from our ground floor suite, the upper-level suites have more light, especially on the west side of the resort (closer to the adults-only halfmoon shape pool). During the first 24 hours there seemed an absence of senior management presence at the resort, but this significantly changed on our second day when having expressed our disappointment, the assistant Executive Director Mr da Silva met with us and expressed his objective was to ensure our full satisfaction. Since then we received an outstanding level of personal attention to our needs thought our stay.
Two days prior to departure, we received a complimentary upgrade to one of the higher elevation villas – this was very appreciated and offered spectacular sunset and ocean views with an abundance of wildlife proximity. Should we return, this would be the sector of the property that we would prefer.
The rooms are well constructed with good quality furnishings. Not quite the latest technology seen in more modern luxury hotels, but the internet connectivity was excellent, and everything works. The rooms resemble the earlier Aman properties we stayed in such as Amanpulo in Philippines.
There is direct access to a small beach where the hotel has a rustic bar with limited drinks. We sensed that this area could be improved with more extensive cocktails and smartened up.
As a guest you are assigned a “curator” or butler who’s role is as an individual concierge and point of contact with the hotel. Our curator “the Brilliant Brenden” was very attentive, and instantly responsive on WhatsApp, not only helping whist in the resort, but also being on hand and contactable during our off-property excursions.
Another star performer in their team was Mr Senith, the restaurant manager. Each day we would discuss our bespoke menu, and which place and time we would like to eat. These intimate dinners were a big plus to us offering variety and complete segregation when we wanted it, or mixed dining with other guests when we preferred. The Chef’s “Tableau” by example was a fun evening very well done, as was snapper fish cooked to our own recipe with roasted fennel and hollandaise sauce, as well as curry for my wife!
Activities included a marine biodiversity experience on a catamaran. This requires a 6am hotel departure. We do find nature and marine life interesting, and we encountered multiple dolphin pods, sadly we didn’t get to see a Blue Whale. The experience which included a swim and lunch at anchor near the port was not ideal, the sea was not particularly clean and visibility was impaired for snorkelling. Although we are boating enthusiasts, this would not be an adventure we would repeat.
Cape Weligama now has a dedicated naturalist, Mr Damitha who is very knowledgeable and added further engagement for us in the environment. Damitha is a recent addition to the team and should be encouraged to develop a broader range of nature activities. The property is home to numerous wild species. Complimenting the families of roaming Peacock we saw Indian palm chipmunk, monkeys, iguana, lots of beautiful birds and a quite rare civet.
The resort offers a range of spa treatments and massages that were professionally delivered. My afternoon Balinese massage performed by therapist Mega was a daily treat! However, the spa building does lack a relaxation area or any steam room/sauna plunge pool facilities which would be a welcome improvement.
Incidentally, prior to arriving in Sri Lanka I discovered that the production and sale of cigars is prohibited anywhere in Sri Lanka. This is a negative to be aware of; cigar smokers should travel with adequate stock for the duration of stay.  Thankfully, I stocked up at our previous destination and enjoyed my Habana cigar most evenings after intimate dinner with a welcome cognac or scotch whisky over a game of chess. Some political lobbying from the tourist department about cigars might be an initiative to create a useful concession in the rule.
This review is written from a global travel context using global not local comparisons. Overall Cape Weligama provided great personalised service and comfort throughout the eight days of our visit and is likely to be a destination of excellence by Sri Lankan standards. I would highly recommend it as a luxury destination for a global luxury traveller.
title: Luxury on Sri Lanka’s south coast

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

Thank you for your feedback on your stay with us. We truly appreciate your valuable insights and feedback as we are constantly striving to improve our special blend of hospitality.

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Had a pleasant stay at the Cape Weligama in early January.

Positives:

Beautiful location and Spectacular views.
Had Some of the best laid out rooms of our Srilanka tour
Had Some of the best food we had in our Srilanka tour.

Good access to the South region including the charming town of Galle.

We enjoyed our time here.

Negatives:

Service Level was not in line with expectations for an ultra lux resort.  Customization, be it tours or meals, was accommodated but after making it feel that you were being granted a "favor" , rather than a welcome and natural accommodation of the requests.

Staff communication was not as expected.    Hotel Senior Management was not at all visible, in contrast to all the other hotels we stayed at in our Sri Lanka tour.

The biggest negative is the value and quality of the "experiences" offered.  In my opinion massively overpriced in relation to what is provided

The beach is tiny. If you are looking for beach access it may be better to stay somewhere else (maybe the nearby Marriott).

All in all, this is a good hotel that could do a lot better by raising its service level and providing better value.
title: Nice Stay at the Cape Weligama

placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:
This villa is absolutely stunning. Everything is meticulously designed for comfort and elegance. My husband and I spent 3 nights of our honeymoon at this villa and we couldn't have imagined a more perfect place. The manager, Ruwan, was very helpful to us and gave us lots of suggestions for places to see and things to do. He was attentive to make sure we were taken care of. The food was also amazing. Even though we stayed during COVID and there weren't as many things to do in Galle, my husband and I were very content spending time in the villa as the view is nice and the pool is also relaxing. While we were there, a family of monkeys passed through the trees and one of the staff members gave us bread and banana to feed them!

Something I appreciate was the mosquito repellent lotion in the room. I get bitten by mosquitoes all the time, but the lotion that Taru Villas makes and provides in the rooms was really great. I wish I could have taken it with me!

Also, the turndown service in the evening is very nice as we're able to come back to our room after being out during the day and the sheets and towels are replaced and everything feels refreshed. 

It was an all around amazing experience and I would definitely recommend everyone to stay there.
title: The Perfect Honeymoon Spot!

placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:
Let's be clear - we are fans of Taru, as the small chain of boutique hotels offer luxury and elegance and excellent service.

Rampart Street fits into the brief perfectly. It is a gorgeous house with a colonial feel, great art on the walls and spotlessly clean.

The staff are just lovely. Friendly and professional, and keen to offer any help and advice, or just to let you get on with it.

The modest pool was a godsend, as Galle was very hot on our visit. We have been a number of times, however never stayed at hotel with a pool - and now I would say that it  is a pre-requisite (for us). 

The food was great - a good selection of classic dishes, both Sri Lankan and international, and served with pride. Very tasty, good size portions and a nice dining space.

Unusually for us, we did make use of the communal lounge area, watch a a couple of films - and that was fun, as we almost felt like we were residents of Galle !

So, all in, we 100% recommend the hotel !!
title: Fabulous boutique luxury in the heart of Galle Fort

text: Wow this Villa is amazing and the hospitality is even better. Set right in the fort the location is ideal for exploring Galle however this place is so lovely you may not want to!! The staff are incredible and the food is lovely. Setting is beautiful old Dutch house with gorgeous outdoor pool with sun and shade. The rooms I mean wow the best room I’ve ever stayed in with the most amazing bath. It was our last night of honeymoon and I only wish we stayed here longer. Gorgeous room and people. The villa itself is a galle expiernece - the architecture, the art work it’s all breath taking. I could of sat there for years reading- they have tons of books on Sri Lanka and Galle. Couldn’t recommend more.  They also give you amazing homemade ice lolly by the pool! Such lovely little touches.
title: Perfect end to our honeymoon!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear GeorgiaLR,

Thank you for your review and for providing your constructive feedback.

We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.

Due to Sri Lanka's tropical climate, mosquitoes are unfortunately prevalent throughout the country. However, we take every precaution to ensure that this does not affect our guests - this includes monthly pest control treatment for the entire property, mosquito coils placed in public areas and citronella oil burners placed in each room . We also place a bottle of our home-made mosquito repellent in each room. 

Despite this, we understand that mosquitoes can still be an issue. Your feedback has been passed on to our team at Rampart Street so that they can do their best to counteract this issue. 

Thank you for bringing this to our attention, and we hope you return for another stay at Rampart Street on your next visit to Sri Lanka.

Kind Regards,
Team Taru Villas
placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
text:
This is an absolute gem of a hotel in the beautiful Galle Fort. 4 rooms, it's an old colonial house now turned boutique hotel. The staff are fantastic, excellent service, nothing is too much trouble. All meals are whenever you want them, and whatever you'd like - top service hospitality, equal to a 5 star hotel. 

The only two niggles: the sheer volume of mosquitos was incredible, but little the hotel can do about this! Mosquito net over the beautiful 4 poster bed, but didn't stop the little wotsits getting in. Secondly, the bathroom for room #2 is only accessible from the balcony, not directly from the room - so you really need to assess whether that middle of the night wee is worth going outside with the mozzies!

Excellent hotel, highly recommend!
title: Excellent hotel, you must stay here!

roomTip: Book a room on the 1st floor with the sea view
text:
I stayed at Taru at Rampart street in early July for 2 nights .I must say  this is  such a lovely place to stay  .Taru is a unique Dutch Villa located in the Galle Fort  with limited number of rooms and the service is personalized . Love the Dutch style interior  and the  bathroom is spacious and the bath  tub with the view is a must try .   Food choices on the menu and the quality of the dished are not that great  but I will give it a miss considering the most fantastic service and the beautiful stay .

The staff  at the reception was extremely helpful and he is more like an all rounder being the waiter and sometimes your housekeeper. I totally slipped his name in my mind . 

There is a lovely small swimming pool at the atrium area . Easy access to all the other shopping streets in Galle Fort. 

I cannot wait to make it there again and look forward to another lovely stay . Thank you for making my stay wonderful .
title: If it's a stay in Galle  Taru is the best to choose from  . A fanstatic holiday !

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Respected Guests,
Warm greetings from the team at Aarunya Resort!

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback following your recent stay. We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed your experience, especially appreciating our offerings, attentive service, and dedicated staff. Your kind words serve as motivation for us to strive for excellence every day.

We eagerly await the opportunity to welcome you back for another memorable stay. If there's anything we can assist you with regarding future bookings or if you have any further feedback to share, please feel free to reach out to us directly.

Warm regards,
Sumeda Yasaratne
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text:
I first heard of Aarunya Resort when a friend recommended it. He struggled to describe his experience. It was a curious combination of excitement and awe which didn’t make sense at the time but piqued my interest. 

I finally did book in for a night in February 2024. I was greeted on arrival at the car park and a buggy was sent over for my bags. At reception were 4 individuals who were ever willing to assist me with any queries I had. A glass of fresh Amberalla (a type of local mango) juice and a 5 min relaxing neck massage from the on-location wellness spa attendant set the tone.

I was curious to see the resort so Gayan; the chief ambassador and I hopped into a buggy. The next 30 mins was most amazing. Even though I now live in the UK; I was born and have lived & worked in Sri Lanka for 25 years but never appreciated the sheer natural beauty that this country has to offer.  Dusk was approaching; the mist and darkness made the distant mountainous terrain look like the backdrop of a movie set. I was privileged to have seen the landscape at that specific time and let the image permeate and imprint itself into my psyche.

The final stop was the spas. Aarunya Resort has an on-site western wellness spa and an Ayurvedic clinic too. I decided on an Ayurveda massage which had me encased in a paste made from indigenous leaves and herbs. The clinic therapist was very knowledgeable and explained the entire process at every step.

Massage complete and now to my room. Each villa is named after the trees/bushes which surround it. I stayed in ‘Pepper’ with ‘Clove’ and ‘Nutmeg’ being about 20 meters further down the path. The villa has it’s own dipping pool with a view of the mountains.  The room was extremely spacious, decorated in a colonial style with an enormous en-suite. A four poster bed, a divan, a seating area and an office desk (with connectivity) occupied the room’s ample space. The free mini bar, some resort-chef made chocolates, Wi-Fi and satellite TV enabled me the home comforts I required for the hour before dinner.

The menu clearly had the luxurious touch and each dish was lovingly crafted and presented. The enormous wine list was quite unique for Sri Lanka too. Truly a 5 star experience.

The next morning, I walked around the resort to marvel at the natural landscape. The resort is situated on 10 acres of land and has 8 private pool villas with incredible views. There is a meeting room, library and a fully equipped gym on-site. Walking though the tea bushes, I discovered an open air tea room which serves high-tea. The rustic yoga studio is next to the spas and was in full swing and so was the village hut where guests learn about local agriculture and partake in a traditional meal made within the hut.

The resort is surrounded by nature trails and is 30mins away from a golf course and also the city of Kandy. Many of the guests had returned from a day’s excursion and relaxation was the focus.

My realisation is that this resort is a labour of love - there is a certain meticulousness to the detail at every turn. From the light switches to the sloping of the roof lights, from the wording on the menu to the presentation on the plate; it’s just so perfectly aligned with the vision of it’s creator.

The breakfast choice was western or Sri Lankan. I chose Sri Lankan and was not disappointed. Six courses of wonderfully prepared local cuisine. Just enough to tickle the taste buds with whole lot of flavour. 

This resort needs to be experienced first-hand. No amount of description can do it justice. I was there barely 24 hours but this experience will live with me forever. Thank you Aarunya Resort, we shall meet again.
title: An Experience Like No Other

placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
roomTip: - Consider remoteness: absolutely no chance of reaching anything (e.g. supermarket, restaurants) by foot
text:
Stayed there as a couple in a tented sky villa for a few days and can say this hotel is a real blizz with just some minor things to consider before booking: 

Pros:
- Beautiful design and breathtaking view into the djungle (depending on the room type)
- Ideal for relaxing
- Staff is super friendly and always helpful
- Good (but bit pricy) food
- Butler service, in-room dining and minibar free of charge

Cons:
- Especially for Sri Lanka super expensive
- Air condition in tented sky villa is (by principle) not very helpful because the tent heats up super quickly. We tried to let it run almost all the time at the lowest temperature possible and it was still so warm that it was hard to sleep at night
- Condition of tented sky villa and its interior was a bit used and had at some places stains
- Location is a bit remote between Kandy and Dambulla - consider this if you plan to make trips to Kandy, Dambulla or Sigiriya
title: Real blizz with some minor cons

text:
The resort is incredible, probably the nicest location I have ever stayed in. 

The rooms are the height of luxury and the staff are incredibly attentive. 
They were able to arrange a cooking class for us on incredibly short notice, the food being the nicest curry I’ve ever had! I also made some requests before arriving at the hotel, to have a surprise left in the room for my girlfriend on arrival and everything was done exactly how I asked. 

Unfortunately, there were a few technical issues with the room, such as the hot tub not heating up to be hot and the controller for the AC wasn’t working as it should. There was also some building work going on at the resort which was next to our villa so there was some noise in the morning (this may only be applicable to the villa we stayed in). 

However, the pros far outweighed the cons and we would love to stay again!

Thank you to everyone who made our stay so fantastic!
title: The most beautiful places I’ve ever stayed

text:
Words can barely capture the magic of our recent family getaway at Aarunya Nature Resort in December. Nestled amidst breathtaking Sri Lankan hills, this intimate haven surpassed every expectation, offering a symphony of breathtaking scenery, luxurious comfort, and impeccable service.

From the moment we arrived, we were captivated by the resort's breathtaking setting. Lush greenery hugged our private villa, with the majestic Mountains painting a dramatic backdrop (we even could see Hunnas Falls from our room). 

Our villa was a haven of tranquillity. Stepping inside was like entering a luxurious cocoon, with minimalist elegance blending seamlessly with warm Sri Lankan touches. My sun loved having his own bed in the spacious room, while we had the king-sized bed and private pool and jacuzzi on the balcony – the perfect spot to unwind with a glass of wine under the starlit sky. Every detail, from the plush towels to the locally sourced toiletries, exuded quality and thoughtfulness.

The staff at Aarunya truly made our stay unforgettable. Their genuine warmth and attentiveness were unparalleled. Every request was met with a smile and a can-do attitude. We had almost all our meals at our private villa and only had breakfast at the main dining area with stunning views.

Aarunya offered everything we needed on a holiday and leaving it was bittersweet, but we carried with us a deep sense of gratitude for the experience. It wasn't just a vacation; it was a complete immersion into nature's splendour, luxurious comfort, and genuine Sri Lankan hospitality. Aarunya is more than just a resort; it's a piece of paradise, a sanctuary for the soul, and a place we will undoubtedly return to for years to come.

5 stars – highly recommend!
title: Paradise Found: 5-Star Serenity at Aarunya Nature Resort

ownerResponse/text:

We eagerly look forward to the opportunity to host you again soon. Should you require any assistance with future reservations or have additional feedback to share, please don't hesitate to contact us directly.

Warm regards,

Magnificent vistas from our room, supported by superb personal service, and exemplary cuisine, made for an unforgettable family holiday.
Never thought I would so much enjoy torrential rain, or being able to almost touch the clouds.
There were some challenges  (that would in no way detract from this place being uniquely remarkable): 
isolated; occasional loss of hydro; slippery surfaced here and there; and my bed was rock hard).
Still; we are so glad to have visited Aarunya, and enjoyed the warm hospitality of the entire team.
A must visit.
P.S. We uniformly loved the outdoor shower.

text:
One of the best couple's retreats in Sri Lanka. Me and my wife were awestruck by the amazing views and hotel infrastructure, considering how well nature has been blended to give both a luxurious and environment friendly feel our stay.

Hospitality level were top notch. From breathtaking views to the plush interior and facilities, we couldn't have asked for a better place to spend our 13th wedding anniversary. The food was amazing with majority of the ingredients freshly sourced from their estate.

Special mention to Ms Kusala who made the reservation and booking a seamless process and had us checked in in not time. Very courteous and warm welcome was given by herself and the team. Also want to make special mention of Namal from F&B who served us the meals timely and engaged in conversation to explain the surroundings and experience that was on offer at the premise. 

All in all a great place for honeymooners or couples!!!

text: A friend recommended Elements and it did not disappoint!  The whole team works hard to make everyone's experience enjoyable and memorable.  While the chefs, Roy and Ifam serve up delicious meals morning, noon, and night- especially the Sambal,  roti bread and grilled shrimp, Suranjan mixes a mean cocktail and is spot on whenever your glass needs a refill.  The manager, Samith was also there, checking and making sure all our accommodations were taken care of, whether it be SCUBA, visiting Wilpattu National Park, taxis to the airport or early morning takeaway breakfasts- he takes care of the details to a T.  Hashan, the kite instructor, was patient and provided much humor during my attempts at kite surfing.  Our accommodations were crisp and clean and provided a relaxing environment when we wanted alone time.  We appreciate the care the team has for the environment and the local community. Thanks, Sylvie and Marcel for creating such a wonderfully peaceful, yet active getaway.  Hoping to see ya'll again.
title: Let's Go Kiting!

text:
Elements Beach & Nature Resort in Kalpitiya, Sri Lanka is an exceptional destination that offers a unique blend of luxury and natural beauty. The resort's stunning location on the beach and its serene atmosphere make it the perfect place to unwind and relax.
As for the manager, Samith, he is truly outstanding. He is extremely friendly, professional, and always goes the extra mile to ensure that his guests have a memorable stay. Samith's dedication to his guests is exemplary and his knowledge of the local area and activities is impressive.
The resort itself is beautifully designed and maintained, with comfortable and stylish accommodations that offer breathtaking views of the ocean. The facilities are excellent, including a lovely swimming pool and restaurant.
Overall, I highly recommend Elements Beach & Nature Resort in Kalpitiya, Sri Lanka, and commend Samith for his excellent management and service.
title: Exceptional Destination

text:
Firstly, everyone should know it is perfectly safe to travel Sri Lanka and we experienced no restrictions or uneasy situations at all in 3 weeks (round trip and chillout at Elements). 

Elements Resort is a wonderful cozy place in the middle of the nature. Swiss-German operated family business directly at sea and lagoon. Very nice and clean houses, delicious Srilankan and Western food. Eco place with horses, donkeys, doggies and a working bull. Own organic garden. Our kids started learn kite surfing from scratch with a friendly and helpful instructor. Various options on sea or lagoon, for different levels of wind and experience. Also the family did SUP on the lagoon. 

Thanks go to Sylvie & Marcel and their wonderful team. We can't wait to be back.
title: Wonderful hideout at the beach!

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
Elements beach Resort was the perfect start of our Sri Lankan road trip. It is located between the lagoon and the ocean. 
We had a lovely beach villa. The villa has a porch swing and a giant hammock to enjoy the view. 
It is owned by a very nice Swiss-German family and their two lovely daughters.  They are always inn for a chat and are very passionate about their project and involving the local community. 
We were there 2 nights with our two boys 14y and 11 y old and had a great time. The dolphin watching tour was amazing. The boys swam in the ocean for hours and there was a lovely pool.  We could borrow bodyboards and had lots of fun. You can also learn how to kite if you are in to that. 
The food is excellent and the waiters were very friendly, funny and helpfull. We got fresh tuna and  traditional Sri Lankan curries. We asked not to add all the spice, because our European taste buds can not take it, and it was perfect. 
There are donkeys on the beach and several, well cared for, dogs and cats. 
We were really sad to leave and would go back there in a heartbeat. 
Definitely worth doing a detour for this hotel.
title: Hidden Gem

text:
I visited ELEMENTS with my two teenage sons and a few friends. In the midst of a growing severe economic crisis in SriLanka our time spent at Elements was outstanding. Despite facing a lack of fuel and having to wait for days to fill a tank our car transfer worked flawlessly and the Elements team in general did a great job making us feel welcomed and cared for. 
My highlights among kitesurfing in both the waves and flat water lagoon was the amazing tasty fresh cooked food and of course the super cute beach villa built with so much ambience and style. 
A big high five to Mr. Marcel Bobay, his family and team for creating such a unique space !
title: Visit in midst economic crisis

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
Such an amazing place to spend kitesurfing holidays and to relax.
The staff is super friendly, everything was perfectly organised, food is super delicious and the resort in general is just a beautiful place on the beach and in the nature. We stayed as a couple in a lagoon villa and can highly recommend.

The kite spot is a dream for every kitesurfer. On one side there is a lagoon with flat water, on the other side you can ride in the open sea and enjoy the waves.

We have visited the resort in July 2022 during the crisis in Sri Lanka. But in the Elements Resort we did not notice much. Everything worked perfectly! The transfer from and to the airport was organised from Elements and worked, although there is a big fuel crisis in Sri Lanka.
There is no reason to not visit the Elements Resort in this crisis. As the country depends a lot on the tourism you can even contribute your part by visiting the country, so that the employees in the tourism industry earn money and have enough to live
title: Amazing for kitesurfing & relaxing - safe despite crisis in Sri Lanka

text:
I visited Alhambra Restaurant at Ramada Colombo today for an early Mother’s Day treat for my mom, and we tried the South Indian Thali, it was absolutely fantastic! The flavors were rich and authentic, the presentation was beautiful, and the variety on the plate was spot-on. As someone who regularly enjoys Indian cuisine, I’d rate this a solid 10/10. Chef Malar has done an excellent job.

A special shout-out to Kasun and Vihanga for their warm and friendly service from the moment we arrived. They made us feel welcomed and well taken care of throughout the meal.

The Thali offers great value for money, and I believe it deserves much more publicity. Highly recommend for anyone craving a true South Indian dining experience in Colombo!
title: Authentic South Indian Thali – Truly Impressive!

الفندق راقي والنظافة لأبعد الحدود، العاملين فيه على مستوى عالي من اللباقة والاحترام، الكل بدون استثناء شعلة من النشاط، مبتسمين ومرحبين.. كانت إقامتنا مريحة وحبينا المكان والموقع، الغرف كذلك مفروشة بالسجاد وأنيقة وفخمة بنفس الوقت… المطعم الإيطالي لذيذ وطلبات المنيو لذيذة أيضا… حبينا كل شي… خصوصا الأخ: أرشد… كان بقمة الأخلاق والودية والتعاون، وتعجز الكلمات عن وصف لطفه واهتمامه… كذلك: حامز وإمزان… الطاقم كان على مستوى عالي من الاحترافية بالتعامل واللطافة.. أوصي بهذا الفندق بشدة.. وهو وجهتنا المستقبلية دائما..

Chef Ifras met me at the fruit corner and when I asked him about Guava he said he will get one for our table  even though it was not a part of the buffet .and that he did  with a Smile , which was a special quality to a satisfy guest . And finally Rajitha look after us from the beginning and ended up by giving us a coffee . He too is an asset to the Hotel . This is a special gem added to Colombo hotels with the 24 hour service in the restaurant.
title: Added Gem to Colombo Hotels .

text: We are just finishing a three night stay as part of our honeymoon in Galle (May 2025). While there was construction and going to the hotel seemed odd with all of the construction work happening outside, once you arrived to the entry it felt like you were transported to a luxurious paradise. Checking provided lovely hand towels and great seating areas. They even upgraded our room to a room with a jacuzzi tub. The food we had was wonderful and they were great with someone in our party who was vegan. The pool was amazing as well. Our housekeeping attendant, Kasun, was awesome! They even made towel art and kept our room looking wonderful. Overall amazing stay!!!
title: Amazing honeymoon stay!

Would love to stay here again. And again.

text: Fox Resort in Jaffna is a fantastic place to relax and enjoy great food. The atmosphere is peaceful, and the staff is incredibly welcoming. Highly recommend for a great dining experience in Jaffna!
title: Wonderful Dining Experience with Excellent Service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear AxelHuebne,

Thank you for your kind words on your stay at Fox Jaffna! We’re delighted that you enjoyed your stay and found our hotel to be a peaceful oasis. It’s wonderful to hear that our friendly team, delicious cuisine, and relaxing pool made your visit special. We’re also glad you appreciated our bunker-turned-art-gallery, our positive transformation of a painful past that we take great pride in sharing with our guests.

It would be our great pleasure to welcome you back for another stay. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for your lovely review of Fox Jaffna! We’re so pleased that you and your mother had a wonderful stay with us. It’s fantastic to hear that you enjoyed our friendly service, clean rooms, and delicious food at a great value.

We’re especially glad that you appreciated the charm of our historic property and its well-preserved surroundings. The heritage of our hotel, including the wartime bunkers, is something we take great pride in, and we love sharing it with our guests.

Your recommendation means the world to us, and we hope to welcome you back for another memorable stay!

With warm regards,

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: Mum and I stayed here for a couple nights in January. Staff are friendly, rooms are clean and the food is tasty and at a reasonable price. The 5 star edge is the building and the beautiful and well kept surrounds, set in a historic house with preserved war bunkers which are open to guests. Highly recommend!
title: Great spot in Jaffna

ownerResponse/text:
Dear willwhizz,

Thank you for your wonderful review of Fox Jaffna! We’re delighted that you found our hotel to be a peaceful oasis and that you enjoyed the beautifully manicured gardens and soothing swimming pool. It’s fantastic to hear that our team’s service stood out during your travels in Sri Lanka - Our team really strives to create a warm and welcoming experience for all our guests and it is heartening for their efforts to be recognized.

We’re sorry to hear about the bonfires nearby during your stay, but we’re glad it didn’t take away from your overall experience. It’s also great to know that you had fun with our crab cooking class! There’s nothing quite like preparing and enjoying a delicious Jaffna-style crab dish firsthand.

We appreciate your kind words and hope to welcome you back for another relaxing stay.

With kind regards,

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: This is a nice hotel and an oasis as Jaffna is really run down and dirty. The hotel is nicely manicured and the pool is nice. We were unfortunate that a neighbouring property had bonfires whilst we were there but we still enjoyed it. It’s the first hotel in Sri Lanka that we stayed where they understood service. All staff were excellent. We also did the crab cooking class which was good fun cooking your own dinner. Decent beer and wine available too.
title: An oasis after seeing Jaffna!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Patricia D,

Thank you for your thoughtful review of Fox Jaffba! We’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed our beautifully designed garden, the serene poolside ambiance, and the comfort of your room. It’s wonderful to know that our amenities, from the well-stocked fridge to the cozy bed and hot shower, added a pleasant dimension to your stay.

We’re also pleased that you appreciated our buffet breakfast selection - our team takes great care in curating a mix of fresh and flavorful options, both local as well as international favourites, to start your day right.

The temple is an integral part of our community, and while its rituals can sometimes extend into the night, many guests find it to be a unique cultural experience. That said, we will explore ways to enhance the tranquility of your stay, and we appreciate your feedback.

We truly value your visit and hope to welcome you back for another memorable stay!

With warm regards,

The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text: Un magnifique jardin bien pensé donnant sur une piscine décorée de jarres immenses et comprenant quelques tables du restaurant. Notre chambre est accessible par un sentier, wifi, frigo garni, clim et brasseur d’air, et des sachets pour le café et le thé. La douche est très chaude, avec un sèche cheveux, et le lit confortable • Seul bémol  la musique et les chants qui émanent du temple voisin une grosse partie de la nuit . Petit déjeuner au buffet : viennoiseries , fruits frais et jus, plats nouilles et riz curry, des œufs…très bien
title: Havre de paix

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your wonderful review of Fox Jaffna! We're delighted to hear you appreciated the character of our boutique resort, the blend of old charm and modern luxury, and our picturesque gardens.  We especially appreciate your kind words about our staff and their exceptional service.

It's fantastic that you enjoyed the unique experience of visiting the traditional bunkers and their artwork.  We're glad this was a highlight of your stay.

We're truly sorry that the heavy rain prevented you from fully enjoying our pool and gardens. We hope you'll have the opportunity to experience these amenities on a future visit.

Thank you again for recommending Fox Jaffna. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Sincerely,
The Management of Fox Resorts
placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Heritage Rooms
text:
Renovated ancestral mansion located away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Beautifully designed with a touch of old charm and modern luxury. Well kept picturesque garden. 
We booked a heritage room which opens to the front courtyard. Spacious and comfortable room with necessary amenities. There was no shower cubicle and water splashes everywhere. Staff was kind enough to provide us with extra floor mats. Better to fix the problem permanently. 
Buffet was not that great and didn’t have much variety or authentic Jaffna food. Exceptional services by the restaurant staff. Apologies for not remembering their names. 
Highlight was the opportunity to visit traditional bunkers with impressive art work. Worth a visit. 
Even after three days, we were not able to use the pool or relax in nature due to heavy rain. Delightful stay but couldn’t enjoy it fully. Look forward to staying again ! 
Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Fox Jaffna to anyone visiting the area.
title: Characterful Boutique Resort

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciated our staff's efforts.  We're especially proud of Scotty, Shane, and Pushpa for their attentiveness and care, and we'll be sure to pass along your kind words.  They, along with the entire team, strive to provide exceptional service, and it's fantastic to know their efforts made a difference, especially during a difficult time for your family.

We're also delighted you found the hotel beautiful and clean, and that you were intrigued by the wartime bunkers and museum.  It's a unique feature, and we're glad you enjoyed it.

text:
5 stars for the staff. Very friendly, helpful and attentive. Particular kudos go yo Scotty, Shane the servers and Pushpa the chef for being accommodating when a member of our family got sick. 

4.5 stars for the venue. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. It has some renovated wartime bunkers underneath it as well that double as a small museum of sorts.

The only issue with it is the shower system in our bathroom wasn’t very responsive, but we told the staff of it and we hope it will be resolved for the next guests.
title: Beautiful place near downtown Jaffna

text:
I like to thank each and everyone of the team at Taj Bentota Resort and Spa for such a wonderful and memorable holiday at such a beautiful hotel earlier this month.

 

The hotel has such a lovely team of staff working at the resort and they all helped create a fabulous break for my husband I celebrating our wedding anniversary.  We left on Saturday 7th June with lasting, fond memories and very much looking forward to visiting Sri Lanka again, if not in Bentota, we will definitely book another Taj hotel on the island.

 

We'd also like to extend our gratitude to all the unsung hero's working behind the scenes to create such a beautiful ambiance. The maintenance team, the gardeners, the chefs, they all do a tremendous job ensuring everything works well,  the grounds looking beautiful and the guests fed to such a high standard 

 

The house keeping staff looking after our room were exceptional and the waiters, waitress and guys working around the pool were all so friendly and never without a smile. The reception team were always welcoming and helpful and the security team and the front gate were always ready to greet us no mater what time of day or night.  There are too many names to remember but each and everyone of them deserves recognition for their hard work, enthusiasm and dedication.
title: A fabulous stay at a wonderful hotel

text: Beautifully landscaped property. Beautiful beach attached to the property. So big that they have a tour of the hotel. Very good traditional dance programme in evenings, followed by guitar or saxophone. Throughout the day they have different activities for kids too like face painting. Excellent Indian food, with Chef Dalip Singh very happy to customise food the way you want. My kid loved the food. Very courteous and presentable staff, all speak good english. Especially person named Saman was very helpful. Water seeps into the room slightly through the glass doors if it rains heavily, but its not that big a prob. Staff is happy to help. Overall verdict: go for it, wont regret it!
title: Choose it for an excellent family stay at Bentota

text: I recently stayed at the 98 Acres Resort to celebrate my wedding anniversary, and I will remember it for a very long time. We stayed in one of their honeymoon suites, which was absolutely amazing. The view of Ella Rock and Little Adam's Peak from our room was breathtaking. The hotel staff were the friendliest I have ever encountered. To our surprise, when we checked in, they had decorated our bed with a happy anniversary message and provided a delicious cake to celebrate, all complimentary from the hotel. I will definitely return to this lovely resort.
title: A magical anniversary get away

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Ayubowan!

We’re especially grateful for your kind mention of Mangla, Indika, Amanda, and Prabath — they will be thrilled to know they made a positive difference during your stay, especially while your wife was unwell. We’re glad we could offer some comfort during that time.

text:
A truly outstanding hotel. If you are going anywhere near Ella, stay here! Set in the most stunning of valleys, the whole hotel looks out on a beautiful valley of forest, mountain and tea plants. The room was one of the nicest we have ever stayed in with an amazing balcony, comfy bed and giant bathroom.

In addition to this, all of the staff and their service was truly exceptional. When my wife got hit by a 24hr stomach bug (from food outside of the hotel), everyone seemed genuinely concerned and went above and beyond to help us. A particular thank you to Mangla, Indika, Amanda and Prabath who were all amazing during our stay.
title: Perfection

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Ayubowan!

Thank you so much for your heartfelt review and generous words. It brings us great joy to know that your stay at 98 Acres Resort & Spa was such a special and memorable experience. text:
A Perfect Honeymoon at 98 Acres Resort & Spa, Ella

We had an unforgettable honeymoon at 98 Acres Resort & Spa. From the moment we arrived, the warm hospitality stood out. The staff greeted us with a traditional "Aarathi" ceremony, setting a serene tone for our stay.

We chose the Royal Deluxe Cabana on a bed and breakfast basis. The accommodation was a blend of rustic charm and modern comfort, featuring eco-friendly designs with thatched roofs and furniture. The balcony offered panoramic views of the lush tea plantations and the majestic Little Adam’s Peak and Ella rock. 

A highlight of our stay was the complimentary sunrise tour arranged by the hotel. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, we trekked to the top of Little Adam’s Peak. The sight of the sun rising over the misty mountains was truly magical—a moment we'll cherish forever.

Dining at Restaurant 98 was a delight. We enjoyed a diverse breakfast buffet with both Western and Sri Lankan dishes, including the must-try egg hoppers. The setting, overlooking the verdant landscape, made each meal special.
title: Overall, 98 Acres Resort & Spa provided a perfect blend of nature, luxury, and cultural immersion.

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Make your booking prior 

On site parking available
text:
From the moment we booked to the day we checked out, 98 Acres Resort & Spa offered an exceptional and seamless hospitality experience that exceeded all expectations.

Reservation Experience:
We took advantage of a special Room Rush offer and booked a Suite Room directly through their website — a fast, intuitive, and convenient process. What truly impressed us was the thoughtful follow-up. A day before our scheduled stay, the hotel sent a personalized reminder email — a first for me with any hotel, and it genuinely saved the day as I had completely forgotten the date!

Getting There:
We drove from Colombo via Beragala–Wellawaya–Ella route, which took about 5 hours. The scenic journey itself was a treat — filled with lush greenery, waterfalls, and mountain views that set the tone for what was to come.

Arrival & Check-In:
We arrived at 2:00 PM and were warmly welcomed by the smiling staff with a traditional blessing and a refreshing iced tea. The check-in process was swift (just 5 minutes), and we were chauffeured to our suite in an eco-friendly electric buggy.

Personal Butler Service:
Our butler, Mr. Haridharan, was exceptional — offering a full room tour, explaining all facilities, dining options, and activities around the resort. His attention to detail made us feel genuinely cared for throughout the stay.

Exclusive Offers:
Upon check-in, we received 15% off at the Ravana Pool Club and 10% off on the nearby Mega Zip Line adventure — an unexpected bonus!

Dining & Culinary Experience:
Dinner was a delight, enjoyed in our room with a golden sunset view of Mini Adam’s Peak and Ella Rock. Their à la carte menu features both Sri Lankan and Western options. Every dish was perfectly cooked, beautifully presented, and served in generous portions.

The Main Restaurant is just a two-minute walk — spacious, ambient, and operated by highly professional staff. The bar offers a wide selection of beverages including exclusive 98 Acres cocktails. We highly recommend trying their signature drink called “Pickle” — a unique, refreshing cocktail experience.

Unmatched Views & Ambience:
Every villa is strategically designed to face breathtaking views of Ella Rock and Mini Adam’s Peak. Sunrise was absolutely magical. If you’re into stargazing, this is the place — the night sky revealed a million stars, a rare sight for city dwellers.

Facilities & Activities:

The Mini Bar was well-stocked (chargeable)

Gym and spa services are must-try

ATV rides, zip lining, skywalks, abseiling, and more at the Ravana Adventure Zone, just a short hotel shuttle ride away

GoPro and drone video options are available at very reasonable rates (bring your ID or driver’s license)

The Halpe Tea shop on-site offers the finest Ceylon teas to take home

Service & Staff:
The staff — from housekeeping to the executive team — are impeccably trained, respectful, and proactive. Their warm hospitality reflects true Sri Lankan charm and professionalism.

Unique Touches:
As a final gesture, guests are blessed according to their faith before departure — a thoughtful spiritual send-off. We were also gifted a complimentary pack of Halpe tea.

---

Final Verdict:
98 Acres Resort & Spa is not just a hotel — it's an experience. With top-tier service, stunning scenery, mouthwatering cuisine, and well-curated activities, it is undoubtedly one of the best resorts I’ve stayed at in Sri Lanka. Highly recommended for both locals and international travelers.
A solid 5-star experience.
title: A Dream Escape in Ella – Unforgettable Stay at 98 Acres Resort & Spa
