text:
This was a beautiful find in Ella. We hired a driver (Randika from SeeLanka Tours) and he came to collect us in Colombo from our hotel, and drove us to 98 Acres in Ella. We even saw a wild elephant on the side of the road, and visited a beautiful waterfall along the way. So even the drive to Ella (which took 5 hours along the southern expressway) was fascinating. 

Once we arrived in Ella, we were so grateful to have chosen 98 Acres. We had a beautiful room that overlooked nature. We even had a peacock come and sit on our verandah on the final morning before we checked out. He was completely at ease, chilling there for at least 2 hours, giving us a chance to carefully take some pics without scaring him off. 

The staff were amazing - absolutely 10/10 in their friendliness and helpfulness. The food was spectacular, and the chef went to such great lengths to ensure we had food that was within our dietary requirements (gluten free for me). And the place is so unique and with such spectacular views over Little Adams Peak and Ella Rock. Every day provided such wonderful opportunities for photographs. 

There were a few minor things I noticed which weren't 5/5: 

1. The glass for the shower doesn't extend to the wall, so every time we used the shower, water splashed over the toilet. 
2. We did hear the noise of the buggies (vehicles which carry guests around the property) from our room, and because we had the top floor of the villa and another couple had the lower floor, there was some noise transfer (we could hear them talking). I ended up using ear plugs the first night, but didn't need them the second night. 
3. We had an Ayurvedic 1 hour massage at the Spa on site, but neither of us were impressed with our therapists. My friend and I are both trained in Ayurvedic massage and we both teach massage. If I visited again, I would find a massage clinic off-site where I can get a proper Ayurvedic massage. The upside was that the view and environs of the Spa on site at 98 Acres was stunning, so we got some great pics for facebook and Instagram.
title: An amazing place to stay in Ella

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
For a relaxing holiday, it's best to head south to the vicinity of Weligama, a favorite spot for surfers. Here, Cape Weligama (Relais & Chateaux) stands out as the premier destination. This renowned hotel boasts 39 boutique villas and suites spread across 5 hectares of a former coconut grove on the dramatically picturesque Cape Weligama. The primary draw of this location is the stunning views, views, and more views.

The Ocean Terrace Restaurant, where guests gather for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, is perched on a cliff, providing an unparalleled vantage point to take in some of the best scenery imaginable. 

Cape Weligama also offers three secret spots—secluded areas perfect for watching the sunset. Each spot is equipped with a table and chairs, and can be reserved for a romantic lunch or dinner. 

The villas themselves are spacious, each covering at least 130 square meters, and are built in the local architectural style. Each villa features its own private pool (shared between two or three villas) and a spacious terrace furnished with a table, sun loungers, and a sofa. It's an idyllic spot to sip tea while listening to the tunes of Frank Sinatra or Ella Fitzgerald.

The cuisine at Cape Weligama is another highlight. Talented chefs deliver an impressive culinary experience starting with breakfast. However, the evening meals truly showcase their skills. A standout feature is the Chef's Table at the Tableau restaurant, where a seven-course dinner is prepared before your eyes. This culinary journey includes appetizers, soups, sorbets, main courses, and desserts, making for an unforgettable dining experience.

Chef Ishara Wijesinghe has honed his craft in various countries including Dubai over a 20-year career. He returned to his homeland to perfect his skills in Sri Lankan cuisine, infusing it with European gastronomic techniques. The result is exceptional—his cooking method could easily earn a Michelin star. Guests can ask about the secrets of local cuisine, get excellent recipes, and engage in conversations about global culinary traditions and life in general.

For those seeking adventure, Cape Weligama offers a variety of activities, from surfing lessons and whale watching excursions to guided tours of nearby tea plantations and historic sites. In conclusion, Cape Weligama is not just a place to stay; it's a destination that offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and immersive cultural experiences.
title: Wonderful Stay

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay longer at this place as planned 😉
text:
After having stayed twice both at Ceylon Tea Trails and Wild Coast Tented Lodge I finally wanted to experience the „Sea“-part of the Resplendent Ceylon Hotels. I am always skeptical about Conde Nast Traveller Hot-List Hotels but Cape Weligama really is a true gem! The service was so great and I loved the tranquility and general atmosphere of this place. The Hotel is immersed in its surroundings not separated from it, giving exit to the surrounding beaches. Everything was beautifully maintained and clean. I was upgraded to a villa, which I loved. Sajith showed me the property and did an amazing job. Since I unfortunately only had one night he saved me a lot of time by explaining and showing everything to me directly after arrival. He also made sure that I knew how to contact him, if I had any questions or problems. 
The food was also delicious. I will definitely return and can highly recommend staying here. Thank you very much!
title: Not to be missed

text:
Easily the best hotel my husband and I have ever stayed at! Everything was absolutely amazing. The food was so delicious and the views were supreme. The highlight of our stay was your incredible staff! They were genuinely interested in our comfort and always went above and beyond to make our stay the best ever. Lahiru, Mahendra - our curator and Pradeep were so warm and friendly and we truly appreciate their efforts. Manula from F&B was the absolute star during our stay - he honestly went above and beyond and was the most pleasant person to deal with! Manula assisted us both during breakfast and dinner and at the end of our stay we felt like he was part of our family! My husband accidentally cut his toe on a stone and Manula rushed to get ice and a band aid and was so lovely during the situation. 

As a Front Office Manager myself in Melbourne, I truly appreciate and value outstanding service in the hospitality industry and am so proud to call myself Sri Lankan when I experience stays such as these. Your staff truly seemed like they loved their job as it shows by the way they work!

I can easily say that my husband and I will be dreaming of our honeymoon at Cape Weligama for months and years to come. 

Thank you to the wonderful team at CW - we will be back!
title: HONEYMOON HEAVEN

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
This is the most incredible place we’ve ever been! From the incredible hospitality, to the cliffside views looking at the surfers below, to the delicious Sri Lankan and Western breakfasts and dinners, and to the beautiful rooms, this place deserves all of the accolades. This was our last stop of our (a couple) Sri Lanka trip and it was the perfect ending. Shaun was absolutely wonderful, greeted us at check in and hosted us the entire trip, ensuring our stay was top notch! He was a gem. The sincere nature of all of the staff also did not go unnoticed. All of the butlers, to bartenders, to maintenance around the property to the managers, were genuine and sincere to see you. Another highlight was tasting the different fruit or flavor infused arracks at the Surf Bar onsite. The drinks the bartenders made with those arracks were unreal! 

We stayed in the master suite, and the room was huge with a large private deck with seating. The all wood walk in closet was a nice touch to tuck away our suitcases out of the way, and the rainfall shower was the best treat after a swim at the beach nearby. The shower room also turns into a steam room, although we didn’t try it. And the half moon infinity pool! Highly recommend a swim there at dusk, as it’s pretty incredible to watch the sun go down and surfers below. 

All in all, our hands down favorite part of our trip was Cape Weligama! There’s not enough words to say how special this stay was. We will be returning in the future!
title: Seven stars!

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: We didn’t stay at cape weligama but visited one evening to enjoy drinks by the bar and dinner afterwards. The setting and location were beautiful, overlooking the sea from the cliff top, the drinks and food of a high quality (food portions are on the small side for Sri Lanka) but what stood out most was the service which was the best we’ve experienced even in the few hours we were there - genuine, efficient and elegant. Truly world class. Beautiful property and extremely well maintained and well run. Well done team
title: Amazing

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: A beautiful hotel in a stunning location but the star feature was the wonderful people working there. They made the stay and I could not fault their warmth friendliness and professionalism they were outstanding. Our first floor villa with huge suspended pool was beautifully appointed though the pool and outside area needs a bit of updating this did not detract from our enjoyment the view from the room was truly stunning. The main pool on a cliff top is one of the best hotel pools and views you will find anywhere.No hesitation in recommending this lovely hotel there is so much to explore and see so have good walk around.
title: Stunning location lovely hotel with the best possible people.

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our 2nd time on the South coast of Sri Lanka, previously there in 2013, and it is just as beautiful as it was but much busier with more tuk tuks, scooters, surfers, everything really!
The Cape Weligama hotel is at the luxury end of the market price wise but mostly lives up to expectations. The villa was beautiful and we shared the private pool with only one other villa (tbh we had it to ourselves most of the time) and housekeeping by Sadasheena and Vimukthi was fantastic. We were there for 13 nights, started on half board for one week then cancelled that for the 2nd to give us a bit more freedom of choice as the evening menu did not appear to change.
We got out and about using a brilliant local tuk tuk driver, Viraj +94 773969530, who was a very safe, honest and reliable driver and I highly recommend using him. He lives with his family a few hundred yards from the hotel and would appreciate the work.
Inoka looked after us on arrival and Madushan was invaluable in making our departure so easy and stress free.
All in all we had a fantastic relaxing holiday with temperatures always around 31/31 degrees so landing back in London at 5 degrees was a shock, remember to take a jumper, we didn’t!
title: Fantastic holiday, thanks to all

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: We have visited CW several times and it gets better each time. Everything is done to make your stay as comfortable and happy as possible. The site is stunning and as the gardens mature,  the landscaping ensures privacy even within areas with shared pools. Accomodation is beautiful and cleaning regimes ensure everything is always spotless. The food is outstanding from the breadless bendedict at breakfast to the local crustaceans at dinner. There are several chefs who will come and speak to you and dining at Tableau, a separate chef’s table is a fabulous experience. Bar staff love the challenge of coming up with a cocktail for you and the Arrak lesson should also not be missed. Without spoiling the surprise, it is much more than it sounds.
title: A fabulous holiday

ownerResponse/text:

The Resplendent Team
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Hilltop property with beautiful views. Mixture of Villas and suites. All accommodations very large like mini apartments with massive bathrooms, walk in wardrobes and large verandas 
Food excellent large choice. A number of items repeatedly not available - would suggest amending the menu. 
Large portions - could be reduced. 
We stayed three nights and felt that it may be better to have a menu which changed as opposed to the same, however there was a wide choice. 
2 swimming pools, the half moon one was beautiful and quiet and no children under 12. 
Staff excellent special mention to waiter ‘Wishwa’ who went above and beyond especially when they had some staff off sick. 
Rina in the Spa - excellent pedicure. 
Negatives
Steam room in our bathroom did not work and could not be fixed
Lighting in wardrobe/ dressing room poor
Steps uneven so better lighting would be helpful. Not suitable for those with mobility issues 
Laundry and drinks very expensive 
We were on full board but for those not menu prices high, service and tax on top of these prices
title: First Class Accommodation

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If budget allows go for the villas near the oceanfront swimming pool as closest to all the facilities.
text:
The food at Cape Weligama was excellent, we particularly loved the spaghetti lobster dish. It was a very generous serve with plenty of lobster and the pasta was cooked to perfection. 

Breakfast was also delicious with plenty of choices and fresh juices. The staff were all incredibly friendly, efficient and knowledgeable.

 The villa rooms are incredibly large and spacious and tastefully furnished, more like the size of an apartment. 

The property is very hilly but good if you like the exercise. There is no beach to swim at as rocky below, although the pool is fabulous. Buggy's are available on call. 

We booked a premier villa but did have to share the pool with others which I was not a fan of. Plus, we had another villa above us which took away our privacy.

Disliked  · The only dislike was there were no fans outside on the verandas which was annoying if just wanting to relax and read, without them it was far too hot. 

Overall - Lovely traditional boutique style hotel nestled on a side of a hill with a beautiful sweeping ocean vista below. The villas are enormous and extremely comfortable.
title: Relaxing stay with delicious food. 💕🥂🌴

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is now,  without a doubt, the finest I have ever stayed at. I travel well and enjoy writing well-deserved reviews.
Firstly,  the rooms are outstanding.  We stayed in a junior suite which was so well equipped. Many bottles of water,  replenished daily with a very well stocked mini bar with beautiful little chocolates and biscuits left in the room every night. 
The bathroom was outstanding, again with EVERY detail covered. 
The restaurant and food was of an exceptional standard and the service was superb. My breakfast,  daily,  was a delightful 'Crab chilli scrambled egg on toast with a crab emulsion'. Dinner was equally exciting and delicious and we thoroughly enjoyed the private candlelit dinner over looking the sea,  watching the fisherman coming and going in the dark. 
Service - how or where do I start? Nothing and I mean NOTHING,  was too much trouble for any member of the incredible team that made our stay so exceptional.  Very special thanks have to go to Thorundu and his team, also the delightful restaurant manager,  who constantly pointed out things of interest,  including rare mammals and planets that could be clearly seen at night through his telescope.
I could write for ages as this was an incredible stay and an incredible experience.  I would love to return!!!!
Thankyou Cape Weligama for the most wonderful stay. Highly, highly recommended  👌
title: OUTSTANDING RESORT IN EVERY WAY

text: I had a truly unforgettable time at Kandy Myst by Cinnamon. The service was absolutely exceptional—Madushan went above and beyond to ensure every detail was perfect, Malinda was incredibly attentive and warm, always ready to help with a smile, and Chamathka made our experience feel extra special with her kind and professional approach. The views were stunning, the food delicious, and the overall atmosphere peaceful and relaxing. The genuine hospitality from the team made this one of the best hotel experiences I’ve had in Sri Lanka. Highly recommended!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Piyumi,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that you and your husband enjoyed your stay and that you found our staff friendly and accommodating. It warms our hearts to know that our efforts to celebrate your husband's birthday made your visit even more special.

We are glad you appreciated the views and the ambiance of the hotel, despite the rain limiting your time at the pool. Your kind words about the cozy and clean rooms, as well as the rooftop bar, are genuinely appreciated and will certainly motivate our team to continue providing great service.

We hope to welcome you back soon for another memorable stay. Please do not hesitate to reach out when you're planning your next trip!

Warm regards,

Niroshan Dinuka
Manager, Front Office
placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel stay was well worth the price, easily accessible and quite close to the town yet the views were good too. 

The staff was so friendly and accommodating, probably few of the best from among all the Sri Lankan hotels I’ve been to. 

Due to the continued rains we weren’t able to use the pool but the pool area was very pretty.

Me and my husband wanted to go to Kandy  for his birthday, but I had to reschedule this booking 2-3 times because I got sick. I left a note in the initial booking that it was my husband’s birthday and they actually followed through and got a cake with candles and everything even after we went there 10 days later. Both my husband and I got surprised 😂❤️ Such a sweet gesture.

The food was great, rooms were cozy and clean. The rooftop bar was really nice and the interior was so beautiful.
title: Great hotel, excellent staff!

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
text:
If you’re looking for the perfect spot for a coffee date in Kandy, look no further than Terra Lounge at Kandy Myst by Cinnamon. I had the absolute pleasure of sharing a wonderful time there. 

From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere set the tone: cozy, elegant, and filled with the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee. 

A special shout-out to Akila, the star behind the counter, whose craftsmanship and passion for coffee truly elevated the experience. Every cup he brewed — from the velvety cappuccinos to the aromatic pour-overs — was a masterpiece. Sanduni and Akarsha made the experience even more delightful with their warmth and great conversation. 

If you ever find yourself in Kandy and want to enjoy not just great coffee, but also beautiful company and exceptional service, I highly recommend planning your coffee date at Terra Lounge. You might just find your new favorite spot — and perhaps your new favorite people too.
title: Coffee date

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sanuja,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your wonderful experience at Hotel Kandy Myst Cinnamon! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our selection of sweet items, especially the macaroons, and that they added to the indulgence of your stay. 

We strive to provide a variety of desserts that not only please the palate but are also beautifully presented, so we are delighted to know that you found them impressive.

It’s wonderful to hear that you found our ambiance calming and inviting. Our team, especially Saduni, Gayathri, and Akila, will be happy to hear your kind words about their warm service. We take great pride in ensuring our guests feel at home, and it is encouraging to know that we succeeded during your visit.

Thank you for your high recommendation! We hope to welcome you back to the hotel soon for another sweet escape.

Warm regards,

Niroshan Dinuka
Manager,Front Office
placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently visited Hotel Kandy Myst Cinnamon and had a truly enjoyable experience. One of the highlights of our visit was the selection of sweet items available – especially the macaroons, which we absolutely loved! They were perfectly baked with a delicate texture, rich flavor, and just the right amount of sweetness. Each bite felt like a little indulgence, and we found ourselves going back for more. The rest of the dessert offerings were equally impressive, with a beautiful variety of treats that not only tasted great but were also presented with elegance and care.

The ambiance of the hotel was calm and inviting, making it an ideal spot to unwind and enjoy some quality time. What made our visit even more memorable was the exceptional service we received. A heartfelt thank you goes out to Saduni, Gayathri, and Akila (our barista), who were all incredibly welcoming and attentive throughout our time there. They made us feel right at home with their warm smiles and professionalism.

It’s not often you find a place that combines quality food with outstanding service and a cozy atmosphere, but Hotel Kandy Myst Cinnamon managed to do just that. We highly recommend it to anyone visiting Kandy – especially if you have a sweet tooth!
title: High tea time with besties

placeInfo/address: 254 Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Quite the underrated city hotel. Conveniently located. 

 One of the best rooftop views in Colombo (@ night). 
 I had visited a magnificent Amari hotel in Bangkok few years back hence my expectations were understandably high & was not disappointed!

We had dinner at their Ahara Restaurant.  International buffet.  Reasonably priced. 
Beautifully and tastefully done Restaurant. 

The food was exquisite! Chefs stationed at the buffet were helpful and knowledgeable, they were only too happy to answer any question pertaining to displayed food items.

Mr. Udesh gave us a most hearty welcome and was ever so courteous throughout the evening. 

Apart from the dinner buffet, we ordered drinks: cocktails & cocktails - delicious!

Our servers Mr. Umesh & Mr. Theekshana were friendly and obliging.  Very well trained. 

Prior to dinner, we visited the rooftop bar and the Italian restaurant.  The ambience was cosy and classy.  Wonderful staff there too. We will visit for a meal to this restaurant in the near future. 

Much thanks to all front office staff for their hospitality as well.

Great job... Amari, Colombo!!!  We were impressed!
title: Lovely city hotel

text:
Had an incredible buffet lunch at Amari Colombo for just RS 6500, and it was absolutely worth it! The variety was fantastic—Thai, Indian, Sri Lankan, Japanese, and International dishes, all delicious and well-prepared. The pasta was a standout for me! 

The hotel itself is beautiful, with the best rooftop view in Colombo—perfect for a relaxing meal. The staff, especially Visanka, Mendis, and Chef Ifras, were so friendly and welcoming, making the experience even better.

Highly recommend this place for a great buffet with amazing food, excellent service, and a stunning atmosphere! Can’t wait to go again!
title: Amazing Lunch Buffet at Amari Colombo – Highly Recommended!

text:
My mother and I came to Jetwing Blue to relax and get away from the chaos and we have loved every minute of it. The service was amazing and the Buffet was a treat. The pool was perfect in the heat and it was in a very convenient location. Not to mention the hotel chain has put a lot of effort into sustainably and training up local people to work at their hotels. 

The team at jetwing blue has made our stay so seamless. Everyone has been so attentive and efficient and I am blown away by their hospitality.

I would like to specially thank Shalani for introducing us to tours run by the hotel, and Roshel for her service. The Treecle tour is a must if you like sweets!

Sandaruwan who was working the front desk was kind and incredibly attentive, we cannot praise his skill enough.
title: Amazing service and a great stay!

roomTip: There's also a nice gym at the hotel!
text:
We were originally booked at another Jetwing, but they moved us to Jetwing Blue due to construction work.  It was a very pleasant surprise!  The staff was very kind and and helpful, and upgrading to the Family Room gave us so much more room for our 20-year-old daughter who joined us.  We stayed there on the last night of our trip to Sri Lanka, and the large room gave us plenty of room to reoganize our luggage.  

The pool area was beautiful and the servers arranged a comfortable place for us to sit, eat, and enjoy drinks.  The view of the ocean was lovely, although I didn't walk down to it.  We ate dinner on property that evening which was good.  Unfortunately we didn't have time to enjoy the complimentary breakfast buffet.  

One more thing--there are lots of nice tourist stores within an easy walk from Jetwing Blue.
title: Ocean view and plenty of room

text:
We celebrated my dad’s 80th birthday in Sri Lanka, staying at Hilton Colombo Residences. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with genuine warmth and care. Jinanjali, the Guest Relations Officer, greeted us each day with her lovely smile and went out of her way to make our stay special.

On the morning of my dad’s birthday, we headed to Flow for breakfast. When we returned, our suite had been beautifully decorated with balloons, birthday signs, and a delicious cake waiting for him. My dad was absolutely thrilled! It was such a thoughtful gesture and a true example of exceptional service.

Thank you, Jinanjali, you helped make this milestone celebration one we’ll never forget. Highly recommend the Hilton Columbo Residences.
title: Exceptional Service with Heart

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a wonderful stay! It’s been a year since we stayed at Waterland, and of all the places we’ve visited, this was by far our favorite. The bonus was having our own private swimming pool—such a treat!

Our bedroom was incredibly comfortable—like sleeping in a queen’s retreat. And the bathroom? Taking a shower felt like being in a tropical forest—absolutely magical and refreshing.

The staff was attentive and patient with us. As Deaf travelers who rely on ASL, we really appreciated how supportive they were. They communicated with us using apps on our phones, which was awesome and made us feel truly welcome.

Another highlight was the boat tour around the area. We saw bats and many beautiful local birds—very cool!

The only possible downside is that the location is quite secluded and set in a residential neighborhood. But for us, that was actually a plus. We wanted peace, privacy, and a break from the typical tourist crowds.

Thank you for making our stay so memorable!
title: One Year Later, Still the Best Experience!

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
*Wonderful Stay at Waterland Hotel – Monsoon Villaל, Negombo*

We stayed at *Waterland Hotel in Negombo* in the *Monsoon Family Villa* for two nights.  
We were a family group: parents and three grown-up children.

The hotel staff were kind and attentive, making us feel welcome throughout our stay.  
The location is peaceful, not in the city center, and right next to the Dutch Canal.  
The rooms were spacious, clean, and had a private pool.

Breakfast was excellent – it's recommended to pre-order special dishes from the menu the evening before.  
Dinner was very tasty, and we especially recommend the local Sri Lankan dishes.

In the morning, we went for a walk and visited the local fish market.  
We also took a family boat ride from the hotel along the Dutch Canal for $55. We saw interesting wildlife, and our guide, Medzara from the hotel, was wonderful.

The hotel features a billiards table over 100 years old. We met Mark, the hotel owner, who was very friendly and shared stories about the place.

There are also bicycles available – it’s a good idea to request them in advance so they can be prepared.

We warmly recommend the hotel!
Please note: as a hotel policy, a 10% service charge is added for services provided. This tip is shared among the entire hotel staff – and it’s well deserved!
title: *Wonderful Stay at Waterland Hotel – Monsoon Villaל, Negombo*

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
We have been to Waterland many times, but it is such a special place that we have never been able to say, “been there, seen that, done that.” Waterland, being close to the Katunayake International airport, has always been either a warm welcome or a melancholic goodbye to Sri Lanka for us.
In my previous reviews I have written extensively why Waterland is my most favorite little hotel in Sri Lanka. In short, its exquisite beauty in the milieu of the majestic Maha Oya, environment-friendly building standards, friendly & efficient staff, and divine privacy for each villa, create an atmosphere to make you feel special.
Around the time of the sunset, we had an opportunity to observe the devotional ritual of fishermen in front of the church on the bank of Maha Oya just before their night departure to the sea. A melancholic melody of blessings from the church choir echoed through the serenity of dusk hinting a sense of harmony.
We were very happy to see the gracious owner, Mark once again on the premises, who made us feel even more special with a champaign welcome. We enjoyed a tasty hoppers dinner on our private deck in a festive atmosphere surrounded by Mark, two of his senior staff members, twinkling lamps, flashing red, green, blue hues emanating from the private pool and an occasional flying dog bat whizzing by above us.
We will be back to Waterland soon enough.
title: Another magical night at Waterland

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: What a fantastic time we had here. This was really the most beautiful room during our entire tour. The private pool in the living room is great. We had a very early flight and were given breakfast packages. The staff is very friendly and are always there for you. We also had dinner in this hotel in the evening and it was delicious.
title: Beautiful hotel with a unique location on the river!

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir haben eine Nacht in einer dieser wunderschönen Villen des Hotels verbracht und wollten eigentlich gar nicht mehr gehen.

Das Zimmer war so schön - voll ausgestattet mit allem, was man braucht, liebevoll eingerichtet und auch sauber. Eines unserer Highlights waren der private Pool und die Regenwalddusche im Bad. 

Es wurde an viele liebevolle Details gedacht, vom bereitgestellten Trinkwasser bis hin zu selbstgemachtem Mückenspray. 
Auch das Abendessen und Frühstück waren sehr gut. Frisch, lecker und sehr schön angerichtet.

Besonders wohlgefühlt haben wir uns aber definitiv aufgrund des lieben Teams: wirklich alle waren wahnsinnig freundlich, hilfsbereit und sind uns immer mit einem Lächeln begegnet. 

Wir waren wunschlos glücklich und kommen sehr gerne wieder!
title: Fantastischer Start unseres Urlaubs

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for 2 nights in April 2025 as a family of 4. It's a beautiful location .The staff are super friendly and helpful. The food in the hotel was really nice but they were also able to arrange a tuk tuk into town and make recommendations. The boat tour rnn by the hotel was great and we also enjoyed the floating breakfast which was a bit novelty but good fun.

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take time to explore the surrounds and meet the locals
text: Warm welcome in a special place. This is a small private hotel run by friendly people who go above and beyond to make you feel at home. The afternoon boat trip through the extensive wetlands is integral to understanding the place - amazing birdlife, culture, flying foxes, water monitors and all in a comfortable 90 minute cruise. Food is authentic Sri Lankan cuisine - fresh and delicious.
title: Well designed private villa hotel run by friendly people

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Elephant villa had best views
text:
We stayed 2 nights arriving at 6pm after a long journey from UK. We stayed in the Elephant villa which had a lovely small pool with fantastic views of the river. The villa was charming with an interesting bathroom- the open shower was in the middle of the room adjacent to an indoor pool with fish. The bed was large & comfortable & the air on was excellent. We were introduced to the ‘mini bar’which had only a bottle of water in it. Maybe this could be improved with a few beers/soft drinks?
Breakfast was lovely. We are not big breakfast lovers but the Sri Lankan omelette was lovely. We took advantage of the floating breakfast on our final morning which was an interesting experience! We ate dinner & the curry & rice was lovely if a bit cold. I’d like it a bit warmer.
We did the boat trip & saw lots of monitor lizards, birds & enormous fruit bats. It lasts about 1.5 hrs & was very interesting & worth the money.
The highlight was our own pool & whilst facing north you get plenty of sun from 9.30am, in fact we got too much & suffered later.
The location near the airport lends itself well for the beginning or ending of your holiday & I’d recommend this hotel.with a couple of minor tweaks it would be perfect eg. Music a bit loud at breakfast, more comfortable dining chairs, options in the mini bar.
title: A hidden gem

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: What an incredible start to our holiday in Sri Lanka! This place is a must to stay in! Absolutely gorgeous location with own pool and an incredible view of the river. The staff were incredible, the kindest people, very attentive and really really lovely! We would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who is visiting Sri Lanka. We were very sad to leave! Thank you to all the staff at Waterland for a beautiful start to our holiday!

ownerResponse/text:
We’re delighted that you  and your group had such a memorable stay at Waterland. 

We're glad you enjoyed the spacious villa, the private pool, the connection with nature, the excellent service, the comfort, and the beauty of the setting and the hotel.

It's good of you to describe the boat safari so lovingly.  While the hotel itself offers the chance to experience life by  the water, the boat safari offers the delights of being on the water.  The guided tours on decorated boats have become an integral part of the Waterland experience.  It's so nice to hear that you had such a magical experience on the boat safari.

Thanks for recommending Waterland so enthusiastically and for encouraging others to stay here for a number of days rather than just 1 or 2.  We greatly appreciate the time and care you invested in writing the review.

Warm wishes from all of us at Waterland.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: Our party of five had a very enjoyable and memorable stay at Waterland!  The staff met us upon our arrival and checked us in quickly and efficiently. ownerResponse/text:
Vielen Dank für Ihren Aufenthalt, Ihre Bewertung und Ihre wärmstens empfohlene Empfehlung für Waterland!

Wir freuen uns, dass Ihnen Ihr Aufenthalt gefallen hat und Sie die Einrichtungen, das Essen, die Villa, den privaten Pool und die ruhige Umgebung genossen haben.

Vielen Dank für Ihre Sorge um die Tiere. Wir stimmen Ihnen zu. Vögel sollten grundsätzlich nicht in Gefangenschaft gehalten werden.

Im Laufe der Jahre hat sich das Hotel um streunende Hunde, Katzen, Vögel, Reptilien und andere Tiere gekümmert. Wir bieten diese Tiere dann zur Adoption an.

Die Vögel wurden verletzt und dem Hotel zur Pflege übergeben oder gerettet. Sobald diese Vögel in Gefangenschaft sind, haben sie kaum Überlebenschancen, wenn sie in die freie Wildbahn entlassen werden.

Wir werden die Gründe für die Käfighaltung dieser Vögel besser kommunizieren.

Alles Gute vom gesamten Waterland-Team.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: Sehr nettes, familiäres Hotel mit komfortabler Ausstattung und sehr freundlichem, kompetenten Personal. Essen war sehr lecker👍 Moskitonetze waren vorhanden (sehr wichtig). ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrter Gast,
Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich für einen Aufenthalt im Royal Palms Beach Hotel Kalutara entschieden haben und sich die Zeit genommen haben, uns Ihr ausführliches und aufmerksames Feedback mitzuteilen.
Wir freuen uns sehr, dass Sie Ihren 12-tägigen Aufenthalt bei uns genossen haben und dass die großzügige Gestaltung unseres Hotels und der Poolbereich positiv zu Ihrem Erlebnis beigetragen haben, insbesondere während der Monsunzeit, als Baden im Meer nicht möglich war. Es freut uns auch sehr, dass Ihr Zimmer Ihren Erwartungen entsprach und der atemberaubende Blick auf den Sonnenuntergang von Ihrem Balkon einen unvergesslichen Eindruck hinterlassen hat. Wir danken Ihnen für Ihre Anerkennung unseres Housekeeping-Teams, das sich während des gesamten Aufenthalts jedes Gastes um höchste Sauberkeit und Komfort bemüht.
Wir freuen uns sehr über Ihre Anmerkungen zur Vielfalt und Qualität unserer Speisen, insbesondere der traditionellen Küche. Ebenso nehmen wir Ihre Anmerkungen zum All-inclusive-Angebot und zur Qualität der Getränke außerhalb der Hauptmahlzeiten zur Kenntnis. Wir werden diese Aspekte mit unseren Küchen- und Serviceteams besprechen, um Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten zu identifizieren.
Wir freuen uns, dass Sie unsere Wellnessangebote wertgeschätzt haben und die Massagen zu Ihrer Zufriedenheit waren. Es ist auch schön, von Ihren Erfahrungen mit unserem Entertainer Lahiru zu hören. Wir werden Ihre freundlichen Worte gerne weitergeben. Er wird sich freuen, dass seine private Yogastunde so positiv war.
Wir haben auch Ihr Feedback zu den Tuk-Tuk-Fahrern vor dem Hotel zur Kenntnis genommen. Obwohl diese Dienste unabhängig vom Hotel betrieben werden, verstehen wir Ihre Bedenken und werden unsere Gäste weiterhin über sichere und kostengünstige Transportmöglichkeiten wie Uber beraten.
Vielen Dank noch einmal für Ihre freundliche Empfehlung und die Hervorhebung des guten Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnisses. Wir sind sehr dankbar für Ihre Anerkennung und hoffen aufrichtig, Sie bald wieder für einen unvergesslichen Aufenthalt begrüßen zu dürfen.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Fahrten immer über Uber buchen. 2-Tages-trip über Uwalawe-Nationalpark, Ella und Kandy lohnt sich absolut!
text: Wir waren für 12 Tage im Royal Palms Beach Hotel Kalutara. Die Hotelanlage war großräumig mit genug Platz für alle Gäste, auch am Pool. Aufgrund der Monsun-Zeit konnten wir leider nicht im Meer schwimmen. Der große Pool hat uns aber auch vollkommen ausgereicht. Für Tagestrips war es ein toller Standort. Unser Zimmer war geräumig und bis auf kleine Schwierigkeiten mit der Elektrizität wirklich top. Von unserem Balkon aus konnten wir abends den traumhaften Sonnenuntergang beobachten. Die Zimmer werden bei Bedarf täglich bis zu zwei Mal gereinigt. Das Essen war abwechslungsreich mit großem Anteil an traditioneller Küche. Von dem All-inclusive Angebot zwischen den Hauptmahlzeiten und der Qualität der inkludierten Getränke haben wir uns mehr erhofft. Wir haben auch das sehr preiswerte Massageangebot genutzt und waren sehr zufrieden. Begeistert waren wir von Animateur Lahiru, der mit uns eine tolle private Yogastunde am Strand gemacht hat, die er sehr gut auf unsere Fähigkeiten ausgerichtet hat. Das Personal war überall sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Was wir nicht gut fanden, waren die Tuktuk-Fahrer direkt vor dem Hotel, die unverhältnismäßig teure Touristen-Preise verlangten. Wir empfehlen Fahrten über Uber zu buchen. Sicherer und deutlich preiswerter. Alles in allem empfehlen wir das Hotel auf jeden Fall weiter. Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist absolut gerechtfertigt!
title: Gutes Hotel mit top Personal

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback following your recent stay with us.
We are truly delighted to know that you found our hotel beautiful, clean, and welcoming, and that our team from reception to the pool staff made such a positive impression. Special thanks for highlighting Chamodi, Priyantha, Sarath, and Nimal; we will ensure they are recognized for their exceptional service.
We're pleased you enjoyed the spacious room and overall facilities. Your constructive comments regarding the hairdryer quality, bathroom lighting, and terrace seating are noted and will be reviewed for improvement.
We appreciate your detailed observations about the buffet. While we’re glad the quality and variety of food met expectations overall, we acknowledge the areas you've highlighted from menu combinations and food temperature to allergen awareness and snack offerings. We take these concerns seriously and will work closely with our culinary and service teams to address them.
We're also grateful for your feedback on accessibility, including handrails and mobility considerations, which are especially important to us. Thank you for pointing out these practical areas for enhancement.
It’s wonderful to hear you had a fabulous stay overall and that you plan to return next year. 
We look forward to welcoming you back and providing an even more comfortable and seamless experience.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
ladies if hair dryer is important, take your own !
Cadburys Dairymilk gives the biggest smiles I have ever seen.
text:
The hotel is beautiful, clean and welcoming. The staff are the jewel in the crown here. Nothing is too much trouble. The reception staff from the bell boy to the money exchange service and customer service assistants, all have lovely smiling faces and are so helpful.  Chamodi was amazing when we needed to change rooms due to myself having an injury to my ankle 2 days before arriving and having a little difficulty with walking. 
 Lovely huge pool, The pool guys Priyantha, Sarath, and Nimal cann ot do enough for you and work extremely hard to ensure everything in and around the pool is clean and tidy and you have everything you need. 
Rooms spacious and clean, with everything you need, BUT the hairdryers are not the best, and lighting in bathrooms is not good for ladies applying make up. Seating is not comfortable on the terrace and could do with some improvement, it seems they are more for aesthetics than comfort. 

The Buffet restaurant is what took my review from 5 star to 4 star.
Food was of a high quality and plenty of choice, BUT some of the combination options seemed a little strange, such as when battered fish served there were no Fries, ( in fact  there were never any fries in 2 weeks) Sri Lankan bbq night was a huge hit with the most gorgeous baked potatoes, ( would have been nice if they could have substituted the mashed potatoes at least once or twice on other nights). Roast Potatoes not parboiled just potatoes cut and put in an oven, and came out very hard and barely roasted.  Vegetables very fresh but were almost raw, aldente is good but these were the wrong side of aldente. Food that was not cooked on the stations, was not hot, in fact was barely warm.  
The 2 cool rooms, one for salads and one for desserts, need to be monitored very carefully by management, many times not enough tongs/ serving slices, meant cross contamination. If anyone had a nut allergy they would not be able to have anything in the dessert room. Thankfully nut allergy was not a problem for us but a fish allergy was, and almost caused a problem in the salad room had I not been so vigilent watching my sister in laws choices, as labels had been moved around. 

Afternoon snacks very very poor.

If you require milk for tea in your room just ask in the buffet restaurant they are happy to help. 

On the whole we had a fabulous time, yes it was rainy season, but rain was mainly at night or early morning. Yes we will be back next year. Trips we did this time Udawalawe, Pinnawala, and Colombo city tour, all booked with Bonni at Ranga Tours, just outside the hotel across the train track at the massage centre, which also did amazing 1 hour massages for just £15. 

A couple of things to bear in mind and for management to review.
lots of small steps 4 or 5 at a time, but better handrails needed with these not something i would normally think of but an injury (before I came) made me realise that people with mobility issues could use some extra support. Better lighting in bathrooms. Better hairdryers.
title: 3rd time in sri lanka, and the best hotel we stayed in.

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip: Prendre beaucoup de petites coupures … non pas que le personnel demande:leur attention et gentillesse mérité bien un petit cadeau
text: Super hôtel , avec le sourire et la bienveillance pour les hôtes. Dommage que la plage soit inexistante . Oui nous étions en période de mousson mais tout à fait agréable question température de l’air et de la piscine . Très bon massage même à l’hôtel d’à coté où il y a plus de choix . Beaucoup de touristes anglais et allemand .. pour le français dur dur 😜 nourriture très bonne et variée : internationale ou du pays . Un grand merci pour la gentillesse du personnel qui font tout pour vous satisfaire ! Bravo ! Et à bientôt…

text:
I had such a fantastic time during my stay! The staff were absolutely amazing – so friendly, helpful, and genuinely welcoming from the moment I arrived.

The rooms were lovely – very clean, comfortable, and well-maintained. A special mention to the housekeeping team for their creative towel and flower displays – such a thoughtful and beautiful touch that made each day feel special.

One of the highlights was watching Chef Rohan prepare a prawn curry – a real treat to see his skill in action, and the curry was delicious! I also went on a scenic bike ride with Lahiru, the hotel animator, who was an excellent guide. He was so lovely, full of energy, and made the whole experience fun and memorable.

Lahiru also joined in with the pool games and really brought everyone together. His enthusiasm made such a positive impact on the group and helped create an enjoyable, lively atmosphere for everyone.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay – from the people to the activities to the food, everything was exceptional. Highly recommended!
title: Amazing Stay – Wonderful Staff and Unforgettable Experiences!

text:
Just back from an amazing tour of India, followed by an equally amazing 2 week stay at The Royal Palms Beach Hotel Sri Lanka. 
The service throughout our stay was exceptional.  All the staff were helpful, friendly and a credit to the hotel. The hotel had excellent facilities, lovely grounds, was well maintained and always clean. 
Although there was limited access to the beach, the hotel grounds and  pool more than made up for it. 
The choice and quality of food in the main restaurant was excellent. There were always a good mix of local and western dishes. While mainly buffet style, there were also a number of chef stations offering freshly cooked options. There was also a room within the buffet area dedicated to the most amazing cakes & desserts.... so many wonderful choices!!
While all the staff provided top class service, we would like to highlight a few individuals for a special mention. Our room attendant, Mahish was fantastic. He was always helpful, friendly and efficient and provided flower and towel creations on a daily basis.
Kasun in reception also stood out by giving excellent service. Always helpful & friendly and often going the extra mile in ensuring we were looked after.
While the hotel was well located for trips out (we had 4 days out on trips) and the local town, Kalutara was well worth visit, we also spent a good deal of time using the pool. The pool attendants were brilliant. Nimal & Priyantha were lovely people, always helpful and attentive.
We found the whole stay excellent, but the most noticeable thing that stood out was your helpful & friendly staff. They are all a real credit to the hotel.
We will definitely be recommending the Royal Palms Beach Hotel and hope to come back soon.
title: Exceptional Service

Rooms spot on, very clean and re stocked with everything daily.towel art in rooms really clever.food, a lot of choice and really good quality.staff , very polite and helpful ,cant do enough for you.pool staff excellent.we new about certain drinks were extra but £3.50 for a glass of wine and £6.00 for a cocktail ,really cheap .most inclusive drinks were fine and i think we tried everything more than once!.fantastic hotel ,good food and drink and plenty of sunshine. The staff are a credit to the royal palms .we would definately consider coming back.highly recommended.
title: Top notch hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you sincerely for your gracious and heartfelt feedback. We are truly honored that you chose Royal Palms Beach Hotel to celebrate such a momentous occasion, and we are delighted to hear that your wedding day was everything you envisioned and more. It brings us immense joy to know that our team was able to support you in every detail, from the stunning setup of the wedding hall to the exceptional dining experience that received such wonderful praise. We are especially pleased that the complimentary honeymoon suite added a memorable touch to your celebration.
Your kind recognition of Mr. Amara and Mr. Chandima is deeply appreciated. We will certainly share your commendations with them, as they will be proud to know their dedication made your experience truly unforgettable.
Once again, thank you for your trust and recommendation. 
We wish you both a lifetime filled with love and happiness and look forward to welcoming you back for many more special moments in the future.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
We highly recommend the Royal Palms Beach Hotel to anyone without hesitation. The team provided outstanding support for our wedding, ensuring every detail was perfectly executed. The wedding hall looked absolutely stunning and created a truly magical atmosphere. The food was exceptional—every dish was delicious and beautifully presented, receiving compliments from all our guests. We were also offered a complimentary honeymoon suite, which was equally impressive and added a special touch to our celebration.

A heartfelt thank you to Mr. Amara for his exceptional coordination and dedication, and to Mr. Chandima for his kind assistance throughout. Their efforts made our wedding experience truly unforgettable.
Thank you so much!
Didulana & Menushi
9th May 2025
title: A Magical Wedding Day at Royal Palms

I would like to thank the staff of Crown Hotel in Kandy, Sri Lanka for a wonderful experience. The rooms are luxurious, very clean, and the service is excellent. The reception and housekeeping staff are respectful and professional. We booked breakfast and dinner – the food was delicious and the buffet had a great variety. The staff were very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for a pleasant family stay.
title: Kindy City the Golden Crown Hotel

text:
We had an absolutely wonderful experience at the Golden Crown Hotel. The room was spacious, spotless, and incredibly comfortable — especially the bed! We also loved the beautiful view from our window, which added an extra touch of relaxation to our stay.

The staff were outstanding — always friendly, smiling, and eager to help. A special thank you to Ms. Kaveesha in the green saree, who was exceptionally kind and attentive. All the other staff members were equally helpful and welcoming, making us feel right at home.

The buffet was a highlight! It was delicious and perfectly catered to our tastes, especially since we were ready for a break from spicy food. The breakfast buffet offered a great variety that really hit the spot.

This hotel has definitely earned a spot on our list for a return visit. Highly recommended!
title: Exceptional Stay at Golden Crown Hotel!

text:
I had a pleasant and comfortable stay at The Golden Crown Candy Hotel. The room was clean and well-prepared, and the staff were friendly and helpful.
The hotel’s location is excellent, close to many tourist attractions, which made it easy to get around.
One of the highlights was the very affordable laundry service – a great value.
However, the café prices were surprisingly high compared to nearby places.
Breakfast was good, though a bit more variety would be appreciated.
Overall, I recommend this hotel for a convenient and enjoyable stay.
title: Good Value Stay with Excellent Laundry Service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Charitha,
Thank you for your thoughtful review and for choosing Kithala Resort for your family trip to Kataragama! We're delighted to hear that you had a relaxing stay and enjoyed the peaceful surroundings, friendly service, and the breathtaking views of the paddy fields.
We’re pleased that the booking process was smooth and that our team provided helpful assistance both online and over the phone. Your kind words about our tranquil location, greenery, and welcoming atmosphere mean a lot to us.
It’s great to know that you found your room spacious, comfortable, and perfect for unwinding with a book and a cup of tea. We appreciate your feedback regarding the bathroom and will certainly take it into account for future improvements.
We’re happy that our buffet meals met your expectations and that our staff contributed to your enjoyable dining experience. It’s always our goal to provide a warm and welcoming service.
We’re glad you made the most of your relaxing stay and appreciate your insights about the excursions we offer. Your comments will help other travelers looking for a serene getaway or an adventure-filled stay.
Thank you once again for your valuable feedback. We hope to welcome you back for another memorable stay at Kithala Resort
 
Warm Regards,
Mahesh De Silva,
Front Office Manager.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The paddy field overlooking the hotel may not be green throughout the year. The beautiful green color is there when they are young.
text:
I stayed here during a trip to Kataragama with my family. The booking process was smooth, and I did it online. They have a pretty functional web site and are very responsive with the phone.

Location
It's located in Thissamaharama away from the clutter of the city in a very quiet environment. Perfect place for a relaxing stay.

Hotel
The front of the hotel just faces the main road and looks quite ordinary but don’t let the looks from the front deceive you. The back of the hotel is totally different from the front. It looks over pure greenery of the grass covered open area and the paddy field. The paddy was still young, so it had brilliant green which was soothing for the eyes. In between there is a nice pond which attracts birds. The pool is also situated in the garden overlooking the paddy field, which is quite nice.

Accommodation
We booked a triple room on half board basis. Our room was on the upper floor next to the stairway leading up to the garden. The room is spacious but not the largest in the class, very clean, and it has a private balcony with a breathtaking view of the green paddy fields and the garden. Great place to read a book and relax while zipping tea. The room consists of all the basic facilities including TV, sofa, safe etc… Also, it had tea making facilities. The only negative point I had with the room is its bathroom. It’s a bit cramped and the door of the bathroom cubical was hitting the shower head which misaligns it. And the showerhead is too far for a short person to adjust. Though it’s not a dealbreaker it was a bit inconvenient. But it had all the toiletries.  The beds were very comfy and overall, I am happy with the room though I had some negatives on the bathroom.

Food
We had dinner and breakfast from the hotel. Both were offered as buffets. The spread was relatively small but quite sufficient to fill you up. It was just right for us, and we loved it. The service received during meals was great. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. 

Service
We received great service from the hotel staff. The staff was extremely friendly and quite happy to respond to our requests and was ready to provide a detailed explanation of the aspects of the hotel when we had questions. Loved the great service from the friendly staff.

The hotel offers some excursions like safaris, but we didn’t took part because we came there to have a relaxing time which we did.

Overall, we loved the stay at the hotel. It's an excellent place for families or groups of friends to have a relaxing time with some safari adventures.
title: Comfortable stay with friendly service...

text: Our stay at The Backwaters Lodge was outstanding - the emphasis on using renewable resources and avoiding plastics was very much in tune with the wild location. The proprietor was very welcoming and knowledgeable and I loved the little signs around the site mixing humour and eco-philosophy, such as, on a path, “No Wi-Fi beyond this point. Connect with Nature.” My room was a cabin at tree height made from a shipping container - it was pristine inside and very comfortable. Outside the forest hummed with life. Menus were discussed and our delicious meals planned and made to order, all served in the covered dining area above the river. Besides the amazing safaris that we went on there were lots of other activities on offer for another time!
title: Pristine accommodation in a spectacular tropical setting.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay at Backwaters Lodge. Hope to see you again soon.

text:
Great location with serene surroundings. The best bit about our stay was the service and the food. Mr. Tarique and all the staff couldn’t have been more helpful or friendly. The food was just delicious and so much of it. The room was very comfortable with a river view and the lodge had many places to sit and relax and enjoy the peace and tranquility. Everything went smoothly. The safaris were fantastic, with a very knowledgeable driver. Saw so many birds, elephants, deer, sloth bear, crocodile, wild boar, mongoose, monitor lizards and the elusive leopard. 
Would recommend this place to anyone thinking of visiting Wilpattu NP.
title: Magical experience

text: This is a great place to unwind and enjoy nature. We stayed for 4 nights and, although unusually heavy rain curtailed some activities, we enjoyed the nature trail around the property, birdwatching in the rain by tuk tuk, and a fantastic visit to Wilpattu national park on our one dry day. Lakshi and her colleagues looked after us very well; Lakshi is the woman who knows everything and efficiently arranged everything for us. The food was excellent and, as vegetarians, we were delighted to find we were given different foods to try each day, all of which were delicious. roomTip: Monitor unpredictable flood levels in the area due to climate change
text:
We loved our stay.  A warm welcome awaited us as we staggered in with our backpacks after the tuktuk ride up from Puttalam. Lahkshi ushered us to our adorable treehouse and got us up to speed with her fluent English, which we appreciated.  All the moving parts of this operation are in good repair. It all runs crisply with precision and good humour.
Each staff member is thoughtful and helpful. The kitchen is 5 star quality, which is crucial when it is the only option in town.
    They cater to all tastes and they were shocked and delighted to get our request for ‘more spicy sambal please!’  Sumptuous desserts!
We had mostly abnormal rainfall but had a great time none the less. 
We loved taking the kayak out and exploring the rich wildlife on and above the backwaters. 
All good, 2 thumbs up👍👍‼️ - Oj and Rosa from Canada
title: Sumptuous cuisine and joy on the water and in the trees!

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. we are so happy you enjoyed the stay at Backwaters Lodge. Hope to see you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
Upon our arrival, we were warmly welcomed with delicious lemon juice. Our room offered a stunning view of the river peeking through a jungle of trees. The room itself was very spacious and there's also a forest trail of around 1100m around the hotel .The dinner was simple yet very delicious as the string hoppers noodles were the best we've ever had, including its side curries. The breakfast was equally good as well with beautiful scenery around us as we ate with the sounds of nature surrounding us. The staff was very friendly and attended to us including arranging a river safari for us which displayed the great view of the trees and birds beside  the river. 
A highly recommended stay due it's amazing food,scenery and staff
title: Beautiful eco-friendly hotel

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel was an extremely comfortable stay. I stayed here for two nights and slept very well both nights. The room was spacious and clean, and the food is surprisingly good, compared with a standard hotel buffet. The staff were all extremely friendly, which to some extent may be an institutional policy since EVERYBODY goes out of their way to say hello/good morning, which was much appreciated. However it went beyond this. After learning that I felt unwell, one guy working in the restaurant called Chaminda went out of his way to find off-menu Sri Lankan remedies (such as lime juice) that would help me feel better. While the pool is nice and it's generally a good place that I would recommend, it was this kind of proactive kindness that made me feel really good about my stay. Thank you brother Chaminda! The only small downside is that when we were checking out, a few minutes before settling our final bill we put our own suitcases in our car in preparation to leave instead of asking a porter, and the security man from the front desk suspiciously came over to our room/car as though he thought we were planning to make off without payment, which was unnecessary. Otherwise this place is amazing and I would definitely stay here again!
title: Extremely comfortable and friendly

Dear Ananda,

Greetings from Kandy Myst by Cinnamon!

Thank you for taking the time to share such a positive and detailed account of your stay.

We are pleased to learn that you found our property to be a "Hidden Gem," offering a blend of elegance and comfort in Kandy. Your appreciation for our thoughtfully designed rooms, rooftop amenities, and the culinary offerings at Grains is highly valued. 

We are especially grateful for your recognition of the exceptional service provided by our team under the guidance of our General Manager, Mr. Dhinal Perera.

Manager, Guest Service
Kandy Myst by Cinnamon
placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
text:
A Hidden Gem in Kandy with Exceptional Personalized Service  

Nestled near the heart of Kandy, this intimate property—opened in February 2025—offers a seamless blend of elegance, comfort, and accessibility to the city’s rich cultural sights. Thoughtfully designed rooms feature expansive windows that frame breathtaking views, while the rooftop bar and pool area provide a serene escape with stunning panoramas and cozy seating nooks, perfect for unwinding from day to night.  

Dining at Grains was a culinary delight, with an impressive selection of both local and international dishes at breakfast and lunch (open all day), catering to every palate.  

Yet, what truly sets this property apart is its unparalleled hospitality, orchestrated by the visionary leadership of GM Dhinal Perera. More than just a general manager, he is the heart and soul of this establishment, cultivating a culture of warmth, attentiveness, and excellence. His commitment to guest experience is reflected in every interaction, from the genuine smiles that greet visitors upon arrival to the seamless service that ensures every stay is flawless. Under his guidance, the team transforms hospitality into an art, making each guest feel not just welcomed, but truly at home. Here, service isn’t just impeccable—it’s an unforgettable, deeply personal experience.

Look forward to our next stay!
title: This intimate Kandy property offers breathtaking views and exceptional hospitality

text:
Eventhough it was close to the town of Kandy, the hotel had a very peaceful and relaxing vibe with beautiful surroundings. The view from the hotel, especially from the rooftop is amazing, especially of the hills and greenery. The rooms are very clean, modern and comfortable, with anything you need. 
The staff were very kind and helpful all the time, and their service made the stay feel even more special. The food was also good with a good mix of local and international flavours, and the restaurant had a really nice architecture. Special thanks going out to, Haritha, Theekshana, Nethulya, Dhananjaya, and chef Sujith at the restaurant/kitchen for that wonderful service.
If you are visiting Kandy and in need of a calm and stylish place to stay, I really recommend Myst by Cinnamon. It’s perfect for relaxing and enjoying nature and surroundings, whether you come with family, friends or even solo it’s the perfect spot. The rooftop infinity pool and bar takes the stay to a whole higher level, and is the perfect place to relax with friends or family, and personally my favourite place from the hotel.
title: Our stay at Kandy Myst by Cinnamon

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mendis,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your recent experience at Kandy Myst by Cinnamon. We are thrilled to hear that you had one of your best hotel experiences with us! 

It’s fantastic to know that you enjoyed the stunning mountain views from your room on the 12th floor, as well as our modern amenities. We're especially pleased to hear that you found the dining experience at Grains to be a highlight, with our variety of cuisines and freshly made pastries.

We truly appreciate your kind words regarding our rooftop infinity pool; it is indeed a special spot for many of our guests. Our team prides itself on providing excellent service, and it is wonderful to hear that you felt well taken care of during your stay.

Thank you for the recommendation! We can’t wait to welcome you back on your next trip to Kandy. Please let us know if there’s anything special, we can do to make your next stay even better.

Warm Regards,

Niroshan Dinuka
Manager, Front Office
placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
text:
We had one of the best hotel experiences at Kandy Myst by Cinnamon. This 14-floor resort is a modern architectural gem with high-tech features and spotless interiors. Our room on the 12th floor offered stunning mountain views, and the bathroom was stocked with all luxury amenities.

Check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient. Dining at Grains was a highlight—buffet meals were generous, with Indian, Italian, Sri Lankan, and international cuisines available, plus live stations. The pastries and bread were fresh and delicious at every meal. We especially appreciated the wide variety of meats and seafood options even at breakfast!

The rooftop infinity pool is unforgettable—swimming with views of misty hills during sunrise and sunset felt surreal. The hotel also offers ample parking across multiple floors and is located just minutes from Kandy town.

Staff throughout the hotel were incredibly hospitable and attentive. Though the hotel only opened in March, it already operates at a high standard of cleanliness, service, and guest experience.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Kandy. We’ll definitely be returning!
title: A Truly Exceptional Stay at Kandy Myst – Modern Luxury with Breathtaking Views

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
Hilton Colombo Residences continues to be my preferred place to stay whenever I’m in Colombo, and for good reason. This was not my first visit, and every time I return, I’m reminded why I choose this property — the exceptional service and genuine hospitality that goes above and beyond expectations.

From the front desk and concierge to the room service and Flow restaurant staff, the level of professionalism, courtesy, and care is truly world-class. Every interaction I had during my stay was with someone who was not just doing a job, but clearly committed to creating a memorable experience for guests.

The staff at all levels are courteous, helpful, and pleasant — real ambassadors of Hilton’s service excellence. Their dedication to guest satisfaction is evident in every detail, and they truly uphold the highest standards that the Hilton brand is known for. Without a doubt, the people here are Hilton Colombo Residences’ greatest asset.

I would like to take a moment to personally acknowledge a few team members who stood out during this stay: Vinya, Jinanjali, Manodya, Tharaka, Travene, Dasantha, Denuvan, Chanthula — and especially Chef Rohan, whose warmth and culinary expertise added a special touch to my experience. There are certainly many more who contributed to making my stay exceptional — these are just the names I happened to catch.

To the entire team at Hilton Colombo Residences: thank you once again for a fantastic stay. I look forward to returning soon.
title: A Consistently Outstanding Experience at Hilton Colombo Residences

placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
Recommendation for Colombo Hilton’s Resident Facilities

Colombo Hilton offers an outstanding selection of resident facilities designed to provide relaxation, rejuvenation, and luxury. Whether you are looking to unwind after a long day or indulge in a wellness experience, the hotel ensures a premium lifestyle with world-class amenities.

The steam room and sauna are perfect for those who want to detoxify and relieve stress. The heat therapy helps improve circulation, relax muscles, and promote overall well-being. These facilities create an ideal environment for relaxation, making them a great way to unwind after workouts or a busy day.further best hospitality was given by Jason from the sports center.

For a more soothing experience, the jacuzzis offer the ultimate comfort. The warm, bubbling water soothes sore muscles, relieves tension, and provides a sense of deep relaxation. Whether you want to enjoy a peaceful moment alone or spend time with friends, the jacuzzis provide a luxurious escape.

The fitness centre at Colombo Hilton is well-equipped with modern gym equipment, catering to those who wish to maintain an active lifestyle. With professional trainers available, residents can achieve their fitness goals effectively.

The swimming pool is another highlight, offering a refreshing retreat. Whether you prefer a leisurely swim or an energizing workout, the pool area provides a serene and well-maintained environment.

For a complete wellness experience, the spa services offer a range of treatments, including massages and facials, ensuring ultimate relaxation.

With its exceptional facilities and high standards of service, Colombo Hilton provides residents with an unparalleled living experience, blending comfort, relaxation, and luxury seamlessly.
title: Nice experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Hema 

Thank you so much for your heartwarming and detailed review! On behalf of the entire team at Hilton Colombo Residence, I would like to express our sincere gratitude for your kind words and continued loyalty over the past three years. It is truly an honor to have you stay with us year after year, and we are thrilled to know that we have been able to provide you with exceptional experiences on each visit.

I am particularly touched by your recognition of the team members who have made your stays memorable, including Shanaka, Priyal, Ruwan, Naleen, Romesh, Chef Rohan, Chef Manoj, Rukmal, Travene, Jinanjali, Migara, Nipuni, Dinuka, Raj, and Isuru. It is a testament to their dedication and passion for providing outstanding service. Your thoughtful acknowledgment of their efforts is deeply appreciated and will certainly motivate everyone to continue delivering the high standards you have come to expect from us.

We are also glad that you enjoyed the prime location, cleanliness, and quality of our food and service. We strive to maintain our property to the highest standards, and it’s wonderful to hear that our efforts are appreciated.

I personally look forward to welcoming you back in early 2026, and I assure you that we will continue to go above and beyond to ensure your next stay is as memorable as your previous visits.

Once again, thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are excited to welcome you back in the near future.

Best regards

Karim Schadlou
General Manager

Hotel is well maintained, clean, situated in a prime position in Colombo. Food is excellent as well as the service. There are many members who are willingly go extra mile to help guests. placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
I have been a regular guest at this property, and the customer service standards have always been exceptional. As a Diamond member, this remains my top choice for accommodation. During my recent stay, Sabarishna from housekeeping went above and beyond—his service was outstanding. Additionally, many other staff members have consistently delivered top-notch hospitality, making each stay truly enjoyable.

However, the security staff remains a major disappointment. Despite my previous complaints, their service standards are well below expectations. I have never encountered such arrogance at a Hilton property. Today, I once again had to report an incident to the front office after being obstructed on my way to my room while using the digital key. Their attitude and lack of professionalism are unacceptable and do not align with the otherwise excellent service provided by the rest of the team.

Overall, while the hospitality from most of the staff is impeccable, the experience is tarnished by the unprofessional behavior of the security personnel. I sincerely hope management takes immediate action to address this issue.
title: Exceptional Service from Staff, But Security Needs Urgent Improvement.

This was by far and away the best hotel we stayed whilst on our tour, which was a shame because we hardly had any time in it (we arrived around 4pm and left at 5am to go on safari).

Overall I would absolutely recommend.

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t miss the boat.
text:
My stay at the hotel was absolutely wonderful from start to finish! I truly enjoyed every moment. All the staff were incredibly friendly, respectful, and helpful — always smiling and easy to communicate with. The food was delicious and varied, and everything was very clean.

The room was spacious, spotless, and super comfortable. It had a fridge, great air conditioning, and was well-organized to make you feel right at home. The view from the room was absolutely stunning — like living inside a painting, whether from the balcony or through the window.

One of the highlights of the trip was the boat safari — we saw crocodiles up close, water buffalo, exotic birds, and even bats hanging in the trees! It was such a magical and smooth experience, perfectly arranged and timed.

Another unforgettable feature was the swing they have at the hotel — it’s literally suspended between the hotel and the sea, and as you swing, you feel like you’re flying between the two worlds. It was such a peaceful and thrilling experience at the same time!

From check-in to check-out, everything was seamless and smooth. Big thanks to the whole team for making this stay truly unforgettable. I would definitely love to come back again!

Btw, I stayed only for half day as I reached late and left around 11am.
title: Unforgettable , i adore everything.
