placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: What a wonderful place to spend my forst night in Sri Lanka. The room was exquisite. The food was just first class. The staff could not have been more welcoming and wanted to make sure evrything was 100%. Thanks you for a great stay and giving me an amazing first impression of your wonderful country.
title: My amazing introduction to Sri Lanka's hospitality, food and good vibes.

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: We, one adult and two teenagers, stayed three nights at Monsoon Villa and we absolutely loved it! An essential part of the experience is the extremely attentive and helpful hotel staff! We spent a lot of time enjoying the private plunge pool. Two of the bedrooms have attached bathrooms, AC and are luxurious. The third one is also beautiful and cozy but can’t be cooled down as well as the two others. Breakfast was delicious and there are differen options to choose from. Some things that are good to note: 1) There are no restaurants or bars nearby but there’s no need for them since the hotel restaurant serves excellent food. They often ask you to book lunch and dinner in advance. If you wish to try some other restaurants in Negombo, Pick Me app works well and also the hotel staff helps to book tuktuks, taxis, and any other trips. 2) The nearby beach is not suitable for swimming. However, we walked there and watched birds and saw some local fishermen drying fish. We also found the walk through the local neighborhood interesting. 3) There is a church on the other side of the river and some religious music can be heard in the villa but we liked it. The atmosphere of Waterland is fascinating in many ways and we already miss that. We will definitely be back if we ever have the chance to visit Sri Lanka again!
title: A perfectly relaxing visit in a special atmosphere!

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow! What a hidden gem! I love it when I stay somewhere that totally exceeds my expectations, and this place ticks every box and more. The MOST comfortable bed I have ever slept on (in over 30yrs of travel), stunning views, rooms, service and attention to detail. My friends and I stayed in The Peacock Villa, a split level two bed, with a triangular private pool (deceptively large) overlooking the river, for two nights after a long journey out to Sri Lanka from the UK. It was the perfect spot to decompress for a couple of days. Nothing was too much effort for the staff, from getting our room ready early after a long journey, to organising tuk tuks (big shout out to Nicolas and Sunni who ferried us around multiple times!) to arranging a rover boat cruise (a must) and talking us through the breakfast menu! The local resteraunts are great value and catered well for our less spicy European taste buds. I'd recommend a resteraunt called Toro for a good all rounder, and some great live music. The fish market in negombo is worth a visit (via tuk tuk, which are plentiful and inexpensive, however I would recommend using the same drivers and contacting them by WhatsApp, or being firm on the rate prior to the journey if flagged down). We had no issue paying US dollars or rupees, but found the gold shops gave the best rate changing GBP into local currency.
Wouldn't hesitate to stay again, was really quite spectacular. And watching the fireflies dance over the pool on the last evening was something I will cherish. If you follow the road from the hotel to the right, a 10 min walk will take you down to the beach/estuary where you will get a wonderful sunset/sunrise view.
title: Superb

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Das Waterland ist ein kleines Paradies im Grünen 😍
Sehr schöne Villa (wir waren in der Peacock Villa) mit grossen Zimmern und Badezimmern. Sauber, leckeres Essen, grossartiger Service, wundersch��ne Lage - auch in der Nähe zim Flughafen. Absolut zu empfehlen 👍

ownerResponse/text:
We're so happy to hear that you had a great experience and found the hotel to be wonderful!

It's good to hear that you enjoyed the cozy feel, the villa, the luxury of a private pool.  The private pool is indeed one of the defining features of a stay at Waterland.

The menu at Waterland is quite limited.  This allows us to do lots of live action cooking with fresh ingredients and to ensure that what we serve is special.  It's gratifying to hear that you appreciated the range of the menu and the local sourcing of the ingredients. 🍽️

You will not find a fresher cup of coffee anywhere on the island.  The coffee is grown locally and roasted and ground on site.

Your suggestion that guests explore the grounds is excellent.  The garden is the pet project of the manager and he and the staff have done a marvelous job of transforming a coconut plantation into a tropical oasis.  In addition to the beauty of the garden, the garden offers a chance to see how different fruits, herbs, and spices are grown.

Your kind words about the staff are most appreciated.  The staff are professional to be sure, but it their warmth and gentle personalities that really stand out. 

Thank you for recommending Waterland so highly and for taking the time to write such a lovely review. 🙏

Warm wishes from all of us at Waterland.

 Thanks too for recommending Waterland so enthusiastically as a great place to start a trip to Sri Lanka. 🇱🇰

First and last impressions of a country play a disproportionate roll in shaping our experiences.  We're glad that Waterland provided a relaxing and memorable start to your Sri Lanka journey.

roomTip: Bring binoculars to see the wildlife on the river
text: Waterland was a great place to relax on arriving in Sri Lanka. The Peacock suit was perfect with two huge bedrooms. It had a lovely plunge pool and a beautiful balcony to admire the view of the river. We watched Brahminy kites fly above the hotel and saw cormorant and egret fishing. We also saw a large water monitor making its way across the river. The hotel staff were really friendly and we loved the welcome from the cat who joined us each evening. We also liked the Sri Lankan breakfast made in front of us.
title: Great place to start a Sri Lanka trip

placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: Waterland provided a perfect setting and relaxed atmosphere to  overcome jetlag and become acclimated to Sri Lanka. The location was quiet and had a great river view. An added bonus was watching the fruit bat migration each day at sundown. The Peacock Villa contained a lower and upper bedroom with large bathrooms and spacious outdoor decks plus a private swimming pool. The staff were attentive to all our needs. The restaurant was small but provided good food and great service. The hotel was roughly 25 minutes from the CMB airport and a distance away from traffic and from the downtown area.  However, taxi and tuk tuk rides were easily arranged with the hotel. We particular enjoyed the river cruise arranged by the hotel.
title: Great place to unwind

Nous sommes ravis d'apprendre que vous avez particulièrement apprécié le safari en bateau. Ce type de safari offre une façon unique d'explorer la nature environnante et nous sommes fiers d'être le seul hôtel de Negombo à proposer des visites guidées en bateaux décorés directement depuis l'hôtel.

Nous sommes désolés d'apprendre que vous avez trouvé le petit-déjeuner correct, mais pas particulièrement à votre goût. Les repas comptent généralement parmi les moments forts de l'expérience client. Nous sommes désolés que le menu ne vous ait pas particulièrement séduit. Il met en avant la cuisine locale et la cuisine fusion, préparées avec des ingrédients frais. Le chef cuisinier étudie actuellement la possibilité d'élargir légèrement la carte afin d'offrir davantage de choix à ceux qui ne souhaitent pas consommer de plats sri-lankais.

Tout le personnel de Waterland vous souhaite bonne chance.

ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrter Gast,
Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich nach Ihrem zweiten Besuch in Sri Lanka die Zeit genommen haben, uns Ihr wertvolles Feedback mitzuteilen. Wir freuen uns sehr, dass Sie einen wundervollen Aufenthalt im Royal Palms Beach Hotel hatten und unsere gepflegten Einrichtungen, den freundlichen Service, die sauberen Zimmer und die köstliche Küche so geschätzt haben. Besonders freuen wir uns, dass die Herzlichkeit und Gastfreundschaft unseres Teams zu Ihrem angenehmen Aufenthalt beigetragen hat.
Wir danken Ihnen auch für Ihr Verständnis hinsichtlich der saisonalen Meeresbedingungen und freuen uns, dass Sie dank des nahegelegenen Strandes und der Ausflugsmöglichkeiten Ihre Zeit bei uns dennoch optimal nutzen konnten. Es ist schön zu hören, wie sehr Sie die kulturellen Kontakte und die ayurvedischen Wellnessbehandlungen geschätzt haben.
Nochmals vielen Dank für Ihre freundliche Empfehlung. Wir hoffen, Sie bald wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Es war unsere zweite Reise. Bei der ersten Reise im September 2024 wohnten wir in Bentota. 
Unsere zweite Reise nach Sri Lanka (April) hat uns nach Kalutara geführt in das Royal Palms Beach - volle Empfehlung ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ - sehr gepflegte Anlage, nettes Personal, saubere Zimmer, großer Pool, weitläufige Liegewiesen, super leckeres Essen und man ist schnell im Ort - wir haben unseren Urlaub hier genossen. Der fehlende Strand hat uns nicht gestört, da man zu dieser Jahreszeit wegen der Strömung eh nicht baden konnte, den Strandspaziergang konnte man ca. 100 m weiter oder bei Ausflügen nachholen.
Touren - Wir hatten von zu Hause aus vorher einen Guide in der Nähe des Hotels gesucht und mit Kasun’s „Darshana Lanka Tours“ einen Volltreffer gelandet. Alle Touren wurden nach unseren Wünschen angepasst (da wir ja schon vieles gesehen hatten - mit den Veranstaltern kommst du eben mehrmals in die Kräutergärten); unterwegs gab es Empfehlungen und auf unseren Wunsch Essen in lokalen Restaurants; die Zeiten richteten sich nach unseren Wünschen (wenn wir bleiben wollten, blieben wir eben länger); notfalls wurde die Tour angepasst; Kasun begleitet die Touren in Englisch, da wir nicht alle gut englisch sprechen/verstehen (wir waren zu viert unterwegs), haben wir natürlich einen deutsch sprechenden Reiseleiter bekommen; die Fahrer waren alle sicher unterwegs und vieles mehr - alle Ausflüge waren ein Erlebnis 👍🥰
Und wir hatten nicht nur einen Reiseveranstalter gefunden, sondern eine gastfreundliche, liebenswerte Familie kennengelernt. Im heimischen Garten haben wir zusammen Tee geschlürft, die Anpflanzungen erkundet und probiert, frische Kokosnuss geerntet, getrunken und gegessen und eine schöne Zeit verbracht. Und bei Papa gab es tolle ayurvedische Massagen. Es war eine neue Erfahrung und gut für die Gesundheit.🤗🍀
title: Volle Erholung mit vielen persönlichen Ausflügen

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Our room was fantastic, kept so clean and tidy by Mahesh. He was so helpful and we were excited to see petals & towel art when we returned to our rooms after a day out. 
The staff were very helpful. Perhaps the restaurant staff were a little too quick (annoyingly) to clear our plates and to make sure we signed our room bill. The food is fantastic, such a wonderful choice and absolutely delicious. The spa at the hotel could be improved as it wasn’t very relaxing lying in a bright room with no blinds. 
There is a beach area behind the hotel but be warned as local people try to sell you taxis, trips  and clothing,  as soon as you venture out, 
The security gates and “sellers” outside the hotel make it feel a little like being in a compound! 
The reception staff were very helpful, particularly the lady who emailed my daughter to say we had arrived safely after a 24 hour delay! Air India were not helpful at all!!!!
title: Very clean rooms, fantastic food but a few faults

text:
We visited this hotel for the second time in an all-inclusive 2 week format.
There is a lovely, friendly atmosphere at this hotel and once you enter reception there is a wonderful ambience. The staff are incredibly friendly, courteous and helpful and a special mention must go to Madhavee Sachithra, who surrounded us with her hospitality and care from the first days of our stay. She is a very cordial and professional person.

The choice of food in the main restaurant was very good and there was always a good selection of local dishes; although we had to be careful about spiciness on some of them. The delicious desserts were mainly European style and fresh fruit.

The standard of our room was very good. It was large, clean and cleaned daily. Our room 130 was on the ground floor with a balcony and a view of the pool and the sea. 

There were never any problems with sunbeds and the pool staff were always helpful and made sure you had a sunbed of your choice. The pool was beautiful and maintained to a high standard. The pool bar was an added bonus.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Royal Palms. It is one of the best hotels we have stayed in so I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
title: Great hotel and wonderful stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for your lovely and detailed review. We’re thrilled to hear you enjoyed your 9 - day stay, especially the buffet variety, attentive staff, and thoughtful birthday surprise. It’s great to know our vegetarian options and service met your expectations.
We appreciate your constructive feedback regarding the drink's selection and the all-inclusive package timing; these are noted as we strive to improve. We're also glad you found the room comfortable and the tours well organized.
It means a lot to be considered one of the best hotels you've stayed in. We truly hope to welcome you back in the near future.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent 9 days in this lovely hotel .

 Buffet food was delicious and had a good selection daily even though 2 of us were vegetarian, never had an issue. Deserts are to die for. Cocktails are very basic and not much choice, but again knew this on booking and found drinks to enjoy. 

All the staff were polite and friendly and had no issues. I did see some guests being rude to them, but these guests appeared to have no manners for guests also. The staff dealt with them very politely and professionally. The guests are multi cultural, which is great to see and to speak to them 

Check in and out was quick and easy. The only issue I would mention is that my pick up wasn't till 5pm and they are strict with no food or drink inclusive package  from 12. 

The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels offered daily. On my birthday I had a towel elephant and a happy birthday in the room, which was a very nice thought . The room was kept at a good temperature and the bathroom was basic, but had what was needed. Our room was near the railway track and this was not an issue. Didn't wake us up and when heard, it was only for a few seconds. 

Booked a 2 day trip to Ella and Kandy with the mercury rep this was £270 and included the hotel stay in Ella. ( This includes train and safari). Good value and 2 very long days as early starts. The hotel supplied a packed breakfast.

The pool was kept clean and there were plenty of sun loungers, again the pool staff were great and put a towel out for you . 

There is a bar above the restaurant, which is comfortable and has a band in, It would be nice to see some Sri Lanka dancers or music etc, in the evening.  The gym was also cool and had enough equipment for a work out. 

Do read on booking that there is no beach, but it was still lovely to see and hear the sea. Also 1 glass of wine at lunch and dinner only. I had read  this on booking so it wasn't an issue.as saw several guests complaining about these.

Overall one of the best hotels U have stayed in and hope to return one day.
title: Great hotel

Nochmals vielen Dank für Ihre freundlichen Worte und Ihr konstruktives Feedback. Wir hoffen, Sie bald wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen und Ihnen ein noch angenehmeres Erlebnis zu bieten.

roomTip: Ask for rooms in the side wings of the hotel and not those parallel to the road outside, these are much quieter.
text: AMAZING!  The hotel is  beautiful, well maintained and has a relaxed atmosphere.  We stayed in Room 237 (15th - 29th March 2025), it was spacious, the bed was so comfortable and it was extremely clean and tidy - a big shout out to the housekeeping staff for a great job 👍  The food was lovely and there was a big selection, my favourite's were the freshly made waffles and omelettes at breakfast and the butter cake was delicious.  The grounds of the hotel are well maintained and kept tidy by a great team of gardeners, if you're lucky you might see one of then shinning up a palm tree to take off any fruit or dead leaves.  The hotel pool was large and never overcrowded and there were plenty of sun loungers and towels for guests.  The pool attendants were very helpful and happy to chat for a while whilst they went about their business.  The overwhelming memory of the Royal Palm Beach Hotel is the staff, both front and back of house.  They were welcoming, warm and friendly, there's too many to name but one member for the reception team stood out for me, Kasor - I think that's the correct spelling, I am terrible with names but he wore a pair of glasses - he was always smiling and had a great sense of humour, he was a diamond.  The entire staff are an absolute credit to the hotel, they made this holiday the best we've experienced and my husband and I hope to return soon.
title: AMAZING!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for your thoughtful and detailed review following your stay at the Royal Palms Beach Hotel. We are delighted to hear that you had a positive experience, especially after your tour with Mercury Holidays.
We greatly appreciate your kind words about our staff’s warm welcome and exceptional service, including the drink and flannel upon arrival, as well as the quick resolution of the air conditioning issue. We're pleased you enjoyed your spacious room with the beautiful view, the immaculate grounds, and our amazing pool area, complete with the swim-up bar. It’s also wonderful to know that you appreciated our food offerings, particularly the Sri Lankan cuisine.
We also appreciate your constructive feedback regarding the twin beds and bathroom design. We will certainly take your comments into consideration as we continue to enhance our guest experience.
Thank you again for choosing to stay with us. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at this hotel as add on after 8 day Jewels of Sri Lanka tour with Mercury holidays.

Pros

Staff on arrival were amazing.... Drink and flannel to cool is down.  Always polite, well spoken and helpful.

Room was large with beautiful view over pool, grounds and the sea.
Bed comfortable (see cons) with lovely soft pillows
Bathroom, small but everything clean and refreshed daily.

Grounds immaculate.

Pool was amazing.... Swim up bar, what can I say ... And the selection of AI cocktails were perfectly blended by great staff..

Plenty of sunbeds under brollies or palm trees.

Had a problem with Aircon.... Sorted within 5 mins..... Again great staff service

Food - I can't even put into words my feelings on the food..... AMAZING.., I only ate the Sri Lanka food and it never failed to satisfy..... 

Cons - these are cosmetic but should be improved.

Bedroom, 
Twin room beds were comfortable BUT adults should never be given single beds... I kept waking up ever time I turned over as bed was only fit for children.  Used to American queen beds in twin room.

Bathroom.
Was a bath with shower over. Large glass fitment meant getting in and out of bath difficult for older people and quite dangerous.

Overall fantastic hotel...
title: Royal Palms Resort

text:
We had a lovely time in the Backwaters Lodge. We booked the suite and it looks right at the close by river. Staff was just amazing, helpful and super friendly. Food was delicious. We were here on our honeymoon and they did set up a secluded table for us in the lounge area by the river for a romantic dinner with candlelight. The owner was so happy to make us this cute surprise.
We also booked the Safari to Wilpattu with him and he gives very reasonable prices and the Safari was just great.
We did the sunset boat tour, in the rain, so obviously no sunset, but still saw amazing wildlife and birds and had a roundabout just good time here.
title: Great experience in the middle of nature

text:
Super mooie omgeving en dicht bij het natuurpark. 
Wel back to basic, maar prima voor 1 of 2 nachten. Aparte lucht in de kamer (denk dat dit een geur was om insecten mee te verdrijven). 
Eten was prima (meer dan genoeg eten, het was altijd te veel 🙈).
Safari tour 1/2  dag prima geregeld, olifanten, zwijnen, waterbuffalo, aapjes en luipaard gezien. 1/2 dag is dan ook meer dan prima. 

Personeel super vriendelijk en behulpzaam. 
In de avond nog een sunset tour gedaan met de boot, super leuk (vogels spotten, pauwen en nog wat andere dieren) plus nog een klein rondje gelopen om vervolgens in het donker weer terug te gaan met de boot naar het hotel
title: Back to Nature

text: The Backwaters Lodge is back to nature set in a beautiful location on the river. The owner and Manager were so helpful and made us a lovely breakfast and lunch picnic for our 12 hour leopard safari (yes we were lucky enough to see a couple) We did a beautiful sunset boat trip and saw a crocodile and many amazing birds. The food at the restaurant is delicious- they ask you what meat you like (if you eat meat) and prepare a meal for you. It really is a peaceful, tranquil place to visit
title: Tranquil

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your wonderful review.  we are happy that you enjoyed your stay at Backwaters Lodge. We look forward to seeing you again soon
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
The owner is very helpful and friendly, giving plenty of good advice for our visit to Wilpattu.
We only stayed for one day and did a 12 hour safari, but we saw plenty of beautiful and rare animals. Don't only go to see a leopard - enjoy the flora, and the birds and you will have a great time...and who knows you might get lucky (as we did).
Tip the driver - it is hard and tiring work to bounce around driving the jeep all day looking for animals.
If we go again, we would do a half day safari and half day on a boat. That said, we saw a leopard and a bear (even more rare) only at the end of the day, so no regrets doing a 12 hour safari.
A wonderful experience and thanks to Backwaters lodge for all your advice and help!
title: Great accommodation, friendly and funny host!

text: The Backwaters Lodge - Wilpattu is an incredible off-the-grid retreat, far removed from the noise and chaos of the city. The tranquil setting at the edge of the water, surrounded by nature, provides the perfect ambiance for relaxation. We had a truly lovely time during our stay.The staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive, catering to our every need. A special thanks to the owners, Tarique Omar and Ajith Rathnayake, who personally ensured our stay was nothing short of perfect. Ajith took us on a Jeep Safari to Wilpattu National Park, where his expertise as an excellent tracker and deep knowledge of wildlife made the experience unforgettable.We are very grateful for their kindness and hospitality. As a travel agent, I highly recommend The Backwaters Lodge and will definitely bring my clients here. It’s the ideal destination for anyone looking to reconnect with nature and enjoy exceptional service.
title: The Backwaters Lodge - Wilpattu is a hidden gem, perfect for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life

text: The Backwaters hotel is so much more than a hotel. placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
Exactly two years after our first visit we returned to The Backwaters with our good friends from Germany. Tarique Omar’s passion remains and the service and comfort were excellent. Old staff like Das and the new GRO Lakshi made us all feel at home. The local cuisine was originality plus plus. We thoroughly enjoyed boatman Mubarak who knew exactly how to pole a boat taking us on a sunset boat ride in the backwaters. To see the sunset and the moon rising at the same time in utter tranquillity was stunning. Then the boat ride in the expansive Kala Oya estuary with its myriad of shorebirds in their thousands was dazzling, followed by a ride inside the mangroves and a visit to the great Baobab tree. While we could not spot the leopard in Wilpattu National Park we enjoyed the birdlife and landscape composed of Villus, the small natural lakes. 

“While I think of them they are growing rare
after the distances they have followed
all the way to the end for the first time
tracing a memory they did not have
until they set out to remember it
at an hour when all at once it was late
and newly silent and the white had turned
white around them then they rose in their choir
on a single note each of them alone
between the pull of the moon and the hummed
undertone of the earth below them
the glass curtains kept falling around them
as they flew in search of their place before
they were anywhere and storms winnowed them
they flew among the places with towers
and passed the tower lights where some vanished
with their long legs for wading in shadow
others were caught and stayed in the countries
of the nets and in the lands of lime twigs
some fastened and after the countries of
guns at first light fewer of them than I
remember would be here to recognize
the light of late summer when they found it
playing with darkness along the wet sand”
—W.S. Merwin
title: Shorebirds

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your detailed review.  we are sorry about your safari experience. the park has a limited number of guides who can speak good English. they can be taken for an additional fee if booked in advance. safari jeeps are outsourced and the drivers are local villagers who try their best to explain. We look forward to seeing you again soon and will arrange an English-speaking guide for you..
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 3 nights here. We enjoyed our visit overall and thanks to the acting manager Laksy who looked after us well as the manager Tarique was away for most of our stay.
The accommodation is somewhat basic being in a well converted container but don't be put off as everything works fine although it's not large.  You get what you pay for.
The food was fine and we had no complaints on that score.
Our real disappointment was the full day safari. This was organised by Backwaters. Our driver/guide had very limited English and we learnt little from him although he tried hard. Matters weren't improved by his being in a large cab with us sitting in the open back. So he had to lean out of his window to communicate with us! If we had known his limitations we would have taken our usual driver with us and the experience would have been completely different.
On the first evening we did a river trip which was fine as we insisted on an English speaking waiter coming with us as the boat driver wasn't going to be able to do more than point at the birds!
On our second full day we used our usual driver for birdwatching etc. There are so many species in the area.
Later in our holiday we met another couple who had a similar safari experience so it clearly wasn't a one-off.
A shame as otherwise we enjoyed our stay. We were somewhat disappointed by Tarique's reaction to our complaint when he returned the night before we departed.
title: Our stay spoilt by the full day safari

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your wonderful detailed review.  we are so happy that you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to seeing you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons réservé deux nuits au Backwaters Lodge. La communication avec Tarique était bonne en amont du séjour, permettant d’organiser notre séjour et nos activités avant notre arrivée, notamment le safari d’une journée (je recommande vivement une journée entière, c’est mon safari coup de cœur, nous avons pu voir de nombreux animaux de près et 2 léopards !) et une session de kayak sur la rivière. 

Concernant la chambre avec terrasse sur pilotis, le cadre est idyllique, perché dans les arbres, entouré du seul bruit de la nature environnante, une vraie bulle de sérénité ! Les lieux étaient très propres et agréables. L’équipement nécessaire est disponible, sur place ou sur demande. Concernant les prises, certaines sont britanniques et d’autres indiennes donc le choix est là selon votre adaptateur. Un bémol serait le confort du lit, un vrai sommier serait nécessaire pour le confort de tous. Toutefois, tout le reste était largement supérieur à ce point ce qui a permis d’oublier cet inconfort. 

Les parties communes sont très relax, permettant de prendre du temps de détente dans un environnement naturel et préservé. Les petites citations sur la nature et la balade en bord de rivière et forêt avoisinante sont vraiment sympa. Il y a également de belles espèces d’oiseau à observer sur le bord de rivière (martin pêcheurs, aigles, paons …). 

La cuisine est très bonne, nous avons pris plaisir à prendre notre petit-déjeuner et diner à l’hôtel. Le personnel est également très gentil et serviable, nous avons fortement apprécié leur disponibilité et professionnalisme. Je remercie tout particulièrement Tarique pour notre dernier échange sur les oiseaux et sa délicate attention ornithologique qui m’a beaucoup touché 😊. 

Un point à mettre en avant est la démarche écoresponsable de l’hôtel. Cet aspect n’est pas assez mis en avant lors de la réservation donc j’ai été très agréablement surprise de trouver un hôtel œuvrant tant à la préservation de la nature ! (eau filtrée, kit picnic zéro déchet, récupérations etc …). Cela m’aurait encouragé à réserver plus longtemps afin de faire d’autres activités qui sont organisées dans le plus grand respect de la nature (notamment les sorties découvertes des dauphins, j’ai découvert sur place que cela est effectué avec des pêcheurs et non des tours irrespectueux). Cela nous donnera une bonne excuse de revenir dans le futur 😉  Merci à toute l’équipe et au plaisir !
title: Excellent

text: We had a wonderful 4 night stay at Backwaters.  The staff were genuinely welcoming. the location on the river was lovely and there are lots of quiet spots around the property to relax and enjoy the sounds of the wildlife.  The food was delicious - the curries were fantastic and the dining area is really lovely.  Our room had everything we needed and the location in trees was great for bird watching.  There are lots of activities to choose from - we really enjoyed the jeep safaris in Wilpattu National Park, the sunset boat trip and taking a kayak out on the river where we saw masses of birds.  A really great stay - would highly recommend.

text:
Lovely resort with spacious clean rooms overlooking the rice fields with balcony access, swimming pool with adequate amenities. The bathroom needs some renovation/upkeep. The food was adequate for both Indoor or Alfresco dinner. Resort also packed breakfast for our Yala safari early morning excursion (BENTO style) which was a bonus. Staff made a positive impression on us and so we have to thank Surangi and team.  Location is also great if you want to venture to nearby eateries. A great place to unwind for a short stay with beers, swimming in the pool and watching the peacocks dancing.

Mariano & Berta
title: Kithala Resort - for Yala Safari, Tissa Lake and local eateries

ownerResponse/text:

We're also glad you found the presence of peacocks and the little lake with its friendly crocodile to be unique and enjoyable features of your stay. text:
Great hotel. Rooms are a little small but the staff is amazing and superb service. Very friendly and the food is amazing.
There are peacocks that comes in to the hotel yard and the field vore from the pool is very relaxing. Mostly families and one amazing thing is that there is a small crocodile inittle lake inside the hotel. You can throw some bread he/she comes out to the surface. Very safe and we had a great time

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Our family recently stayed at Hotel Sigiriya, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience from start to finish. The staff welcomed us with genuine warmth and made sure every member of our family felt comfortable and cared for throughout our stay.

The hospitality was exceptional — the team was always friendly, attentive, and ready to assist, which made traveling with kids so much easier and stress-free. The hotel’s peaceful atmosphere and beautiful surroundings were perfect for a family getaway.

We also loved the food! The restaurant served a great variety of delicious western, indian and Sri Lankan dishes that everyone enjoyed, including options suitable for the little one. Every meal was fresh, flavorful, and satisfying.

All in all, Hotel Sigiriya offered us the perfect blend of comfort, excellent service, and tasty food. It truly made our family trip special. We would happily return and recommend it to other families visiting the area!
title: A Wonderful Family Stay at Hotel Sigiriya, Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrter Herr Naß,

herzlichen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, Ihre Eindrücke Ihres erneuten Aufenthalts im Jetwing Blue mit uns zu teilen. Es freut uns außerordentlich, dass wir Sie auch bei dieser Reise wieder von unserem Haus überzeugen konnten.

Ein besonderes Dankeschön für Ihre wertschätzenden Worte über unsere Teammitglieder. Es erfüllt uns mit großer Freude zu hören, dass Sie sich durch Niroshan so herzlich betreut gefühlt haben. Sein Engagement, seine Freundlichkeit und sein hoher Anspruch an Servicequalität spiegeln genau die Werte wider, für die wir bei Jetwing stehen. Wir werden Ihr Lob mit großer Freude an ihn weitergeben.

Ebenso bedanken wir uns für die freundliche Erwähnung von Rochell und Benoit aus dem Guest Relations Team. Dass Sie sich durch sie nicht nur professionell, sondern auch persönlich gut aufgehoben fühlten – und sogar in Ihrer Muttersprache Benoit kommunizieren konnten – freut uns ganz besonders.

Ihre Anregung hinsichtlich einer festen Zuordnung von Roomboy und Servicekräften während des gesamten Aufenthalts nehmen wir gerne auf und prüfen dies im Rahmen unserer Qualitäts- und Serviceoptimierung.

Es war uns eine Ehre, Sie erneut bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen, und wir hoffen sehr, Sie bald wieder im Jetwing Blue willkommen zu heißen.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Ihr Guestrelation-Team
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Ein optimales, sehr ansprechendes und komfortables Hotel direkt am Strand gelegen und in relativer Nähe zum Flughafen. Das Personal grundsätzlich aufgeschlossen, hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend. Besonders dabei zu erwähnen ist mein Roomboy Niroshan, der mich von Anfang an mit seinem herzlichen Wesen, seiner Freundlichkeit, seiner Arbeitsleistung sowie dem Bestreben, alle meine Wünsche zu erfüllen, vollkommen überzeugt hat. 
Daneben fielen im Bereich Guest Relation Management Rochell durch ihr immer lächelndes und zuvorkommendes Wesen sowie Benoit als aufmerksamer Ansprechpartner auf. Von herausragendem Vorteil war auch, dass man sich in seiner Muttersprache unterhalten konnte.
Wünschenswert wäre eine dauerhafte Zuordnung von Roomboy und Waiter während des gesamten Aufenthaltes. 
Alles in allem aber immer wieder eine Reise wert. 
Heinz-Jürgen Naß
title: Eine weitere Reise nach Sri Lanka ins Hotel Jetwing Blue...

text: I stayed at The Golden Crown for three nights in April 2025 during a visit to Sri Lanka - the hotel was luxurious and provided a haven of relaxation set high up in the hills overlooking the hustle and bustle of downtown Kandy. At the time of my visit there were thousands of visitors to the city to view the tooth relic being displayed for the first time in 16 years which made the ability to return to the tranquility of this venue even more appreciated. The pool is amazing with its infinity view over the mountains and the rooms extremely comfortable with excellent balconys to walk out onto to enjoy a cup of tea overlooking the Kandy Hills. Breakfast was very enjoyable and the staff were extremely friendly - I would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Luxury in Kandy Hills

ownerResponse/text:
Dear globetrottergrl,

Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your tour of Sri Lanka and for taking the time to share your detailed review. We truly appreciate your feedback—both the positives and the areas where we can improve.

We’re delighted you enjoyed our rooftop pool with its scenic views and the extensive, tasty buffet offerings. However, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the  room location and the condition of your shower. This falls short of the standards we strive to uphold, and we’ve shared your comments with our housekeeping and maintenance teams to address these issues promptly.

Your kind words about our friendly staff mean a lot, though we regret that service felt slow at times. We’ll use your feedback to refine our efficiency and ensure smoother experiences for future guests.

We’re grateful you’d consider staying with us again, and we’d love the opportunity to welcome you back to one of our renovated rooms for a more seamless and enjoyable stay. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to us directly for assistance with your next booking.

Best Regards,

Golden Crown Hotel Management

text:
Stayed one night here during our tour of Sri Lanka. It's a massive hotel - a maze to navigate and we found ourselves in the unrenovated rooms which are far from the restaurant and pool. The rooms were spacious and comfortable - but my shower unfortunately was full of black mold. Service was generally friendly (front desk, restaurant) but slow.
The rooftop pool is a highlight with lovely views of the surrounding hills, and the buffet was very extensive and tasty. I would stay again - but would ask for a room in the newer side.
title: Large hotel, excellent rooftop pool

text:
During our Sri Lankan adventure, this hotel in Kandy wasn't just a stay; it was a highlight. It truly lives up to its 5-star promise. We encountered a small issue with our initial room (which was already beautiful!), and the staff addressed it instantly, upgrading us to an even more spectacular space. That's genuine service!
Everything here speaks quality: the hotel is spotlessly clean, the pool area is a fantastic escape, and the staff are the definition of welcoming and responsive. Breakfast and lunch were both delicious, offering great variety and quality.
But let me emphasize this: the dinner buffet is extraordinary. It's not just good, it's an absolute must-try experience in Kandy. The selection, the flavours, the presentation – it was flawless and left us speechless. Don't miss it! If you're looking for luxury, impeccable service, and incredible food in Kandy, this is the place. Highly, highly recommended!

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
I had a fantastic stay at the Golden Crown in Kandy. I was attracted to the hotel based on the pictures, particularly of the infinity pool and the landscape behind it. I am pleased to say that the pictures don’t do it justice because it is truly magical in person.

From the moment that I checked in, I was welcomed by the staff. They went out of their way to make my stay relaxing and comfortable. 

First and foremost, I am truly grateful to Mihirini who greeted me at the restaurant and went out of her way to ensure that I had an excellent stay. She also arranged an excursion to Pidurangala Rock and Sigiriya Rock. As I was going for a sunrise hike, she arranged a packed breakfast for me to take which was such a kind and thoughtful gesture. 

The food at this hotel is outstanding! I especially loved the Nasi Goreng! The food selection was wonderful. There was a wide variety of Sri Lankan dishes and I particularly enjoyed the curry and dhal.  There were also a lot of Western options. The food was displayed beautifully each day, and the desserts are not to be missed! I found all of the restaurant staff to be kind, helpful and welcoming. I am especially grateful to Moksha who looked after me at the restaurant and also arranged a packed breakfast on the day that I was checking out.

The housekeeping staff were wonderful as well, especially Madusanka.

The atmosphere was very relaxing. It felt like a retreat with the spectacular infinity pool and the lush green hills and palm trees. I enjoyed watching the sunrise from the pool and the sunsets were just as fantastic!

I really loved that the staff wore traditional Sri Lankan clothing, it was a really beautiful touch.

My only regret is that I wish I had booked a longer stay at this amazing hotel!
title: A relaxing environment with beautiful views, outstanding food and exceptional staff!

I have stated here 5 years ago and upon check in the staff recognized me and greeted me as if  I'm their family. The service is superior among other Hilton's I have stayed at around the world. 
I need to specifically acknowledge the FLOW restaurant staff, chef Rohan was outstanding and makes delicious meals with his crew. His talent to make diveryof meals to satisfy anyone from any continent is amazing. I think the Hilton is extremely lucky to have him as the main Chef- you can ask anything special and he will make sure you enjoy his culinary expertise. Stop by the Hopper station run by Janaka.
Rukmal, Raj, Bandara and Nirupika were really outstanding with their customer service to handle guests when the restaurant is fully packed. They greet you and provide everything possible to make you satisfied with the meals. The bar and the restaurant is led by Kasun and he makes sure everyone who comes to these places is satisfied and happy. Try the cocktails made by Hearth with his assistants Suranga and Pasindu. You will never, ever be disappointed. This is my place to stay for my future visits too. I highly recommend this place for anyone who travels to Sri Lanka.

It's so nice to see so many travelers who do not usually write reviews on TripAdvisor motivated to write about their experiences.

We're delighted that you had a fantastic stay at Waterland and your positive remarks about the comfort, the meals, and the personal touches. 

Thanks for staying, for taking the time to write about your experiences, and for your special praise of the staff.  

Waterland has a gorgeous setting with well appointed villas and the luxury of each villa having a private pool.  What makes the difference between a good stay and a fantastic stay, though, is the professionalism and warmth of the staff.

Thanks for recommending Waterland so enthusiastically.

We look forward to welcoming you back.

In the meantime, good wishes from all of us at Waterland.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
roomTip: They add a service charge to every food item which we only noticed after we left s big tip! They even said they would prefer a good review!
text: Fantastic stay at Wayerland villa. The beds were so comfy, the food was fantastic and the staff very friendly and welcoming! We would definitely stay there again if we were to go back to Negombo. They even presented us with a personalised mug, there were many delightful personal touches.
title: Fantastic stay at waterland

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for your wonderful review.

It's marvelous to hear that you had such a relaxing and enjoyable stay after your long flight to Sri Lanka. 

Your review will help others make more informed choices about whether they want to stay at one of the high-rise hotels on the beach in Negombo or whether they want to have a more personal experience off the beaten track.
 
It's lovely of you to highlight some of the special features of a stay at Waterland including  the stunning terraces, the refreshing private plunge pools, the exotic setting, the luxurious rain showers, the combination of modern and heritage design, and the welcoming and helpful staff.

It’s fantastic that you had a chance to enjoy the pool at night – there’s something magical about swimming under the stars. 

Most travelers are now staying at Waterland for several days.  In addition to the billiards, massages, swimming, cooking classes, and photoshoots available on site, your review helpfully notes some other experiences for travelers to consider including a boat safari from our private dock, a visit to the nearby fish market, and exploring the neighborhood by bicycle.

It's wonderful to hear that you were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the cuisine.  The restaurant is fortunate to be led by a dynamic Executive Chef.  He reworked the menu in the summer.  The menu now focuses on live action cooking and highlights special dishes of Sri Lankan cooking,

Good wishes from all of us at Waterland.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
This was perfect for the first night and the following day after the flight to Negombo. The terras of the 2 rooms (with triangular pool) is stunning and very relaxing. Great shower in the bathroom. Very clean and  trendy, but with traditional. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
Swimming late night in the pool is mesmerizing :-) 
Not mutch to do on walking distance, but with the complemenary bicycle you can go to a nearby beach, with a strange deserted mega hotel building. Better to make a trip to the fish market and a boat trip in the lagoon near Negombo. 
Suprising good kitchen for such a small establisment.
title: Just like in the beautiful advertisement pictures

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to write so extensively about your experiences, and for your complimentary review.

We’re honored that you chose to start your honeymoon with us.

It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed every moment of your stay and that you loved the Elephant Villa, especially the plunge pool with the panoramic river view. 

How kind of you to remark that the photos do not do the property justice. There is a magical feeling at the property.  It is indeed difficult to capture that feeling in photos or video.

Many of our guests are coming to celebrate honeymoons, anniversaries, birthdays, and other special occasions.  It's been fun to develop romantic experiences including the floating breakfast and lunch, the romantic welcome with a heart-shaped platform, the boat safari, and the private dining.    

We're glad you got to experience dining under the stars by the water and the boat safari.  Our unique setting between a river and a canal and the private plunge pools allow us to offer guests experiences by the water, in the water, and on the water.

Your kind words about our staff mean a lot to us.  We’re delighted that you felt well taken care of and that the hospitality was wonderful.

 We wish you a lifetime of happiness together.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow! My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our honeymoon and it was fantastic. We arrived early (around 11am) and the staff were very welcoming- we were able to sit in the restaurant and have a drink and they made our villa available earlier so we didn't have to wait long. 

The villa itself (Elephant villa) was fantastic!! The bed was comfortable and the room had everything we needed. The plunge pool with a view over the river was amazing and the photos did not do it justice! We enjoyed having dinner on our veranda one night. We also did a river cruise/ safari which was a great way to see wildlife.

All of the staff were kind, friendly and the hospitality was wonderful. We only regretted not booking it before our flight home!
title: Fantastic start to our honeymoon!

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Definitely worth going to, if you overlook the need for TLC, which you should. It's definitely worth the visit.
text: This is by no means a 5-star hotel, except for the lobby, which is beautiful. The hitel needs quite a lot of TLC. The Colonial style of the hotel is pretty, but it's showing its age in many aspects: lift, shower head, door to terrace not quite closing properly, chipped marble in places, pool towels threadbare, pool sun beds need replacing, etc. However, when we talk about our stay there, we smile, as we both enjoyed it very much. Staff are delightful & caring. Oh yes, another 2 points: the beach is inaccessible due to erosion & a train passes very close to the hotel, but doesn't operate during the night, although unless you're a very heavy sleeper, I wouldn't bank on sleeping late into the morning! But, who cares? It's a beautiful place, so why sleep instead of enjoying!
title: A lovely hotel in need of some TLC

text: I had a great time in this hotel, I traveled to Sri Lanka alone and enjoyed it. the hotel staff is very nice, especialy Kasen, he will help and plan anything you ask for. the hotel room is spacious, available television with international channels. the garden and pool are gorgeous, it's a pitty that the hotel does not have direct access to the ocean because of monsunes, but about 50m from the hotel there is a beautiful entrance to the beach, the sea is clean, huge waves. the beach does not belong to the hotel, so there are local residents here and they offer massages, fish, clothes. either you like it and use it or you show that I don't care and they will leave you alone. I had an all inclusive stay and the food was excellent, really everyone can choose. the hotel sorts waste and tries to go the green way, so it's good to support them . I travelled with the travel agency der tour, I set out to discover the city of Galle with a stop at the turtle station and a cruise at Kogalla beach. the next trip I went on safari and in the moonstone mines. everything was great. on the last day, I left the hotel in the afternoon, I requested a later check out, the hotel manager resolved everything amicably and both parties were satisfied. thank you very much for a great stay. I hope i will be back soon.
title: Great experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share such detailed feedback from your stay. We are delighted to hear that you had a memorable experience and that the location worked well for your excursions. We truly appreciate your recognition of the warmth and dedication of our staff, and we’re pleased that you found our pool attendants and housekeeping team attentive to your needs.
We are also happy to know that you enjoyed our food offerings, including the curries and snacks, as well as the variety of activities available, such as yoga sessions and the gym. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the wristbands and the lack of herbal teas; we are always looking to improve our guest experience and your feedback is valuable in that regard.
It was wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the fresh lime soda, the local wildlife, and the laundry service. Thank you for your understanding regarding the beach situation, and we are glad you found the pool a suitable alternative.
We hope to welcome you back in the future for another enjoyable stay.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Efficient laundry and cashier services. Fresh lime juice drinks. Good location to explore
text:
We stayed two weeks arranged via Tui. Tui was really helpful arranging two trips whilst we were there - a one day one and a two day overnight (in Ella). trips were long days but the hotel location worked well to cover all we visited.
We had a lovely welcome on arrival and a room looking over the sea and pool (302) on top floor. You can hear the trains but we love trains. We were not quite sure when we arrived at this 28 year old hotel what to think but it envelopes you in the warmth and friendliness of the staff. Clearly need for some room upgrades. The pool attendants have been with the hotel since it started (this is not a chain hotel so hence authentic and charming) and ensure everyone has towels and beds - they work really hard. Our room was clean and attended to promptly twice a day including amazing towel art creations!! We loved all the food - delicious curries lunch and supper with snacks morning and teatime if you are all inclusive. Gym is really well kitted out too. You can walk to local Keels supermarket easily to pick up any snacks etc and local gift shops nearby too.
We knew the beach had been washed away so not a problem for us as pool is good size. And also the one glass of wine restriction at meals - if you want more you can purchase however was good way of not drinking to excess!! Yoga sessions to be recommended 2-3 times a week if you like relaxing. We missed the cooking demonstration and kitchen tours due to our external trips. All the bar staff work hard - you can get drinks from pool bar and Cabana bar (latter good to watch sunsets) from 10 am. Their fresh lime and soda is addictive - all hand squeezed.
They also do pork bacon every morning which is unusual in this part of the world.
We weren’t keen on having to wear a green plastic wrist band throughout our stay. They don’t have herbal tea but will make you fresh ginger, lime, mint tea if you ask for it. 
The cashier service is really really efficient. - you can change larger notes to tip (that’s expected in Sri Lanka) and they changed English notes. The laundry service was exceptional and really reasonable - highly recommend.
Watch out for the local iguana family near the pool plus two baby turtles went the wrong way and were rescued. 
To conclude - not 5 star standard in facilities but has masses of character and the staff make it a lovely experience
title: Rustic charm

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. We truly value your insights as they help us enhance the experience we provide to our guests.
We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the television issue and appreciate your patience as our team worked to resolve it. Regarding the beach, we regret that the sea conditions did not meet your expectations, and we are constantly striving to improve the guest experience in light of these challenges.
We are grateful for your kind words regarding our pool area, the overall hotel aesthetics, and the dedicated efforts of our staff. Your comments on food quality and temperature have been duly noted, and we will address these concerns with our culinary team to ensure all dishes are served at the ideal temperature. We also appreciate your feedback on the availability of chicken breast and will consider this for future menu planning.
Regarding the concerns about cleanliness and safety, particularly with the flies and odor issues, we will immediately investigate these areas to ensure they are rectified. Please rest assured that guest health and comfort remain our highest priority.
We also appreciate your thoughts on the restaurant offerings and the vendors outside our hotel, and we will work with local authorities to address this situation.
Once again, thank you for your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and provide a more seamless and enjoyable experience in the future.
placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Would like to have given this a ‘good’ rating instead of ‘very good’ due to a few shortcomings.  In my view it is certainly nowhere near 5 star standard, an average 4 star at best.   The hotel is located right next to the sea and not beach as described in other reviews.  We had a problem for the first 3 days as the television would not work despite 3 attempts by various members of staff to rectify the situation.  In the end, they did as I suggested and changed the tv and remote to give us a set that finally worked ! We understand the beach was washed away and now you certainly couldn’t swim immediately on the sea side of the surrounding fence as it was far too rough. The pool was perfect and meandered from the pool bar area, under a bridge to the other side of the hotel and was a great temperature and kept very clean by the hard working towel / sun bed guys. The hotel has a great reception and bar area with beautiful antique ornaments, furniture artefacts  and wall mounted old doors etc throughout. We were on all inclusive basis and whilst there was plenty of food to choose from I was very disappointed that the food was not kept hot in the serving containers.  This meant various dishes had been sat for a long time and were less than luke warm when serving yourself ! Not everyone closed the lids on dishes which meant the flies helping themselves to what was on offer, not a pretty sight.  Vegetarians were very well looked after with a good range of dishes, sadly the same can’t be said about meat eaters like myself.  Chicken used was always thighs / legs and overcooked both on the grill and in curried style dishes. It would have been nice to have had the opportunity to eat a chicken breast dish but it seems the hotel do not go to this expense. I queried this with the head chef one evening and he simply said “no problem, I will arrange a breast of chicken curry dish for you tomorrow night”.  This was not the point I was trying to make as I said this should be available for all diners without asking for it.  Soups and sweets were of excellent quality. The croutons placed next to the soup container was a haven for flies as it was left uncovered, I mentioned this to a member of staff on our 2nd day, but 7 days later the flies were still dining out on the croutons !  The staff here are very smartly presented and work very hard and interact with guests very well, the hotel is lucky to have such pleasant people working for them. Our room was well looked after and in good working, but noisy a/c.  Our room was located close to the ground floor plant room and this was very noisy with mechanical noises to be heard through the night. Also, first think in the morning there is a very strong smell of drains / discharging sewage in the same area. We had to place towels over the drain in our bathroom close the sink and bath plugs and place a towel at the bottom of our room door to keep the smells out, this needs to be addressed as it is a serious health hazard. I don’t think it fair that when dining in the Cabana restaurant that only 15% is deducted from the bill.  If this restaurant introduced a 50% reduction for this on all inclusive basis it would be full every night as the food was so much better than the nightly buffet. We passed by the Japanese restaurant a few times at night and there was hardly anyone in there. Surely it’s time to change this restaurant to perhaps a fusion Thai / Chinese restaurant in order to make it a viable success.
Sadly, a serious problem exists with vendors on the public side of the hotel fence. I refer not to the ladies selling sarongs and wraps etc, but the males who hang around and sell DRUGS to those who want them !!!!!  I had to tell a German guest that I had seen what he was doing and as he was smoking nearby, I told him to move and not smoke anywhere near me. The men selling drugs had plenty of customers as well, in my view, security should move them on or better still, call the police.  Based on the above, if I returned to the area I would choose to stay elsewhere
title: Nowhere near 5 star, but could be if problems address.

roomTip: Um eine Liege am Pool zu haben, sollte man dem Poolboy gleich zu Beginn Trinkgeld geben. Er sichert einem dann immer die Liege.
text:
Sehr netter Empfang beim Check-In. Auch während unseres gesamten Aufenthaltes waren sämtliche Mitarbeiter des Hotels sehr zuvorkommend, stets freundlich und immer hilfsbereit.
Wir hatten Zimmer 304, welches wir empfehlen können. Dies hat einen Balkon mit Blick aufs Meer. 
Die Hotelanlage ist sehr schön, an manchen Stellen könnte man jedoch etwas renovieren.
Besonders der sehr große Pool ist zu erwähnen. Leider ist kein Strand mehr vorhanden. Wir würden trotzdem das Hotel weiterempfehlen.
Wir hatten nur Frühstück gebucht, dieses war für uns völlig ausreichend. Es gibt einige Lokale in der näheren Umgebung wo man gut essen kann.
Unsere Ausflüge haben wir bei KRIS Lanka Tours gebucht, keine 50m rechts vom Hotel entfernt. Kris können wir nur wärmstens empfehlen. Kris spricht Deutsch und er richtet seine Touren nach den Wünschen seiner Gäste aus. Auch sorgt er immer für einen deutschsprachigen Begleiter, der Interessantes zu erzählen hat bei Besichtigungen von Tempeln, Botanischer Garten usw. 
Bucht man Touren, ist man immer alleine mit Kris und einem Fahrer. Das ist sehr angenehm, da man im Auto unterwegs ist und nicht im Reisebus.
Für uns steht fest, kommen wir wieder nach Sri Lanka werden wir unsere Touren nur bei Kris buchen.
title: Gelungener Urlaub in Sri Lanka

Manager, Front Office
placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Dinner service was quite late for kids starting at 7:30pm so might pay to have a big lunch or afternoon snack to keep the kids going.
text: This hotel was very new and beautifully presented. The staff were all super friendly and helpful especially Senuka and Theekshana looking after my 2 boys 9 and 11 to make sure they had what they needed. The pastry chef Priyantha was incredible offering to provide special food that the kids liked and packed us lunch when we went out for the day. The egg hoppers were a highlight as well as the stunning pool on the roof top. Highly recommend for families, supermarket Keels is very nice and just down the road with an atm outside and a small supermarket with pharmacy right next door to the hotel. Just one thing that might be helpful to know is to pack a flannel or two as it seems flannels aren’t a common item here but I imagine if you ask they will find one. It’s only a 5 to 10 minute tuk tuk ride to the markets in Kandy and The Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic. The rooms were beautifully presented and the pillows super big and fluffy. Complimentary water in each room.
title: Fantastic Hotel and Best Service!!!!

roomTip: Avoid the tent rooms
text:
Very nice hotel, with very nice friendly and kind staff. Nice food too. Only stayed for one night when staying nearby Yala National Park. We arrived and was given such a nice welcome. We were on a FB basis - the lunch was just simply amazing - such a big array of lovely local dishes! 

We originally had an issue with our room, as they put us in a tent even though we booked a normal room - apparently they told our tour company but they didn’t pass the message on and hotel was full! Eventually in the evening they gave us a room or else this review would be the opposite! As the tent was not nice at all! The room was excellent, great view and nice bathroom. 

Would recommend and stay again if on a short break however would not stay in the tent so avoid!
title: Great hotel

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Second review of a different room variety. After not liking the older version of rooms at the hotel, I was very excited to know that a newer line of rooms had opened in Dec of last year.

My first use of the room was in early March and I absolutely loved it, so much so, that I requested for the same during my next visit in March. Maleesha from the resv team so kindly moved all things possible to ensure I got a really good room and I wouldn't have gotten her help without Mihirini who deserves a separate paragraph for her service.

Everytime I saw Mihirini, she was on her feet doing her job. I'd go early for breakfast at 7ish and there she would be, engaging with guests and I would return back to the hotel well past 6pm and there she was still working away. I don't know how she does it but I do hope the hotel is valuing her as much as I'm sure the guests do. I for sure did.
The staff truly makes the stay so memorable. 

Minor things that were quickly fixed: Aircon system seemed iffy - however when we called maintenance, there was nothing wrong with it; The iron in the room wasn't working, which they replaced with a new one. Menu needs to be changed - the pastas weren't available during my visit early in March and then my second time in March as well. It should be off the list if it's not available, but that's just my opinion. I must say, I didn't raise this issue with the staff despite them asking me if there was anything wrong, because I didn't think it was big enough to complain on.

Shoutout to Malindu at the restaurant for constantly being on the watch for guests needs including my own. I never went wanting anything because of their attention to detail.

If you're in town for business, request for a room from the Exec category. Its well maintained, clean. Service all round is amazing.
title: Amazing stuff, lovely new rooms

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We really appreciate the time you have taken to write a glowing five star review about your experience at The Golden Crown Hotel. We are thrilled to know that it has been an amazing experience on all aspects and that you found the Hotel felt wonderful during your visit. It is always a pleasure to know that our guests are satisfied with our services and facilities.

Thank you so much for your appreciation towards our staff members, amenities and food. Once again thank you so much for brilliant words left for us to read about your recent visit and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back again soon!

The Golden Crown Team.
placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife, our 4-year-old daughter, Sophia, and I spent two magical nights at this hotel.
From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed warmly and unexpectedly. The lobby was spacious and relatively quiet. Both the reception staff and security personnel were elegantly dressed, always smiling, and extremely polite.
Our room, 4009, was large, modern, and had a breathtaking view of the forest. It featured a beautifully designed king-size bed with a canopy and a very spacious terrace. The air conditioning was excellent and completely silent. The rooms were exceptionally well soundproofed.
The infinity pool, overlooking the forest, was incredibly relaxing—truly beyond words.
The restaurant was not crowded during breakfast and dinner, and the staff frequently checked to ensure we had everything we needed. The food selection catered to all tastes, and the appetizers and desserts were just as impressive. Live soft music during dinner created a delightful atmosphere.
The pricing for additional hotel services was very reasonable compared to other five-star hotels, with costs similar to those found in the city. Transfers between the hotel and downtown Kandy were simple and affordable.
I have never stayed in a hotel that was so family- and child-friendly. A special thanks to Chathurika, Methmi, Sivaraj and the rest of the staff whose names I, unfortunately, don’t remember.
One significant advantage was that, despite being well-known, this hotel was not one of those that constantly hosted large charter tour groups, ensuring a more peaceful experience.
As for minor drawbacks, the in-room safe wasn’t perfectly installed, there was no bathtub, and we noticed a few tiny insects in the room, though they weren’t bothersome—understandable given the hotel’s location. The hallways were slightly narrow, and navigating between different sections of the hotel was a bit complex, but these were insignificant compared to the hotel's overall exceptional atmosphere.
I truly hope they maintain this level of excellence, and we can’t wait to return—this time for our entire holiday!
title: Unbelievable

text:
The facilities, reception, staff, housekeeping, and breakfast buffet are all superb.  

This is truly a 5-star hotel.  Such an outstanding staff and excellent food in the restaurant.  Our experience in the restaurant was made memorable by Mr. Nilankan the buffet manager, Mr. Lakshita and Mihirini who each went out of their way to help us out with the smallest need and request.  It was a very pleasant experience and made especially so by the staff - each and every one was extremely polite and solicitous.  I think the Golden Crown trains their staff very well - otherwise you would not see the consistency in service.

I must mention housekeeping as well - Erang from housekeeping went out of his way to promptly and graciously respond to our every need.  

What can we say - we would go back again and again to the Golden Crown, and recommend it to all friends and family.
title: An outstanding hotel

text:
We stayed here for three nights as a base for exploring Kandy. The hotel is very luxurious, with a large marbled lobby, high ceilings and a general air of opulence. It is on a busy road, but our room was still quiet. It is quite rural behind the hotel. The room was lovely, with all the facilities you'd expect of a hotel of this type. There are lovely finishing touches in the hotel, such as traditional wall hangings in corridors. 
The outstanding feature of this hotel is its buffet, which was the biggest we've ever seen. Not only was there a huge range of cuisines available, but the quality of food was outstanding. Our regular server for breakfast and dinner was Ajith, who was the best and most attentive server you could wish for. 
The hotel is located a couple of miles outside the city of Kandy, it's a tuc-tuc ride into town.
title: Opulent hotel with amazing buffet!

text:
Where do I begin! The Backwaters was such a fantastic place to stay. The staff were all so friendly and welcoming and Tarique and Lakshi in particular made us feel at home immediately. The room was clean with comfortable beds, en suite bathroom, kettle and a balcony set in the middle of the jungle.  

From the restaurant you could see straight down to the river where we swam and went on a lovely sunset cruise. Everything about our stay was amazing but the best thing of all was the food - WOW! There was so much and it was the best local food we’ve had in Sri Lanka so far - breakfast, lunch and dinner were all amazing and different. The team went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and had the best stay, which we really appreciated.

We visited The Backwaters 
at the beginning of our Sri Lankan venture and are still yet to find anywhere to match it. Thank you again to everyone for such a memorable stay 🙏🏼
title: Beautiful setting, incredible food and amazing staff!

text:
We hebben hier 2 nachten geslapen in een lodge (zeecontainer op palen). Heel leuk klein complex met 6 kamers. 
Ontzettend aardige eigenaar en medewerkers die ons continu in de watten hebben gelegd. 
Ze vertelden welke geluiden we hoorden of wat we het beste konden doen. 
Van hieruit een middagprogramma naar het wildpark Wilpattu gemaakt. 
Heerlijk avondeten met een hoop variatie. Het ontbijt was ook zeer uitgebreid. 
De kamer was eigenlijk iets te klein voor 3 personen en onze bagage maar het ging op zich prima. 
Omdat er heel veel regen was gevallen (en nog steeds viel) was het water in het meer heel hoog.
title: Back to nature

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. we are so happy that you enjoyed your stay at Backwaters Lodge. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

text: Backwaters exceeded all my expectations! I was here for 3 nights with my family. The setting is picture perfect with clean and comfortable rooms, exceptional fusion cuisine, amazing service and the most fun and exciting activities including jungle safari, sunset boat ride, night loris tour, kayaking and wild swimming. Thought and care for the surrounding environment and community was evident throughout our stay. Beautiful place, can see myself coming back over and over again!
title: Slice of heaven on earth!

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. we are so happy that you enjoyed your stay at Backwaters Lodge. We look forward to seeing you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Only 7 safari jeeps available in this entrance to Wilpattu, need to book early to avoid disappointment
text:
Backwaters was such a refreshing getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. The surroundings are extremely quiet, and you can hear only the birds chirping or the wind. We booked Backwaters for two nights and they provided a unique stay focusing on sustainability and preservation of their surrounding environment. The hotel grounds is the thick forest and there are plenty of wildlife sightings while walking around. There is a stream along the hotel in which you can go for a sunset boat ride to enjoy the surroundings as well as encounter elephants. There are plenty of hideouts to read and relax and the hotel has made a great effort to ensure the visitors have sufficient space to do that.
The convertainer cabins were clean and spacious enough for two. The food was an interesting mix of Sri Lankan and South Indian cuisine and enjoyable. The kitchen staff puts in a great deal of effort to make it so esthetic.  
Thank you Mr. Keith, Daas and the rest of the staff that made our stay very comfortable and relaxing.
title: Quiet getaway in the forest

ownerResponse/text: Thank you Mihiri for your review. we are happy that you enjoyed your stay this time too. We look forward to seeing you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be prepared to climb up to your cabin. And do not feed the wild animals.
text: My 5th visit to this place and it just keeps getting better. The food is amazing in taste, presentation and variety. The activities are fun and adventurous. The accommodation is divine. The manager is always on point!
title: An unapologetic repeat guest!

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. we are so happy that you enjoyed your stay at Backwaters Lodge. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

text: Oh my goodness!!  What an amazing place. While the accommodation and facilities werw perfect, it was the owner Tarique and his staff, especially Keith, Sunil and Daas that made our stay.  Nothing was too much trouble.  We organised lunch on arrival at 1pm so we could eat before our safari.  Then we had dinner and breakfast. The food was exceptional!!!  So much variety. Hats off to the local village women who whip up the feasts. Thank you for everything.
title: Paradise found

text:
Je slaapt in een huisje op palen niet groot maar prima met ac en ventilator douche met warm water
De hoofdober annex opzichter annex gastheer is heel vriendelijk en vertelt alles over de omgeving 
De tuin zelf heeft veel vogels maar de plek aan de rivier is uniek voor vogelaars, de common kingfisher vist en is goed te zien, ook het uitje met de boot zonder motor met met man kracht is s morgens voor de vogels en s avonds voor de zonsondergang aan te bevelen
Ook een goede uitvalsbasis voor bezoek aan wilpattu
Het eten is goed verzorgd, origineel singalees eten uit lokaal dorp en hier bereid , echt hele lekkere currys, soep en toetjes
Wifi alleen in de bar bij een biertje
title: Locatie, locatie,locatie

text: stunning location in the jungle with a lovely lake. apparently u can swim in tbt lake though i didn’t try it. very warm welcoming staff and simple but excellent food. the rooms were originally shipping containers - basic but comfortable. bathrooms and bedrooms comfortable and air conditioning. lovely jungle feel to the whole place
title: unusual and beautiful location

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your detailed review. we are happy that you enjoyed your stay at Backwaters.  We don't have fridges in the room is we do not want guests to have food in the room since the rooms are surrounded by forests and wild animals. but however, we are happy to keep them in our kitchen fridge. thank you and We look forward to seeing you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There is no fridge in the room.  They have limited alcohol so maybe pick some up on the way if you want it (there were plenty of beers )
text:
What an amazing surprise this place was.  The staff were great with attention to detail and ensuring your stay was the best it could be.

The accommodation itself was great, but it was the location that was what made it memorable. 

Our daughter loved the paths, the swings and the wildlife.

What was really a pleasant surprise was the food.  A lot of thought went into breakfast and dinner, and the outdoor dining location was so relaxing.

With the small number of rooms here, you could always find a location to yourself.

We also loved that the staff arranged our safari, including a picnic breakfast and lunch.  They could not have made it any easier.

You won't be disappointed. 

One tip (not a criticism) there is no fridge in the room so don't bring food or drinks that need refrigeration.  This place is very "eco" and the lack of fridge is part of this approach.
title: An unexpected surprise

ownerResponse/text: Thank you Chehan for your review. we are so happy that you'll enjoyed the stay at Backwaters Lodge. We look forward to seeing you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir hatten zwei fantastische Tage und ein unvergessliches Erlebnis im „Dschungel“. Tolles Personal und man fühlte sich einfach wohl und wie  Zuhause.
Auf Nachhaltigkeit hat man sehr großen Wert gelegt.  Viele Aktivitäten wurden angeboten und das Essen war einfach großartig. 
Alles war sehr sauber und gepflegt. Wenn man eine Abkühlung wollte, konnte man im Fluss schwimmen.  Der Wilpattu Nationalpark war in wenigen Minuten zu erreichen. Wir wären gerne länger geblieben, aber mussten unsere Rundreise fortsetzen. Wir kommen definitiv wieder.
title: Einzigartiges Erlebnis
