ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Greetings from Seerock "The King's Domain" Sigiriya!

Thank you very much for the valuable review.  The Management and the Staff are highly appreciative for your comments we assured to maintain the highest degree of personalized service at all times. 
 

Best regards,
Management
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is set in the most peaceful, calm, beautiful setting. Its not near any noisy roads/traffic- you just hear the sounds of birds and frogs.
The room is clean, comfortable, generously sized with a balcony at the front and back. Although it is very humid and there is lots of water so I was worried about mosquitos.  There are lots of birds, lizards, monkeys around so its great to just sit and watch everything.
The bed, which had a mosquito net, was really comfortable and we slept so well. The only criticism would be that the lighting wasnt very strong and the light switches were wired in the most illogical way!
The hotel is pretty remote, we ate all our meals there- you would have needed a taxi/tuk tuk to take you to outside restaurants which the hotel would happily have arranged. The food was fine, we would have liked a bit more Sri Lankan food. We only found out that they had a Sri Lankan breakfast menu on the last day!
There is a quiet bar which only seemed to serve local lager and rather expensive (not very nice) wine. They had spirits on the menu but when I asked for a GnT they said they didn't have it.
They arranged transfers to Sigiriya rock, an elephant safari, Polannarua and also onto Kandy. They were very helpful and booked everything for us without any problems. All the staff were so friendly, polite and helpful.
On check-out we were given a questionnaire to fill out (in front of them) and asked if we had any suggestions/feedback. If they want honest feedback- give guests the questionnaire the day before check out to give you a chance to fill it out with more consideration- not when you are in a hurry and your taxi driver is waiting for you.
title: Beautiful, peaceful, remote, friendly staff

Staying here made my family and I feel like we were right in the national parks and one with the nature. Our room was spacious and comfortable. There was a jacuzzi too but we didn't get the chance to use it. They also have an in-house spa which was perfect to wind down by getting a massage after a safari and climbing Sigriya.
A special shoutout to Mr. Nimesh and Mr. Dimutha who made our stay pleasurable and were always there to answer any questions we had. Thank you to the kitchen staff as well that catered to our dietary needs (vegetarian).
Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to immerse themselves in the surrounding while looking for a comfortable stay.
title: One with Nature

roomTip: Give yourself plenty of time to see all the wonderful things and to also enjoy the hotel facilities.
text: What a wonderful hotel! We are a family of 5 visiting Sri Lanka for the first time. We've just had the pleasure of staying 3 nights at this hotel. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly (including Melinda, Krishan, Aditya, Dilini and Ravindi). The rooms are beautiful, the pool is immaculate and the food is excellent.  Dimntha planned a fantastic itinerary of a visit to the national park to see elephants, a trip to the cave temples, a walk up Sygrya, a night time trip to see Loris and a trip to an ancient town. We ended the stay this morning at the hotel spa with the best massages we've ever had. The hotel and all the staff were faultless and we can't recommend this place highly enough.
title: Our best hotel stay ever.

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Good 4-star standard rooms, decent food, responsive reception service, property showing wear, pool area needs refurbishment, repetitive
text:
We had a decent stay at this hotel with our family, though it's clear the property could use some updating. The accommodation met a solid 4-star standard with all the basic amenities you'd expect.
One minor inconvenience was that dental kits weren't provided in the room, but there was a helpful note instructing guests to call reception for any additional amenities needed - which we appreciated.
The pool area was definitely the highlight and most popular spot among guests, though it's quite obvious it needs some refurbishment to bring it up to current standards.
Food quality was generally good throughout our stay. However, we noticed that the buffet menu seemed identical to other Amaya hotels we've experienced, which felt a bit repetitive if you're familiar with the chain.
Overall, it's a reasonable choice for families looking for comfortable accommodation, but the property would benefit from some investment in updates and renovations to maintain its appeal.
title: Good Family Stay but Showing Its Age

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Amaya Beach in Pasikuda was nothing short of exceptional. This was a pre-booked hotel, and it absolutely lived up to our expectations — and more. The beachfront location is stunning, offering breathtaking views and a refreshing sea breeze that was a true gift in the midst of the hot weather.

The hotel is beautifully maintained, with a calm, relaxing atmosphere. From check-in to departure, every member of the staff was warm and welcoming, making us feel truly cared for. Special thanks to Sujiva and Benedict, the managers, who went out of their way to ensure our stay was seamless and memorable.

Whether it's the scenic views, the professional service, or the tranquil vibe, Amaya Beach delivers a perfect coastal retreat. We would gladly return!
title: Unforgettable Beachside Stay at Amaya Beach, Pasikuda

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The current management have taken the experience of hosting guests at this historic location to a different level to cater for changing consumer demands!
It’s modern in amenities but keeps its old world charm from its days as the Tissa Test House. 
The service is courteous professional and friendly. The rice and curry is authentic and made from locally sourced ingredients. 
A great place to stay and use as a base for Kataragama Yala Bundala or other local places to visit and experience. 
I guess I am biased because I’ve been coming here since 1961 and the crane caramel desert. Or caramel pudding as they call it in Sri Lanka is right up there with the best!
title: A great place to stay or stop for a meal

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take care to be wearing thick socks and closed keds if walking in the forest after a downpour. Leeches crawl out on the forest floor!
text: Time stands still in the loveliest way at Palmstone, the peaceful retreat resort in the deep heart of a gorgeous rainforest in Kitulgala. We have just enjoyed the most memorable time here, with idyllic forest walks, great bird watching and some invigorating river rafting with experienced guides. The housekeeping and dining staff offer excellent service, ably led by the manager here. The menu has lovely local Sri Lankan food along with Continental and Indian meal options. Thank you Kenneth, Suren, Mohamed and Sameer for an unforgettable couple of days at your beautiful property.
title: Forest haven supreme

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: They don’t serve wine or spirits but do sell beer. If you like wine with your meal, it’s worth taking your own.
text:
This was just incredible. It is deep in the jungle and you are surrounded by the sounds of the jungle animals and the incredible waterfall right next to the hotel. We swam on the natural pool. The rooms are amongst the best I have ever stayed in. Large, luxurious with a huge shower and a hot tub on a private terrace. 

The food was great and so was a he service. We stayed 3 nights and the hotel made arrangements for us to do whitewater rafting, canyoning and abseiling down a waterfall. We loved these activities and the stay here made our holiday extra special - a total highlight of the trip snd I can’t recommend this enough!
title: Luxury in paradise

roomTip: Bit bumpy road Request Shuttle service if bwanted. Wifi is little weak but no need when we are vacation
text:
We had an incredible two-night stay at the beautiful Palmstone Retreat with my family. We stayed in the Araliya room, which featured a luxurious and clean interior, a plunge pool, and a stunning river view with direct access to the river. Thankfully, the weather was perfect, and we enjoyed swimming in the river and trying out fun activities like sliding, all expertly guided by Sameera, one of the hotel staff.

Sameera also took us on a short 20-minute journey to a nearby waterfall, which was absolutely breathtaking. We spent about one to two hours there, swimming in the natural pool and even jumping from the top—it was such a thrilling experience!

The food at Palmstone Retreat was amazing. The kitchen staff were incredibly attentive to my specific requirements and prepared everything just as I requested. Mohammed in the restaurant was especially helpful with food and services, ensuring we had the best experience.

All the staff were friendly and accommodating, making our stay truly special. This was undoubtedly one of the best experiences we had in Sri Lanka, and I highly recommend Palmstone Retreat to anyone looking for a serene and luxurious getaway.
title: A Hidden Jem

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
- The last 6km is a rough roud. Not every taxi of tourist bus can go there.
- book at least 2 nigh
text:
An Unforgettable Jungle Retreat

We had the pleasure of staying at this incredible hotel nestled deep in the jungle, just 6km away from the nearest town, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. The rooms were exceptionally spacious, offering breathtaking views directly into the heart of the jungle. Waking up to the sounds of nature was a unique and serene experience.

The hotel offers luxurious amenities, including rooms equipped with a jacuzzi, and some even boast an outdoor jacuzzi on the terrace—perfect for unwinding after a day of exploration. The food was delicious, with a variety of options that catered to all tastes, and the staff were exceptionally friendly, always ready to assist with a smile.

A special mention must go to the hotel’s tour guide, Sameera. He guided us to the natural pools just behind the hotel and took us on an early morning walk to the stunning waterfalls, just a 30-minute hike away. Sameera's knowledge of the area and his passion for the jungle made the tours a highlight of our stay.

Our tip for future travelers: book at least two nights to fully immerse yourself in the tranquility and beauty of this jungle retreat. You won't regret it!
title: Book at least 2 nights!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: Een hotel echt in het midden van de jungle met 3 lodges van elk 2 mega kamers. Het verwarmde privé zwembad aan de kamer is een oase van rust met het watervalgeluid en zicht op de fauna en flora.  Super lekker diner en fantastisch ontbijt. Aan het hotel ligt een rivier met natuurlijke glijbaan. Sameera van het hotel helpt je graag om dit te laten ontdekken! Dank u Sameera voor de onvergetelijke ervaring! Super vriendelijk personeel! Aanrader om te gaan.
title: Fantastisch hotel in the jungle

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: It’s quite a journey to get at this secluded place in the middle of the rain forest but once you’re there you do not need anything else. Our chalet with two separate rooms and bathrooms had a jacuzzi on the balcony and a steam room inside in one room and a jacuzzi in the bath room in the other room. The interior is minimalistic but very much to our taste. There is a waterfall in the back garden which is beautiful. Staff is very friendly and in particular we found Indunil’s service to be excellent. He was attentive, went the extra mile, and made our stay very enjoyable. Also the food was very good. It is a good mix of Asian and more Western food. Please mind that if you want to go rafting for which this area is well known it takes approx 25 minutes by car to get there. Rafting is good!
title: Very remote but beautiful place within the rain forest

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed with our family, three children in one cabin (2 rooms which were connected into one villa/cabin) . The location hidden in the rainforest with monkeys and wild life surrounding you. The staff super friendly and helpfull. The kitchen presenting the most remarkable dishes (Sri Lankan and Western dishes). The hotelrooms very well maintained with private spa’s facilities in the bathroom, and a private heated outside pool. And then the surrounding with a mountain river just in front with a natural pool and natural slides to play the whole day or enjoy the sun. 
As we said a truly remarkable place. We would really recommend this place to anyone.
title: A truly remarkable place, Hidden beauty in the rainforest

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
This place was the highlight of our trip to Sri Lanka. We loved its serene and peaceful vibe, nestled in the middle of a jungle. It was just what we needed after ten days of active tourism.

The rooms were exceptional, featuring a sauna bath and a heated pool—an experience we had never had before.

The best part, though, was the staff, especially Indunil. He was incredibly kind, taking us to a waterfall and even providing life jackets for us. His sweetness and kindness made our Sri Lanka trip even more memorable. Thank you for making our visit to Sri Lanka so beautiful.
title: Beautiful stay with lovely staff!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Nvt gewoon gaan
text:
Geweldige ervaring!!! Zowel de omgeving als de kamers als het personeel als het eten!!! Omgeving is het oerwoud waar je continu oerwoud geluiden hoort… de kamers waren de mooiste kamers die ik ooit heb gezien… personeel zeer vriendelijk (leerde me o.a. hoe ik de string hopper met mijn handen kon eten) en het eten en ontbijt was verrukkelijk… 
Had niets beters kunnen bedenken, behalve dat we langer hadden moeten blijven 😜
title: Ga hier zeker heen! Mooie ervaring!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay for more than one night
text: Very nice hotel with large rooms on a beautiful location. Friendly service from the hotel personnel and delicious food. Our rooms had a beautiful view on the river. Sounds of the jungle let you sleep nice and deeply. The personnel also helped us to relieve our son from abdominal pain.
title: Very nice hotel on a beautiful and unique location

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Houd rekening met een wat langere reistijd want de laatste 6 kilometers zijn redelijk slecht te rijden.
text: Geweldig! Met slechts 6 kamers ver van de bewoonde wereld is dit de plek voor RUST. Super vriendelijke mensen, goed eten, in een omgeving zoals nog nooit ervaren. Met een eigen natuurlijke glijbaan/waterval en met een 15 minuten lopen een grotere waterval waar je ook heerlijk kunt zwemmen.
title: Uniek

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
I really recommend Palmstone Retreat. Exceptional location, worth at least a two night stay! We arrived in the afternoon for just one night and thus didn’t have much time to unwind and enjoy the magnificent environment. 

However, we were taken care of perfectly! Indunil took the time to take our 12 year old son to the river to have some private canyoning fun: jumping of rocks into the river, sliding from a natural slide! He really made our sons (and ours) day! Thanks again Indunil!

In the evening we were treated to a superb dinner, again in a perfect setting surrounded by the jungle and its relaxing sounds. 

The rooms are very spacious, perfectly clean and facing the river. Being a family, we had interconnecting rooms which was great. 

Breakfast again was fantastic, absolutely a joy to start the day. Big complements to the chef and his team!

Being in the middle of the jungle, expect the WiFi to be slow (you might want to warn your kids ;) ) And as I mentioned before, if possible I would really recommend at least a two night stay. This way you can even better indulge yourself in this magnificent environment!
title: Out of this world

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The country road up to the resort is narrow with variable surface - avail of the hotel vehicle from main road as Tuk Tuk cost is high given
text:
This was the nicest place we stayed I. Sri Lanka. A true retreat in the jungle. The sound of wildlife was amazing all around us. Stunning location and lovely facility. 
Rooms are very spacious and clean with lovely shower! 

We enjoyed all our meals. Excellent service from Indunil and team with delicious food from the chef. 

The pool is clean and peaceful. Perfect for couples and families
title: Amazing experience in jungle retreat

Prima vertoeven hier, we hebben er van genoten!

Dear Sir / Madam.

Greetings from Habarana Village by Cinnamon! Thank you for staying with us at Habarana Village by Cinnamon and providing us with helpful comments on your recent experience. 
We greatly appreciate your assessment of our services. We look forward to welcoming you back at Habarana Village by Cinnamon! Warm Regards, Shyanaka Munasinghe - Assistant Manager. Front Office.
placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I — had an absolutely wonderful experience at Habarana Village by Cinnamon. We stayed on a Half Board package in a garden view room, and every aspect of our stay exceeded expectations.

From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed with cold towels and a refreshing drink. The check-in was smooth, and the staff made us feel relaxed and cared for right away.

The location is breathtaking, set along the lake with beautiful views and a calm, nature-filled atmosphere. Our room was clean, cozy, and surrounded by greenery — ideal for a peaceful escape.

The dining experience was a major highlight. Every single dish was amazing — fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Dinner included a fantastic live pasta counter and an excellent cold section, while breakfast featured a rich local Sri Lankan section, wide international variety, and a bakery corner with fresh selections. A big thank you to Head Chef Perera for such an impressive and thoughtful spread.

What made the dining experience even more special was the service from Saranga. We were fortunate to have him serve us at both dinner and breakfast. He was exceptionally attentive, kind, and genuinely passionate about guest satisfaction. His warm personality and professional approach truly stood out — he made us feel welcome, remembered small details, and took care of us with such sincerity. we were honestly impressed by his service — he is a true gem in the team.

We also visited the bar, which had a lovely, relaxing vibe. Nadishan served us and was equally warm and friendly, engaging us in pleasant conversation while ensuring we had a great time.

The pool area was another highlight — calm, clean, and surrounded by nature, perfect for cooling off and unwinding.

Every staff member we met was smiling, courteous, and genuinely committed to making our stay enjoyable. As hospitality professionals, we truly appreciated the consistent warmth, service excellence, and attention to detail.

This was one of the most relaxing and heartwarming getaways we’ve experienced. Highly recommended for anyone looking for peace, great food, and sincere Sri Lankan hospitality. We can’t wait to return!
title: A Truly Memorable Stay at Habarana Village by Cinnamon

text:
This was my second stay at Habarana Village by Cinnamon, and once again, it didn’t disappoint. The rooms were clean, well-maintained, and offered a calm, village-like atmosphere.

All meals were buffet style with a great variety, including seafood, chicken, pork, beef, and even mutton for lunch. While salads and desserts could use more variety, the food overall was delicious, and the restaurant staff were very helpful.

The real highlight is the stunning garden and lake view—perfect for morning and evening walks or cycling under the trees. The pool is uniquely shaped and adds to the relaxing vibe. Watching the sunset by the lake was truly memorable.

Highly recommended for a peaceful, nature-filled getaway with excellent service and great value for money.

text: We had the best time at Habarana Village. It provides a nice balance between nature and modern comforts! The rooms were very comfortable. The facilities were great including the pool. We did go in the hottest period so the water in the pool was very warm! We found the best time to have a dip was in the morning or late afternoon/evening. The restaurant was the highlight of our stay. The food was delicious!! We went on a busy weekend so it was fully booked!! The food was so popular that it did run out but the staff kept bringing out more and more! We have to thank the restaurant especially as we had a little one who is 9 months. The restaurant made meals for the baby upon request (mashed veg, yogurt, mashed potato, fruits, oats) and were very accommodating! They always enquired and ensured the baby had enough food! High chairs are available but are in high demand at peak times. All staff are very pleasant and welcoming! They were always willing to talk and were always willing to help! Thank you so so much for making our holiday special!
title: 5 start family comforts!

text: We chose to stay at Seerock for 2 nights when we went to Sigiriya. Sigiriya and Thoppigala is about a 20-minute drive from here. The staff members are super friendly and polite. The food was delicious (we had all three meals). Rooms are really spacious, clean, and tidy. We booked 2 rooms (Gajaba and Harindra) for 4 of us. One room comes with a jacuzzi, and the other one had a plunge pool. In the morning, you can hear peacocks 🦚 calling. The restaurant and the bar are on the upper floor. You can see the upper part of the Sigiriya and Thoppigala rocks from the restaurant. The pool was clean and spacious. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves to stay close to nature.
title: Great service. Friendly staff.

My wife and I decided to visit the Seerock hotel, initially we were hesitant about our choice and after going through so many reviews and videos of this place, we thought of giving it a shot.

My oh my, It was the best 4 days. Where should i start from, We loved the Hotel's architecture and the Superior King Deluxe room we stayed was beautiful with an added Jacuzzi bath . The Seerock Team was very kind to us and they pampered us throughout our trip. We got a pretty good deal with Feelo which came with Fullboard and a free Safari ride. The food was delicious , Kudos to the Chef and the Team. As a whole, It was one of the best trip we had and will recommend it to our family, friends and colleagues!

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Where do i start. It was a one of the relaxed weekends i had in a while.  I am so greatful to have stayed in Seerock which was a amazing little hotel with outstanding service to be offered. Away from city in the midst of total quietness is what anyone would ask for. 

Whoever read this review please feel free to check it out . I can 100% vouch for it.  

- Location - Easy to get by via Habarana. Once you are at Habarana you can reach the hotel via Tuk Tuk. Make sure to use Pick Me (Similar as Uber). Or you could even arrange a pick through the hotel who are happy to do the needful. 

Hotel is close to Sigiriya and Pidurangala as well which is a plus

Hotel was kind enough to arrange a Safari at Hurulu Park where we were lucky to see some Elephants at their own habitat. Tharanga (Safari Driver) was very well aware where to go so we would have the best experience. 

- First impression - We were welcomed by Shehara (Front Desk) witha big smile . Welcome drinks were offered & check in was pretty quick. 

- Room - A well maintained,  clean & luxurious little room with a  Jacuzzi built in . Belive me it was a perfect fit and its  suited for a family as well. 

- Food & Service- Chef Renuka and team are gifted with amazing skillset. Every dish they offered us was out of the world. 

Special shoutout to Daminda and Krishantha who served us through the stay was always happy to make sure we enjoyed each meal. 

Thank you Seerock The Kings Domain for the outstanding hospitality. This is the least I could do for the hospitality you offered. Looking for to see you next year.
title: Habarana's best place to be at (⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐)

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Eravamo un gruppo di amici ed abbiamo soggiornato al Seerock a Marzo, siamo rimasti per ben cinque giorni in questo hotel. L'hotel confina con la giungla ed è formato da un corpo centrale e alcuni bungalows su palafitte. Le camere sono grandi, molto belle, ben arredate e con un condizionatore di qualità. Si trovano in palazzine intorno al corpo centrale, essendo un gruppo numeroso abbiamo occupato gran parte delle camere. Nulla da ridire per le camere, i problemi cominciano con le parti comuni che sembrano un pò lasciate andare e con poca manutenzione. Appena arrivati non si vedeva la piscina per l'erba alta, tagliata il giorno successivo. Nella sala ristorante fanno belle mostra le ventole vecchie ed arrugginite e i mobili che hanno sicuramente visto tempi migliori. Colazione molto scarsa per un hotel di qualità e siamo riusciti ad ottenere un servizio ragionevole ed in tempi normali solo dopo i primi due giorni. Detto questo, il Seerock rimane un ottimo hotel che con qualche piccolo accorgimento potrebbe mirare all'eccellenza.
title: Soggiorno al Seerock

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Hotel liegt etwas abgeschieden (mit weiteren Ressorts) aber der Weg ist es wert! Liegt sehr idyllisch mitten in der Natur. Man hat viel Ruhe
text: Man wird hier von Ankunft bis Abreise behandelt wie ein König! Man fühlt sich stets wohl und die Anlage ist wunderschön! Der Pool ist sauber und etwas hinter dem Hotel, man kann also die Privatsphäre genießen! Das Restaurant ist ausgezeichnet und bei jedem Abendessen kam der Manager und der Koch persönlich an unseren Tisch und hat gefragt, ob alles zu unserer Zufriedenheit ist. Service wird hier noch ganz groß geschrieben! Unser Zimmer mit eigenem Pool war fantastisch. Noch nie so gut geschlafen mit diesem tollen Bett! Sehr große Zimmer, Badezimmer mit großer Dusche und alles in perfekter Sauberkeit. Vom privaten Außenpool mit Massagedüsen konnte man jeden Abend den Sonnenuntergang bewundern. Also für uns eines der besten Hotels in denen wir jemals waren! Hier gibt es absolut nichts zu bemängeln! Spitze! Vielen Dank für den tollen Aufenthalt! Sollten wir nochmal nach Sri Lanka kommen, wissen wir, welches Hotel wir buchen werden! 10/10!!
title: Bestes Hotel in Sri Lanka!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed just the one night after white water rafting in the area. The rooms were amazing with full length windows giving views of the jungle . At the back of the hotel you can go down to the river and water levels permitting swim there. 

The hotel offers meals delivered to your room or alternatively on the terrace outside. We opted to go to the terrace and were the only ones there that evening. 
The staff and food we received that evening was truly amazing. With the chef also coming out to talk to us to ensure we were happy with the food. 
It was our wedding anniversary whilst we were away and after our dinner the staff brought out a cake for us and all the staff came to talk to us.

Thank you for making our stay a memorable one. I would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Beautiful hotel. Beautiful Location

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow! We were greeted by the kindest of staff. Indunil and staff treated us royally. The rooms were clean, comfortable, spacious and the sauna and private tub were very luxurious. It was so hot, the cool plunge was refreshing. The outdoor pool is clean and comfortable. Staff shared with us the 'secret' pool in the back, by the waterfall. Just walk the path into the nature! Chef Lalith had the most beautifully presented food. And the tastes were amazing. Wish we could have had more than one night.
Oh, the road was under repair while we were there and the climb up is bumping and breath taking! Not for the faint of heart. Hold tight..it is worth the terror of the 6 km climb.
title: Didn't stay long enough!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Read the other reviews for road conditions.   Go white water rafting.
text:
We stayed at Palmstone retreat for two nights in April and enjoyed every second of our stay.  The small boutique hotel is located deep in the jungle, surrounded by the sights and sounds of the natural world.  A river runs over rocks at the back of the property with small waterfalls and pools to explore.  

Our room was amazing with picture windows onto the jungle, comfortable bed, plunge pool and sauna.

Whilst the location and facilities each deserve a five star rating it is the kind and attentive staff who added so much to our stay.  

In particular Mohammed Anfas ensure we had everything we needed and arranged for the chef Sivaganam to prepare delicious vegetarian Sri Lankan food that was probably the best ‘fine restaurant’ local food we had. 

The guide Sameera was also very kind and led us on a short hike to see and swim in a nearby waterfall and also took me on an early morning bird watching walk and trip to the nearby Belilena cave.    …. all highly recommended.
title: Luxurious jungle experience

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
New Chef was superb - food was amazing. Service overall was excellent, very  friendly super responsive.. definitely go Abseiling, which is rappelling down an amazing waterfall. Bobby was the guide for the abseiling trip we booked through the hotel. 

Jungle setting was extraordinary and remote. Beautiful stream to boulder and swim in adjacent to resort. Sameera at the resort is a great guide for the jungle
title: Great stay at Palmstone jungle resort in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
What a gem of a place. You’ll find this small and lovely little hotel deep in the rainforest by a beautiful river. The rooms are spacious, modern and tastefully decorated. We had a steam room in our room and a hot tub on the deck. But what makes Palmstone so special is the wonderful staff and the incredible food! The brand new chef goes above and beyond. He is so excited to make food you’ll love. Even our 15 year old son, who’s normally not very adventurous with food, loved the food. The friendly guide, Sameera, took us up to a gorgeous waterfall the first day where we could swim. We did river rafting one day which was nice but the water was low. Some fun rapids but mostly a beautiful run down the river. Our third day we went abseiling which was the highlight of the trip to the Kithulgala area. The trip up the mountain in a jeep on beyond bad roads was an experience in of itself. Driving by  little mountain villages and tea plantations, our guide Bobby took us to the most gorgeous 90 foot waterfall. Repelling down this spectacular waterfall is not to be missed!! 
I highly recommend staying at Palmstone Retreat when traveling to Sri Lanka!!
title: A jewel in the jungle!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Truly remarkable experience.
Beautiful accommodation and service .
Its remote location adds to its charm.
The chef cooks the most delicious food . My son said the chef was a magician.
Friendly and helpful staff . Thank you Unilson , Kenneth and team . An unforgettable experience.
title: Jungle hideaway

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: We had a brilliant time here. The waterfall is beautiful and it is such a secluded peaceful place. Thank you to Indunil who couldn't do enough for us and was so helpful. There is white water rafting nearby which is a lot of fun, definitely would recommend.
title: Perfect Stay

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be sure to check out the waterfalls, about 1 km away, and the cave!
text:
Perfect for relaxation!

We stayed in the Araliya Suite 24.2-27.2.  Which was absolutely spotless and modern. We loved having our own private pool, sauna, and river view, where we even went swimming a few times.

The staff was incredibly friendly, especially Indunil. He arranged an adventure for us to the waterfalls, a short jungle hike, and also acted as a guide to a nearby cave. He also guided us to safely swim at the waterfall behind the hotel. And to top it all off, he arranged a candlelight dinner by the river! Five stars for service! Everything went smoothly in English.
title: Perfect for relaxation!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No nightlife!
text:
A one night stop on an 11 day tour.  Very private RIGHT IN THE JUNGLE, but you need 4wd to access, or to enjoy a 15 minute tuk-tuk run up to the retreat.

Apart from a lovely pool and organised walks locally there isn't much going on, and we were the only guests that night.  How they will survive long term I don't know as only 6 luxury units.  Food okay served in the main building or your room.

A definite decompression spot!
title: Somewhere to decompress!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: Na een hobbelige weg kom je op een prachtige plek. Een werkelijke oase van rust en natuur. De kamer en badkamer was groot en luxe met uitzicht op jungle/rivier. De hotel medewerker Indunil was ook heel leuk met ons zoontje van 4 en nam hem mee zwemmen bij de rivier. Vanuit het hotel kan je een wandeling naar de waterval maken, waar je ook kan zwemmen. In de avond hebben zijn we nog op een kleine zoektocht naar kikkers en andere nachtdieren gegaan. Prachtige plek voor iedereen die op zoek is naar rust en natuur.
title: Oase van rust en natuur

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: One of the most beautiful properties surrounded by the rain forest in Kitulgala. Excellent hospitality starting from the Manager Kenneth, Indunil, and the excellent food prepared by the cooking staff. Will definitely be a place to return to.
title: Most relaxing experience

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: We started our Sri Lanka trip at the Palmstone as my son is an avid birder. It is up in the forest, 30 minutes off the main road via a pickup truck or tuk tuk ride. Once there you are very secluded on the beautiful property. The staff was wonderful, the food was great, the room were like treehouses overlooking the river and the forest. There is a great little hike to the most amazing swimming hole at the top of a waterfall - really beautiful (although some leeches along the way!). We were picked up to go down the hill with a bird guide who took us across the river from Kitulala to a small village next to the Makanawa Forest to look for birds. Saw SO MANY . Lots of birds on site at the Palmstone as well. Didn't go deep into the forest due to damp conditions. Walked across a beautiful suspension bridge and visited the Bridge over the River Kwai site nearby. It was a great way to start our trip, get over jet lag and experience the forest area of Sri Lanka. You can also river raft in this area, as well as canyon and other adventure activities.
title: A great entry point for Sri Lanka, and great bird watching area

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
The Palm Stone Retreat Hotel offers an enchanting blend of luxurious accommodations, impeccable service, and a tranquil ambiance, making it a standout choice for those seeking a refined and rejuvenating getaway.

Mr.Suren, Mr.Indunil,  Mr.Mohommad along with the culinary mastery of Chef Mr.Prabhath, collectively contribute to an exceptional guest experience.
title: Superb

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
The best feature of this hotel is the surrounding environment! It was so relaxing to stay in the jungle with the bird noises and the sound of the nearby waterfall to keep you company. Best place to unwind and loosen all the city hustle. Apart from it, the staff were very supportive and hospitable. The food was delicious! The rooms were well maintained and clean. 
The road into the jungle is only suited for vehicles with high ground clearance. However, they have a shuttle service for the others. They were there on-time to pick us and our vehicle was parked at a secure location. 
All in all, a highly recommendable hotel and a must visit!
title: A place for those who love nature and tranquility

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Excellent place with great hospitality.
Indunil in particular is extremely helpful and ensures guests have a memorable experience.

The inroads are a little tricky to drive if one has a self drive vehicle.

Overall, fabulous stay. Must visit
title: Great stay, fabulous hospitality

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The road to get there is a little bit tricky, as it's a remote area. SUV is recommended.
text:
We had a very unique experience like never before. 
A luxurious house in the middle of the jungle, surrounded by nothing but the sounds of singing birds and and flowing water. It was a real "retreat" and nothing like we had ever visited before. Indunil was extremely kind and even personally brought us to the waterfall allowing us to take some beautiful shots. His English was also really good and he taught us about a lot of the local wildlife. 

Definitely the best hotel in Kitulgala!
title: Luxurious jungle adventure with awesome staff!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Beware of leeches and other insects.
text: This is place you must visit if you need some peace and quite with your loved ones. This place is such an eye-pleaser as there's ample of greenery all around you and the sound of continuous flowing water from the river beside is just a cherry on top! It is about 5-6 kms from the main road and the hotel provides transportation if needed as not all vehicles can make it to the top due to poor road conditions. The hotel is wonderfully maintained and we loved our room (Araliya suite). All-day heated plunge pool, private access to the river and a steam room made our suite all the more interesting! Their food is quite good and the chef is flexible enough to prepare food of you choice (depending on the crowd, of course). We did a hike to the Manna Kathi waterfall from the hotel itself and Sameera, from the hotel, guided us. Therefore, special thanks to him. The overall hike took about 1 hour. The overall service of the hotel is excellent as everyone is very friendly and helpful. We would like to especially thank the chef and Mohommed for the great hospitality through-out.
title: A Real Retreat It Was :)

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: Jaw-dropping! What an amazing hotel in a spectacular location. Indunil and the whole team were so friendly and attentive, even setting up a special breakfast overlooking the waterfall on our last day. Definitely worth the 30 mins drive up the track to reach it in the middle of the forest. We even had wild monkeys looking over the edge of our roof as we sat in the plunge pool
title: Amazing!

We had the pleasure of enjoying the Easter Brunch at Uyana Restaurant at Mahaweli Reach Hotel, and it was an absolutely delightful experience!

The food was fantastic – from a wide variety of dishes to the freshness and flavors, everything was top-notch. The Easter-themed specials were especially impressive and added a lovely festive touch to the meal.

A special shout-out to Nadeesha, our stewardess, who took such great care of us throughout the brunch. Her warm and attentive service truly enhanced our dining experience.

Highly recommend Uyana if you're looking for a quality dining experience in Kandy – whether it’s a special occasion or just a relaxing meal. We’ll definitely be back!
title: Wonderful Easter Brunch Experience at Uyana – Mahaweli Reach

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text: We were lucky to spend three nights at Seerock King’s Domain. It is situated in a peaceful rural area close to all the main sites. The rooms are on stilts over water with fish and water monitors swimming through lily pads.  The rooms are enormous and the bed is bigger than a king. There is a two person jacuzzi with mood lighting and speakers, and the shower has several spray options. Monkeys and peacocks roam the property and the pool area is set amongst nature. The staff are extremely helpful and never say no. Bilshan, Malinda, Mahesh and Lasantha cheerfully took care of all our needs. We enjoyed room service on our back deck, as well as meals in the restaurant. Highly recommend!
title: Fabulous Rooms!

roomTip: all rooms equally good
text:
This Boutique style hotel ( Seerock The Kings Domain) is in the middle of a jungle and the rooms are like chalets. No mosquitoes and good AC a necessity we greatly appreciated. Every room has a jacuzzi and it was refreshing to relax in the Jacuzzi.
The Chef at this hotel ( Sunil Edirisinghe) is 2nd best in Sri Lanka. They serve great meals at your preferred times. One of the favourites at this place is the Kola Kanda ( Sri Lankan Herbal Porridge) made out of Gotu Kala, red rice, coconut curry leaves. 
Hotel premises and the garden is kept clean so you can walk or bike. The staff will take care of your every personal needs promptly.
We were pampered and spoilt during our stay and will definitely visit and highly recommend to others as there will be no regrets.

Paul Family - Canada Jan 2023
title: Merging Nature in our stay

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for two nights, and were sad that we couldn't stay longer. The location is amazing set amongst the jungle with an abundance of wildlife.  A truly majestic and serene location with views of sigiriya. We had an above water villa which was of 5 star standard. The room was clean, comfortable, modern and luxurious, plus the jacuzzi came in handy after a day of exploring sigiriya (15 min away) and other surrounding wonders (Minneriya elephant safari- 30min away). What stood out the most were the staff who were absolutely wonderful and made our stay so memorable. My father was in a wheelchair and the staff accommodated for his every needed including carrying him up the stairs to the restaurant. The food was delicious and the presentation was exceptional. The meals were authentic in taste and we couldn't fault a single dish. The staff went above and beyond to cater to us including packing food for the kids to take on our day trips. The head chef Wasula spoke with us and was happy to cater to our every need (including two fussy eating kids age 5 and 7). Thank you for your hospitality seerock hotel. We will definitely make a visit again all the way from Australia.
title: Magnificent!!

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
I had an unforgettable stay at this hotel! The food was absolutely superb – every dish was rich in flavor and beautifully presented. It truly exceeded my expectations.
What stood out just as much was the genuine customer care. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made sure every part of the stay was smooth and enjoyable.
But the highlight for me was the incredible calmness of the environment. I’ve never experienced anything like it before – the peaceful ambiance, accompanied by the gentle sound of the nearby lake, created the most soothing atmosphere. It’s something words can’t fully explain – you just have to feel it.
Overall, this place offers a perfect blend of comfort, flavor, and tranquility. I’d highly recommend it to anyone needing a peaceful getaway. Definitely planning to return!
title: Unforgettable stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience at our Habarana hotel. We are thrilled to hear that you found our rooms comfortable and that you slept well. Our team strives to provide a welcoming and comfortable stay for all our guests, and your kind words are a testament to their efforts.

We appreciate your feedback regarding the bar service. We are continuously working to improve our service efficiency while maintaining the warm hospitality that Sri Lanka is known for.

We are glad you enjoyed our half-board offering and found the food to be above average, especially after a long day of exploring with your family. We understand that traveling with children can be tiring, and we aim to make dining as convenient and satisfying as possible. We also acknowledge your point about the restaurant being busy during dinner opening hours, particularly with tour groups.

We note your suggestion about exploring the local restaurants and shops in Habarana. Indeed, the area offers a variety of dining and shopping experiences within walking distance. We will certainly keep this in mind as we provide information to future guests.

Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you and your family back to Sri Lanka in the future.

Sincerely,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive Guest Services
placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I suspect fancier options are available locally, but suited us as a place to rest our heads. Was our daughters favourite hotel of the trip.
text: We stayed in Habarana village for 3 nights. Probably the best all round offering for a family hotel that we stayed at whilst in Sri Lanka. The rooms were great, we slept very well. Hotel staff were lovely, bar service is slower than you would normally get in Europe or America, but we found this throughout Sri Lanka. We stayed half board - Food was above average. The hotel is definitely set up to cater for tour groups and there was a few there when we stayed, the restaurant is often packed as dinner opens (I suspect because a lot of people will get up very early to visit major cultural sites & return before lunchtime). In hindsight we probably should've explored the restaurants and shops more around Habarana -certainly there's lots around there & within walking distance. But more often than not we were thankful of being halfboard with a tired hangry child each evening. Food menu is a bit repetitive, but as it was the start of our tour we were very happy with rice & curry daily.
title: Great place to stay as a base for the cultural triangle

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share such detailed feedback about your stay. We are delighted to hear that you found our buffet meals remarkable and that you appreciated the welcoming and hardworking nature of our restaurant staff. Your kind words about the general friendliness of Sri Lankans are also greatly appreciated.

I sincerely apologize for the disappointing experience you had with the Front of House middle manager upon your arrival. It is certainly not the impression we want to create, and I am concerned to hear that his disinterest and communication fell short of expectations. Please be assured that your comments regarding this will be taken very seriously and addressed internally. We highly value creating a positive first impression for all our guests.

We also appreciate your feedback on the rooms. We acknowledge that they may appear a bit tired and gloomy, and this is something we are continually reviewing as part of our ongoing efforts to enhance our guest experience.

It is heartening to know that the latter part of your stay was much better and that you found our location great for exploring the local sights. We are glad you considered your stay to be good value overall.

Thank you again for your valuable feedback. We hope that despite the initial hiccup, you left with positive memories of your time here, and we would welcome the opportunity to provide you with an even better experience on any future visits.

Sincerely,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive-Guest Services
placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Watch out for your youngsters in the pool, its very deep. Make use sunbeds in the morning while its not too hot.
text: In terms of the food, we'd echo the previous reviews, the buffet meals were remarkable in the sheer extent of tastes catered for and at a high standard. Likewise the restaurant staff couldn't be more welcoming and hard working, like every other Sri Lankan we met, except one.... The 'Front of House' middle manager who 'welcomed us' was disinterested and clearly felt the task was below him as he rattled off the standard stuff about meals etc, none of which we understood. It seems pointless to us that you employ so many hardworking youngsters to run the bar and restaurant but keep on the older generation who take their jobs for granted and spoil the first few minutes of what will, eventually, be a memorable visit. This might sound like a one off rant, but the same thing happened to us in two other hotels, one a Cinnamon and one a high-end establishment. I think it time Sri-Lankan hotel high-ups took a long hard look at their jaded middle-mangers and put the bright youngsters up-front instead. I'm glad to say that the end of the stay was much better than the start. The location is great for the local sights. As has been said the rooms are a bit tired and perhaps a bit gloomy with small windows, but then again, you don't spend much time in the room, so why worry. All in all, a good value stop.
title: Someone forgot to dust off the welcome mat......

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your lovely review! We are delighted to hear you found our hotel perfectly located for Lion Rock and enjoyed the cottage-style rooms within our pretty grounds. It's also wonderful to know you appreciated the amenities, the lovely big bed, and especially the superb food, including our Sri Lankan selection and the hoppers with spicy curry – a must-try indeed! We're also glad you enjoyed the excellent coffee and the service and prices in our bar.

I sincerely apologize that the battery in your safe was not replaced despite your reminders. This is certainly not up to our standards, and I will follow up on this immediately to ensure such oversights do not happen again.

We also note your feedback regarding the air conditioning and are glad the fan provided sufficient comfort.

Thank you for mentioning Bussanka; we will be sure to recognize his hard work and dedication. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for another enjoyable stay, where we will ensure all aspects of your experience are seamless.

Sincerely,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive-Guest Services
placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed 2 nights on a recent tour ,hotel perfectly located for the Lion Rock . Rooms cottage style in pretty grounds . All amenities in room fine , a lovely big bed , only niggle was the fact we reported our safe battery as flat on arrival but it was never replaced despite reminders.
Air con a bit weak but fan made up for it.
Food in restaurant both at breakfast and dinner was superb , particularly , but not only , the Sri Lankan selection. Do try the hoppers with spicy curry you won’t regret .
There is also excellent coffee at breakfast , a first on tour so far .
Service in the bar is very good  and prices for local gin and vodka extremely reasonable.
We were well served by a trainee called , I think , Bussanka , but all staff work very hard . 
Recommended.
title: Lovely food   Great bar service.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

It was truly a pleasure to welcome you and your family back to Habarana, especially after your honeymoon at Cinnamon Lodge 14 years ago! We are so thrilled that you chose to celebrate the Buddhist New Year festivities with us this time, accompanied by your three children.

We are delighted that you found the Eagle Lodge fantastic and appreciated the extra bed and excellent amenities, including the mosquito netting. It's wonderful to know that you enjoyed the main pool, the badminton by the lake, and the unique experience of being greeted by our local wildlife!

We are also very happy that you found our breakfast and dinner buffets varied and excellent, and that you had a lovely reunion with some of the waiters at Cinnamon Lodge.

A special thank you for mentioning Mr. Thilina and his warmth and hospitality. We will certainly pass on your kind words to him.

It warms our hearts to hear that your children were sad to leave and wished for a longer stay. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming your entire family back to Habarana Village by Cinnamon for another memorable holiday in the future!

Sincerely,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive-Guest Services
placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
We came back to Habarana having spent part of our honeymoon at the sister hotel next door (Cinammon Lodge) 14 years ago, this time accompanied by three children! We arrived to the tune of Buddhist new year festivities in full swing. We were warmly greeted by the manager in person who encouraged me to try some of the outdoor activities and food.
We booked the Eagle Lodge which was fantastic. An extra bed was provided with no fuss. The amenities in the room were excellent with everything being considered including mosquito netting. The rooms were cleaned to an excellent standard. The main pool was fantastic for relaxing in the hot afternoons. We also played some badminton by the lake. 
We were greeted by various animals literally on our doorstep including a monitor, squirrel, monkey and lizard!
The breakfast and dinner buffets were both varied and excellent. We walked round to the Lodge next door for a lovely reunion with some of the waiters from our honeymoon.
I would like to give manager Mr Thilina a special mention for his warmth and hospitality.
Our kids were very sad to leave here after our three nights and wished we could have extended our stay.
All in all this is a beautiful hotel with fantastic staff.
title: Amazing return to Cinnamon Habarana 14 years later

text: A beautiful hotel, huge and sprawling yet balanced in the nature it's located within. Shares grounds with sister hotel Cinnamon Lodge - can easily cross from one to another if walking around the site. Almost like staying in a botanical garden with a great diversity of interesting trees, bird life and of course the lakeside location. Little tree house-like viewing platforms and bridges add to the charm and help enjoy the lake. Staff were great throughout, rooms were spacious and clean. Live music at dinner times, of good quality. The chefs team really took care of our Jain dietary requirements. Could have been more vegan or eggless desserts on offer though - even other Cinnamon hotels had a much bigger eggless range on offer to all. Overall a memorable experience - highly recommended.
title: Fabulous grounds - tranquility in nature

and beyond and made our stay great really helpful and is the definition of customer service .

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently stayed at Cinnamon Habarana Village to celebrate my birthday with family and friends, and it turned out to be an unforgettable experience. We booked three rooms for the occasion, and from the moment we arrived, everything was perfect.

The rooms were exceptionally clean, offering a comfortable and serene environment for relaxation. The property itself is beautiful, with lush surroundings and a peaceful ambiance that made it feel like home. It truly added a special memory to my travel diary, and I couldn't have asked for a better place to unwind.

The support and hospitality from the staff were tremendous. A big thank you to Saranga, Indunil, Wimalaweera, and Dilshan Basnayaka, who made us feel so welcome and ensured that our stay was flawless. They went out of their way to accommodate my needs, especially since I’m pregnant. The restaurant staff was incredibly helpful in arranging meals that were suitable for me, which I truly appreciated.

As someone who has visited many Cinnamon hotels over the years, I can confidently say that Habarana Village has made a lasting impression. The personalized care and attention we received made it an extra special experience. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a relaxing getaway. Thank you again to the entire team at Cinnamon Habarana Village!
title: Unforgettable stay at Cinnamon Habarana Village

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Watch for mosquito bites near the lake.
text: We stayed here for 2 nights on our Sri Lanka tour due to its proximity to Sigiriya Rock. I have given 4 stars as parts of the hotel particularly the pool & rooms, are in need of some renovation and modernisation. Staff friendly and helpful but too quick to remove plates etc at meal times. A nice big lobby/bar area and spacious dining room. Dinner is a buffet for those like us on the half board option and very good also breakfast fine. Wine is very pricey so we stuck to Lion Beer. The hotel adjoins a lake which is scenic but be careful of mosquitoes. Rooms are serviced & cleaned daily, just a bit dated, but provided with the usual amenities such as toiletries, a fridge, a safe and tea coffee etc. Beds not as comfortable as our previous Cinammon hotel (Trinco Blu) as bit hard and mattresses thinner but adequate for our short break and very quiet at night. We had a lovely elephant towel art creation left on our bed :) Overall the rooms were more basic but we didn’t spend much time in them just for sleeping really so suitable for a short break/stopover.
title: Lakeside retreat

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights to see the sights around Sigirya for which this hotel is ideally located. The resort is centred around the main restaurant which overlooks the infinity pool and the lake beyond that. The grounds around the hotel are well maintained and have an abundance of wildlife if you go and look for it, if you go out at sunrise there's a chance you will see the resident Kites fishing for breakfast.

The rooms are clusters of bungalows at the back of the main building which is a little untidy in comparison to the lakeside grounds. Ours was to the rear of the property which was more private to sit out on the patio area whereas some rooms were directly on the main walkway which didn’t offer any privacy at all. The rooms themselves are quite spacious and comfortable with a reasonable size bathroom.

We stayed half board and the food was ok with a choice of both local and western foods, service for drinks isn't great but it did depend on who was serving and where you were sat. During our stay there were quite a few group tours which made the evening meal a little chaotic due to the buffet layout and space.

The village is only a 5 minute walk away (up the drive and turn left) where there are a few shops and cafes. You can only buy alcohol at the ‘wine shop’ which is a little further past the minimarts where you will find beer is a fraction of the price it is at the hotel. If you do use the bar at the hotel be warned that there is additional tax to be paid when checking out which doesn’t appear on the bill you sign at the bar.
title: Nice location

text: We had an incredible time at Palmstone Retreat. The resort is stunning and our suite was beautiful with a private plunge pool. Indunil was exceptional and he took really good care of us throughout our stay. Nothing was too much trouble for him. The food was absolutely delicious. Sameera was great and took us on a lovely waterfall walk. We loved swimming in the natural pool and the children had a fabulous time doing the natural slides and jumps into the rock pools. This stay was one of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka and I highly recommend this resort for a great break in nature.
title: Beautiful resort in the heart of nature. Exceptional stay!

roomTip: Vorher anrufen - die meisten Buchungs-Apps sind nicht ganz korrekt
text: Ein Juwel mitten im Dschungel. Nach 20 Minuten Schotterpiste erreicht man ein 5-Sterne Hotel mit nur 6 wunderschönen Zimmern, einer erstaunlichen Küche, einem rauschenden Fluss, einem großen Pool und wahnsinnig netten 10 Angestellten, die das kleine Anwesen betreiben.
title: Ein winziges 5-Sterne Juwel mitten im Dschungel

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Palmstone was such a treat to discover. We arrived with little knowledge of what to expect and we were pleasantly surprised at each turn. Our room which was plenty spacious and clean, was situated right by the river. We just walked down and got into the stream whenever we felt like it! It was so refreshing to just sit on a rock and let the water wash over us. 
When we returned to our room, the private heated, outdoor plunge pool was just decadent. As if this wasn’t enough, there was even a steam room in the bathroom! 
The room was well sealed so we enjoyed a relatively bug free stay considering we were in a rainforest. 

The staff were very friendly and seemed ever willing to accommodate any of our requests. A special thanks to chef Prabath who went out of his way to feed us what we’d like, to Indunil for his attentive service and Sameera for guiding us on the most amazing waterfall trek/swim. It was relatively sunny while we were there so thankfully we had no leech issues. I found the trek challenging enough to be enjoyable yet easy enough for my 5yr old. The waterfall and the large natural pool to swim in was sublime. Sameera carried life jackets for us so we could enjoy a super safe swim. 

Palmstone was truly a rare find and great value for money.
title: A rare find

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Very beautiful small retreat. Great luxury rooms with very nice views directly into the jungle. The service at the retreat was extremely giod. The hotel also arranged a trip to a nice waterfall, led by Sameer, an employee at the hotel.
You drive 6km up a winding mountain road to get the this gem. And it is worth it!
title: A gem in the jungle

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
A boutique hotel located inside Kitulgala rainforest area bordering a beautiful waterfall and water stream. Amazing property. You need a vehicle with ground clearance to go there. You will pass some breath taking scenarios on the way to the hotel. When you are in the hotel the view is even better. 

We were there for two nights in room #2. It had a heated pool and a sauna. Spacious room with adequate space to facilitate two extra beds. The heated pool was a huge plus point in this cold environment. 

The key highlight is the amazing staff who work there. All of them were very supportive and attentive. Superb chef and his food was delicious. We loved all the meals he prepared. Sri Lanka, Italian, Arabic everything was perfect. Indunil, who took care of us at the restaurant was also very helpful. Thanks to everyone who made our stay memorable. (front desk, manager, support staff) 

They organized a hike to belilena cave. Buddhika was our guide and he was really helpful. Especially to my little ones. Unfortunately we couldn't do the waterfall hike because of the rain. 

We highly recommend this hotel. Food, staff and location were among the best we have been in SL. Just note the climate, it's raining most of the time. So be prepared to enjoy the rain. Also leeches everywhere. Ask for a spray from hotel staff.
title: Good food, scenic location inside the jungle

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Service by the staff was amazing and best.
And then when it comes to food it’s super tasty 😋. I had Sri Lankan spicy dishes and my wife had some western dishes.So the food was great and then when it comes to nature and whether I no need to write a comment , I will drop a pic and the travel was adventurous.I traveled from CMB to Kithulgala and then from kithulgala we had to travel inside a mini forest . Never had gone a trip like this ,because we were excited to see more what is there.
Room is super amazing, we got a room opposite to the down path of waterfall so the sound of it was mind relaxing .
title: Nature is amazing

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are driving, recommend an SUV or a vehicle with a higher ground clearance. Or call the concierge to arrange a shuttle service.
text: From the location to the service to food to the comfiest rooms, this was hands down the best experience we had. The drive to the hotel was lovely with the nature surrounding the roads. Recommend taking a vehicle with a higher ground clearance or contact the concierge to arrange a shuttle to take you there. Welcome was warm and nice. Rooms were very clean, spacious and cozy. Our suite had a heated plunge as well as a steam room! Rooms overlook the rainforest and when it rains, you just wants to relax inside! Managed to visit the waterfall nearby guided by a friendly staff member. Food was very well curated and served right on time. I would give 10 out of 10 when it comes to taste, presentation and portion! Staff was 100% attentive and looked into our wants & needs. They were very friendly and went out of their way to arrange a birthday cake for us to surprise one of our friends celebrating his birthday with us. They also cleaned our room, changed the linen while we were at the waterfall tour (of course with our permission) Unfortunately I couldn't get the names of the boys who served us from start to finish but we will definitely see them soon. Overall experience is 10 out of 10. Highly recommended.
title: One of the best Hotel Experiences so far! Relaxing, Unique and Welcoming!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka

text:
Absolutely best hotel to stay in escaping the whole world. 
This amazing spot in a middle of a giant jungle is the place to capture adventures and new experiences.

The warm welcoming by the accommodating staff is worth to be mentioned and made this journey the best.

Thank you for making our trip the best

roomTip: Do the guides walks !!!
text:
Absolutely incredible place! This is a wonderful oasis hidden in the jungle. The place offers an amazing pool in the jungle, next to the restaurant. The rooms are possibly the best rooms I have ever stayed in. Each rooms is located by the river with full height windows looking into the rains forest and river. Each room has their own special treats, one room an indoor jacuzzi and outside side bed, the other a steam room and outside hot tub. We stayed with our kids and had a whole chalet - with interconnection rooms if you want !!!’
The staff are so accommodating - both in the restaurant and for the walks. Sameera was our guide for the walks. He was so helpful with the kids and helped them to make jumps and rocks slides down the river in a very safe manner. Do not miss this!
title: Jungle gem - do not miss !!!

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 2 nights with my family here after arrival and it was a very good choice to start the trip to Sri Lanka. There is such a beautiful nature here, a peaceful atmosphere that all the problems of everyday life and work had been forgotten the very next morning...
The rooms are large, perfectly clean with a great bathroom. the view through the window is simply unbeatable. Hotel staff can also arrange activities for more active people - hiking in the surrounding area. The staff is very, very kind, responsive. 
The best emotions about this place remained in my memory
title: Complete escape in nature
